Reviews.Title: “Great location, clean room, but that's about it”
Reviews.Author: Salman_QLD
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the hotel after a long flight and were given access to our room early. Our room was on the 12th floor and had a great view of Union Square. The room was on the larger side with plenty of room for two suitcases. The bathroom is also quite large and has recently been updated. The room was clean, however, I did find a hair on one pillow. The location is perfect for the shopping and dining options in Union Square. The doorman/bellman (the morning shift) was the best employee we encountered at this hotel. He was conversational without being annoying and got everyone on their way quickly and efficiently. Unfortunately, that's the end of the good points about this hotel. The front office staff were rude on our checkout. We asked for some further information about their conference facilities and we instructed to look it up ourselves online. What, you can't give the slightest bit of information verbally? The room service was not up to scratch. The first night they forgot the OJ (but still charged me) and the second night they forgot the cheese on the burger! The wifi (that you have to pay for) is very slow. I could only pick up two bars in my room and it would constantly drop out. Not very good for a business hotel. Lastly, they charged my credit card without my authorization a day before I checked out. I wanted to discuss the Internet charges considering I couldn't get a signal half the time and shouldn't have to pay but I didn't get the chance since they already charged me. Not cool.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location; great views!”
Reviews.Author: snod73
Reviews.Content: We stayed here last weekend. We thoroughly enjoyed our stay. The hotel is located very centrally. Shopping / Dining / Transit ...everything very close. We had great views from our room on the 30th floor. Only some rooms will have the view of the Golden gate bridge (we did not). However, many rooms on the higher floors will definitely have amazing views! We ate breakfast at Grandviews restaurant every day of our stay. We totally enjoyed the banana pancakes!! More than the pancakes...was the view from the restaurant....literally 360 degree view of the entire area!! We got great pictures!! On our departure day, we had a small misunderstanding about breakfast. But, the front desk staff went above and beyond and made sure we got our breakfast (since we had an early flight). The restaurant manager was already organized with what we wanted to eat. There was just a little miscommunication. We were happy it was sorted out quickly. We noticed a lot of families with kids (all ages) staying in this hotel. Also, we had one night where there was a noise problem from the next door room. This was solved by hotel security within ten minutes after calling the front desk. OVerall ..highly recommend this hotel if it is in your budget! I suggest getting the breakfast package. You will not regret it!!

Reviews.Title: “Can't wait to come back!”
Reviews.Author: sneaknsmiles
Reviews.Content: Take a peek on Hyatt's website for their Hyatt Free Time Special. Stay 2 nights and get one free with daily breakfast for two. It's a deal that can't be beat and i know! (i booked on expedia for a different property only to cancel for the Hyatt through Hotel Planner only to cancel AGAIN for a better deal direct through the Hyatt website) Just returned from a 3 night stay at the Grand Hyatt. My boyfriend and I arrived at OAK and took the BART to the Powell Street station. The walk to the Grand Hyatt was a bit confusing for a SF first-timer due to the construction on the roads & Powell St station. Once we arrived, check-in was a breeze. The construction in the lobby area was unnoticeable. We were able to check-in early at around 2pm and were given a room on the 14th floor. The view wasn't great..but a room is a room and we were only there to sleep. Room Pros: - decor is lovely - modern, bright spacious room - sun blocking blinds - hdmi capabilities on the TV - reading lights that were adjustable on both sides of the beds in addition to the normal bedside table lamps - real fridge (instead of the mini bar ones that keep things cool but not cold) for our leftovers & drinks - magnifying mirror (i packed my own but this one was great!) i was tempted to ask where i could get one for home! - massive sink (i mean 3x the size of a standard bathroom) - glass table top in the bathroom (perfect for placing your hot hair tools without wrecking the counters) -4+ elevators (the wait was never long) Room Cons: - lack of drawer space in the closet (3 tiny tiny drawers) - not enough places to put your towels, there were a couple of hooks for your bath towels but no where to put your face/hand towels Breakfast was held daily in their restaurant on the 36th floor. The view is to die for! Picturesque view of Coit Tower and the city. Try to go for breakfast early to guarantee one of the window views! I really enjoyed the options for breakfast: Full Breakfast Buffet or order off the menu (Most hotels only offer a breakfast buffet). The buffet had a wide variety of options and you were also able to order hot pancakes or waffles if you wanted them. Service was professional and friendly. One thing i have to comment on is that there were always staff readily available to assist you. You never had to look around for help. And thank you to the Concierge that stayed open a little longer than normal to arrange our shuttle service to the airport. The hotel also offers complimentary boarding pass print outs through the computers in the front desk area. Thanks for the wonderful stay! I will definitely think of the Grand Hyatt for future visits to San Francisco!

Reviews.Title: “Love this hotel”
Reviews.Author: Spiceydig
Reviews.Content: Great location, union square!!! Walking distance to all of the downtown sites like chinatown, market st and ect. The hotel is updated, clean and great service. My first choice for San Francisco!!!

Reviews.Title: “OK, but staff is often on strike and is rude”
Reviews.Author: Al B
Reviews.Content: Great location, and the rooms are generally clean. During my last three stays however the staff were on strike. This was unpleasant, and there were demonstrations, leaflets left in the room, and the service was much delayed. Generally the staff is rather rude. On one occasion the porter smashed my luggage (most likely an accident), breaking a toy a bought for my son. This was annoying, as I have just checked out and was heading to the airport. When you call on the phone them many times they just hang up :( The aircon is very loud, and you can smell cigaret smoke many times :( Otherwise, it is an OK hotel. I really like its location.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel with only a few minor flaws”
Reviews.Author: jryder888
Reviews.Content: We are a family of 5 and stayed for 3 nights in April in interconnecting rooms. Overall the hotel was great. The staff were friendly and attentive, the rooms were good and the beds comfortable. There were a number of things that could have been done better, which I have described below but, if you don't have time to read the rest, our overall summary is that this is a good hotel in a great location. Having booked online a month in advance, with a confirmed reservation for rooms on the 20th floor or above, we didn't get off to a very good start on arrival. We were told that the only interconnecting rooms were on the 4th floor. In the rooms we found ourselves staring at the windows of the building opposite and decided to complain. The staff then 'discovered' they had interconnecting rooms on the 19th floor, not quite what we had booked, but a great view of Union Square. There are extensive overnight roadworks going on in Union Square at present, and the thin glazing on the windows allowed this work, and the traffic noise, to become quite intrusive, although we soon adjusted. The rooms are newly refurbished, and although the furniture and decorations are not lavish, they are smart, neat and largely functional. Little things could be improved, like the fact that the room is provided with an ice bucket, ice tongs, a bottle opener, but no glasses! The kids were upset that their tastes were not catered for in the choice of TV channels delievered free to the room but again, these are minor complaints. If you have a car, use the assisted parking at the garage across the street to save yourself valet charges. The restaurant on the 36th floor has fantastic views, the food is very good, and the waiting staff are friendly and helpful. We had a small problem with an undercooked dish, but were given a complimentary desert, which was very generous. We would stay at this hotel again and thoroughly enjoyed our visit.

Reviews.Title: “I left my heart in San Francisco”
Reviews.Author: SanDiegoTravelingman
Reviews.Content: If you want to experience everything that this city has to offer, there is no better hotel to stay at. The service is impeccable, the rates are great, and the views from the top floor bar are to die for.

Reviews.Title: “Great Rooms and Service - a little noisy”
Reviews.Author: nolazona
Reviews.Content: Stayed 3 nights for work. Staff could not have been nicer or more helpful. (ex - called to get # for aiport shuttle - they offered to book it for me). My room was nice and bed was comfortable. Nice touch was little reading lights hooked to side of the bed - this was great since I spent most of my trip reading documents in my room (try to contain your jealousy over my exciting trip). My only complaint is same as a couple others - the lobby is currently under construction and it is NOISY! I was only on the 7th floor - may get better as you go up. But the construction started early and went on pretty late. Also, I am guessing due to construction there weren't any real quiet places to meet and talk with co-workers which would have been nice. That said - this was one of my better stays in SF. Also - although it is pretty pricey - the view from the restaurant/bar at the top is spectacular. Treat yourself to a cocktail at a table by the window.

Reviews.Title: “Very enjoyable stay... definitely would recommend”
Reviews.Author: skidamarink
Reviews.Content: We stayed there for a total of 3 nights and had a really enjoyable stay. The lobby was being renovated so there's not much seating place or anything really to look at. The rooms however were really well kept and clean, which is definitely more than I could say for some hotels we've stayed at recently. The pros: 1. Room is clean and newly decorated. 2. Location is very centralized, easy to get around Union Square area by foot. 3. Staff is very helpful and courteous. From the front desk, bell, valet, room service. 4. Starbucks right across the street and walgreens a block away. Easy to get to by foot for water, snacks, etc. 5. Mini fridge in the hotel room... very nice. The cons: 1. There's no lock on the bathroom door! What's up with that? 2. There's only 1 way to get to this hotel by car... make sure you learn the map of the area or you'll be doing run arounds like we did the first couple of times. 3. Parking is not cheap... then again what do you expect in SF Union Sq area. I definitely would stay here again no qualms about it.

Reviews.Title: “What are they thinking? Under Construction”
Reviews.Author: TomK_Chicago
Reviews.Content: Overall, the hotel was very good. Clean, comfy beds. What got to me was that the lobby is being remodeled and the rennovations can be quite loud. So the guy at the front desk puts me in a room on the third floor, so I can get as close to the construction noise as possible. I truly wondered what I did to offend him.. It's nice that they make noise only from 9 to 5 during the rennovation. Too bad I was in the room trying to work from 9 to 12 noon. I couldn't hear myself think. They have a very nice restaurant on the top floor. Very nice view of the city. Other than the construction, it's not a bad hotel.

Reviews.Title: “awesome”
Reviews.Author: FHL3
Reviews.Content: Great service, superb rooms, great food, awesome environment. Location the best in the world. Try the 32nd floor club room with the greatest view of the Bay and that's it. Beat stress , stay in this hotel for your San Francisco vacation. Everything within reach and food and shopping is as easy as 123...Unbeatable experience. The staff is one of the best I've experienced travelling all over the world.

Reviews.Title: “Superb location, minor flaws”
Reviews.Author: Vlado24
Reviews.Content: Stayed in March 2012 for 1 night while on a business trip. The location, just off Union Square and the high-end shopping streets -- is unbeatable. The rooms are spacious and have just been renovated, which is great. The lobby was still being renovated and felt cramped, especially when many guests were checking in/out at the same time. Superb views towards the Bay and Alcatraz from the bar on the top floor, excellent cocktails. My room was on the 14 floor overlooking the street, so I could hear street noise well into the late hours. Ask for a room on an even higher floor, perhaps with a view to the square or the bay,

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant, excellent location”
Reviews.Author: omegami
Reviews.Content: This Grand Hyatt has an excellent location with easy walking distance to cable cars, BART station, all kinds of bus stops. The top floor restaurant has a breathtaking view of SF. We didn't drive, but I imagine driving from/to this hotel would be challenging with all the traffic. Rooms are tastefully appointed, clean and comfortable, after all it is a Hyatt. Really close to shops. Suitable for people who don't mind walking a little and use public transportation.

Reviews.Title: “Great views and good location”
Reviews.Author: anapaulapinheiro
Reviews.Content: Good hotel, great location in the commercial area of san franscicos. Nice bar at the top with great views, express check in.

Reviews.Title: “Unfriendly people”
Reviews.Author: Peter_DC
Reviews.Content: Very unfriendly check in, waiters in the breakfast etc..espresso machine in the restaurants was out of order during my complete stay. Rooms are clean but windows are tin, so you can hear the city vibes rigth up to you room. They claim to had renovated the place but it was done very poor. Internet is charged and mega slow. I stayed at le meridien last time and will probably go back to that one.

Reviews.Title: “Great Union Square Location”
Reviews.Author: mb123456
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 4 nights last September for a conference. Fantastic location with decent room service food. The views from some of the rooms are superb. They had a union strike going on while we were there which was really annoying and loud, but the staff went out of their way to make up for the distractions and this was most appreciated. They moved us to a higher floor to get us away from the noise. They did their best to shield guests getting in and out of the door from the protestors. i would certainly stay here again for business or pleasure.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: lookingglass101
Reviews.Content: This is my second visit to the Grand Hyatt. Pros: Friendly Staff Nice, clean, spacious rooms Nice view of the city from the bar on the top floor Nice sized gym Good Location Cons: Not much, some of my colleagues compalined of street noise at night, but I had a high floor room and had no issues. Overall I would recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “great new rooms”
Reviews.Author: stephen g
Reviews.Content: stayed here again. newley rennovated rooms. very stylish with a modern look. great bathroom too and a great view of the financial area from our room. exceptional bed, so comfy. great cocktail lounge on the 36th floor with wonderful views. excellent breakfast too. when leaving ratherthan a taxi, gave us a town car at the same price to the airport.

Reviews.Title: “Great City Amazing Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Amazin1
Reviews.Content: This Hotel is amazing great location very close to most of San Francisco attractions Staff was really great had a room on a high floor and had a room facing the bay and Alcatraz Island we would defiantly be staying here again

Reviews.Title: “Great location in center of city!”
Reviews.Author: rapahoo5
Reviews.Content: This Hyatt is located in a great central location in a city where there is so much to see and do. Catching a bus or the BART is as simple as walking a couple blocks, restaurants are plentiful for a close place to eat and the hotel itself is very accommodating and clean.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad, but mildly disappointing . . .”
Reviews.Author: TwoWire
Reviews.Content: First time to stay at this property, and I probably would return. However, there are a few things about the property that struck me as odd. First, there is no convenience store in the hotel, or even a little shop off the lobby that so many hotels are moving to. I had to go up to the restaurant and get them to make something for me for breakfast, to take back down to my room after a workout. The lobby itself is completely underwhelming and cramped. A Hyatt Place lobby blows it out of the water. The room, recently renovated, was very nice and comfortable, although I could not figure out how to turn the corner floor lamp on. Finally (and this is a growing pet peeve, albeit a First World problem), an HDTV looks pretty ridiculous when there are no digital signals from which to choose.

Reviews.Title: “Newly renovated”
Reviews.Author: daikin
Reviews.Content: Staying on the 32nd floor in a newly renovated room with laminated hardwood floors. Generally clean and comfy but the water pressure for the shower is on the low side. Friendly check-in staff. Lobby is currently under renovation. Good location in SF.

Reviews.Title: “Grand in name but not the Grand we expected ...”
Reviews.Author: Dime26
Reviews.Content: Perhaps we have been spoilt as having always stayed in Grand Hyatts, primarily on Far East holidays, our expectations were very high, only to be rather disappointed. The stay was perfectly adequate - we stayed 6 nights. The plus points: convenient location off Union Square, rooms had nice decor, beds very comfortable, top floor restaurant has fabulous views and food was fine. The negatives: lobby is dull and front desk check-in experience was disappointing - served by a gentleman (rather unfriendly)... I asked if we could have a higher floor with a view if possible - he replied yes, nice room and good view. We ended up on the 12th floor with no view onto the back of a couple of buildings and some industrial centre roof. Woken at 4am each morning to some form of lorries unloading which we assumed took place underneath the industrial roof we could see below us - this only lasted about 30 mins each morning. Whilst in-room cleaning was fine with friendly, pleasant maids, glasses/trays were left outside various rooms on the 12th floor and we were astonished to see a couple of particular trays left for 3 days whilst we stayed which had food on! Very poor for this type of establishment. Grand view restaurant where we had the breakfast buffet each morning had beautiful views - staff were generally very pleasant and accommodating. Food was generally of a good standard, albeit, the hot buffet items did tend to be on the "lukewarm" side, so by the time back to your table, items often cold. Furniture items in bar/lounge area adjacent to restaurant were generally very tired and could do with a facelift. Check-out : front desk tried to charge us for 6 nights accommodation (which had already been pre-paid through Virgin holidays) - this was quickly rectified once I complained. Hence, our average rating ... admittedly, we did not complain to anyone about any of the issues we encountered ... provided our room was clean with comfortable beds, we were often not in the hotel long enough to worry about things as we were out enjoying the fantastic city of San Francisco.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely quiet Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Andrea E
Reviews.Content: Enjoyed our stay at Grand Hyatt Union Square, beds were very comfortable, staff helpful and despite hotel being busy with guests it was very quiet in the rooms. We faced the back of the hotel but had a great view over the city. Location was especially good, right in the heart of things in Union Square and shopping district, easy to get tours and close to cafe's. Would recommend Louis's Diner for breakfast, just around the corner from the hotel. Cheesecake Factory was great for meals too located at top of Macy's building 5mins walk away. Skybar in Hotel really nice and great cocktails in evening with lovely staff. Only a few minutes to cable car turnaround on Powell Street which takes you straight to Fisherman's Wharf. Alot of homeless in San Francisco but none of them were intrusive or dangerous and felt safe entire time we were there despite venturing out and walking around city alot. Would definitely stay at Grand Hyatt again they clearly conform to a high standard.

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location Location!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Kelly M
Reviews.Content: Trip advisor does it again this hotel was a good choice because it is close to everything I thoroughly enjoyed my stay the only downside room was small. But that's how things are in San Francisco but they do maximize the use of space.

Reviews.Title: “Terrific stay.”
Reviews.Author: discodogman
Reviews.Content: We were pleasantly surprised by this place. The new decor is very nice, and the room (especially the bed) was very comfortable. The location couldn't have been more ideal. If you stay be sure to visit the restaurant and bar on the top floor for an unprecidented view of the city and harbour.

Reviews.Title: “wonderful”
Reviews.Author: Alexandra R
Reviews.Content: Wonderful and beautiful hotel we go there every year because my mom grew up there. We look forward to going there every year. It is in a very great location it is right by union square.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Stay”
Reviews.Author: nalu
Reviews.Content: The positives: 1. Rooms are modern, clean, beautiful; beds lovely. 2. Views are wonderful (we were on 31st floor). 3. Concierge was extremely helpful with rental car, planning trips, etc. 4. Regency Club was AMAZING. I miss it already! (huge high-quality food selection, super clean, lots of space & areas to sit, very friendly & professional Regency Club staff). 5. As usual, the ventilation for the rooms was fantastic (typical Hyatt). 6. Perfect Location! Negatives: 1. Rooms a little on the small side Thank you Hyatt! You made our stay in San Francisco wonderful!

Reviews.Title: “Great location and service”
Reviews.Author: Bernardosw
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for a whole week. It is very well located within short distance to the Cable Car stop, Union Square and Moscone Center. Rooms were impeccable - very well decorated, excellent beds and with a nice working desk. Bathroom amenities were also very nice. My wife accidentally dropped her earing in the sink and we were able to get the engineering team in the room at midnight to open the sink's piping and recover it! Great service! Be sure to visit the restaurant for a great view of San Francisco skyline.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, hotel, food and service”
Reviews.Author: PortNo_California
Reviews.Content: We had not stayed here for a number of years. The hotel has just gone through a renovations. Our room was clean with a great view. All new items in the guest rooms and very comfortable beds. Had dinner first night in Grand View Restaurant on 36th floor. It was fantastic and Frank our waiter was wonderful as well as the Assistant Restaurant Manager. All the staff we encountered were extremely friendly and had a genuine desire to help you. Stay here you cannot go wrong.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, Comfortable room and incredible view”
Reviews.Author: Catsmama
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Grand Hyatt in the last week of March for 2 nights. First of all, the location was the most convenient! There is BURT, Muni bus station right down the street. We could go anywhere in the town of San Francisco from here. There are many shops around the hotel. My sister and my mom are from Japan (I live in Ohio) and they wanted to go specific brand name store. We could walk most of the stores and department stores from the hotel. We could go to China town to have some dim-sum (Yum!) The hotel room had a modern interior. Very clean. The beds were very comfortable. We stayed at 31st floor. The city view was incredible. I am glad we stayed at Grand Hyatt!

Reviews.Title: “@ the heart of San Francisco”
Reviews.Author: LuisGVA
Reviews.Content: Grand Hyatt is @ the heart of San Francisco (Union Square). Very close to everything: shoppings, cable car which brings you Fisherman's Wharf, China town, etc... Service is excellent and staff very professional. Concierge services were great. There is a very nice view from the 36th floor where you can have breakfast, drinks & food. Very comfortable. I had a very good time while my stay despite a noisy night from my neighbors once next room. You have the sightseeing buses stop in front of the hotel in Union Square.

Reviews.Title: “Newly remodeled hotel in the heart of downtown SF”
Reviews.Author: Andrew H
Reviews.Content: My room is practically brand new - the whole hotel has been re-done - except the lobby which is not finished yet - no signs of construction however as the lobby has been re-configured during construction. Room was great - location great - nice bathroom sink etc - great all around.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and Comfy Rooms”
Reviews.Author: UtahFamilytraveler
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights with several other couples and all of us had a great experience. First off I have learned that travel websites aren't the cheapest route to go...we booked directly through the Hyatt and ended up changing our reservations 4 times because we kept finding better deals directly through them. That may aggravate some people but I check that kind of stuff all the time so I love it that you don't get penalized for making changes. Anyway, we went from $229 a night, down to $170 a night, then to a special where it was $209 a night but if you stayed 3 nights you got the third night free, plus breakfast for 2 each morning. So in the end we felt like we got a great deal. The hotel is right at Union Square, easy walk to trolley and BART. Nice location for shopping and dining. The rooms are accurately represented in posted photos. Not super huge but very chic and inviting. The bed was very comfy, there was a small fridge, coffee maker, bathroom well appointed and modern. No complaints at all. Maid service was very prompt in the mornings, we ate breakfast at the hotel restaurant every morning and it was wonderful. Servers and everyone we encountered were very friendly and helpful. In general San Francisco is a VERY NOISY place and I was woke up several times by trolley bells ringing but I didn't feel that was something the hotel could control. The lobby is currently being renovated but that didn't impact anything we did. Actually didn't hear any noise coming from there. I would stay here again and would definately recommend it to others.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, great personal service!”
Reviews.Author: steve c
Reviews.Content: Stayed here in March 2012 to attend a conference at the Moscone Center (convention center). The location is great. One block off of Union Square, and a 10 minute walk from the Moscone center. The rooms are spacious and modern, with beautiful views. Bedding was very comfortable. Good bathrooms. Tub with shower had decent water pressure. I had a room on the 20th floor. Room was right off of the corridor from the elevators, and I never heard a peep from the hallway. Occasionally heard the people in the adjacent room, but nothing out of the ordinary. Fitness center on 35th floor was spacious, with ellipticals, treadmills, stationary bikes, freeweights, plenty of machines, and a separate space for floorwork. Technology in room was acceptable, but if you're a technophile, you might be a little disappointed. 42" LCD TV and great channel selection, but no hi-def selections. HDMI and audio ports for easy connection of laptops or ipods to the tv. Alarm clock with ipod and 3.5 mm connectors. I paid for the premium internet service for the week. Had both wifi and ethernet connections in room, and a passcode to connect a mobile device. Speeds were good for browsing and email, but a bit slow for VPN connections. The reason I will be coming back to this hotel is because of the personal service. Reception staff was friendly and efficient. I checked in early (~1:30 pm, before the check-in time) on a Saturday afternoon, along with about 10 other people, and the staff moved us through. The bell staff has a great presence, always available to answer questions. The crown jewel of this place is the doorman, Michael. It rained the entire week that I was there, so he was the busiest man in San Francisco. Everyone who would normally be walking to the Moscone center was trying to catch a taxi, and he and his staff took care of each and every one of us, while also taking exquisite care of arriving guests, and people checking out. Overall, this is a good San Francisco hotel in a great location with an excellent staff. I'll be back in May for Bay to Breakers, and I'll be staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Not as nice as you'd expect”
Reviews.Author: sydneyberlin
Reviews.Content: Stayed in one of the removed rooms on a pretty high floor. Still had a strange "refurbed rather than new" feel to it, maybe that's because it's such an eyesore from the outside which is a trait it shares with most Downtown Hotels in San Francisco, unfortunately. I personally didn't like the design of the room at all but that's a matter of taste. They went for a strange 70ies vintage style decor with lots of orange and stuff like it which reminds me of my parents' taste when I was a very young kid. Not my thing really and makes you wonder how people will feel about this in 5 or 10 years time... Worst grief for me was the staff, the check in area hasn't been renovated yet so you are greeted in one of those dimly lit, dark wooded lobbies from the 60ies. Right went I arrived, there were about 5 huge Latin families with their badly behaved screaming kids all over which was a nightmare but unfortunately, my check in lady also was not very friendly, disengaged and rather quick to get you out and done with. Room itself, as said, was quite nice depending on whether you like 70ies vintage or not. They had those strange snake-like reading lamps sticking out of the wall besides the bed which you used to have in old business class airplane seats-I hate those things, feels like some creepy alien coming out of your bed head but maybe that's meant to be part f the vintage style, who knows. Very vintage but absolutely not acceptable were the shower curtains. Shower curtains in a freshly renovated hotel- need I say more? Cummon, Hyatt, you can do better- they are yuck! Speaking about vintage... Obviously their wifi has also not made it to 2012 yet. The website claims high-speed Wifi and when you log in to accept the 10 Dollar charge a day (!!!), they tell you some blurb about extra bandwidth and so on. But the reality is: It is s-l-o-w. So slow that it drops out all the time and you need ten minutes alone to log onto your emails. I was close to throwing my IPad against the wall in anger, so bad and frustrating it was! Now, after all that, luckily my lady at check out made up for a lot of the negatives: Very unlike the check in lady, she wad friendly, helpful and pleasant. Took the Wifi charges off my bill instantly and was very apologetic. Apparently, people complain about this all the time and the hotel is investigating their options. We had a long chat about it and she told me that the Wifi antennas are located in the elevator shafts only (which explains why you get the best reception on the elevators) which she already knew was not ideal. Without her, the experience would have been really bad (for example, during my entire two-day stay, not a sinlge time one of the people at the door or any other staff would great me or, more even, open the door or something like they do at many other properties of this class)- like this, I would say it was mediocre.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Erik S
Reviews.Content: My wife and I had the pleasure of staying at the Grand Hyatt for our 5th anniversary. Now I am not a big fan of San Francisco, but I must say that our experience with the hotel and the location was superb! The rooms, service, and location were wonderful. I enjoyed talking to the staff and they suggested several places for dinner to celebrate the special occasion. The only complaint I have is the wireless internet (wi-fi) which you have to pay for. You would think it would be included with the rate of the room, although we did get a great deal on the price. All in all, we had a terrific time!

Reviews.Title: “Great stay with very slow hotel wi-fi..”
Reviews.Author: odanilina
Reviews.Content: Staying in Grand Hyatt for business 2nd year in a row. Renovated rooms are just great, as well as the service and location of the hotel. The only complain is regarding hotel wi-fi. It's an absolute disaster. Even though you normally have to pay for it (except the conference packages where it's already included), it just doesn't worth any money at all - I would even say that Hyatt has to pay those guests who preferred their Internet as the stress is guaranteed. Me and my colleagues had to go to the Starbucks across the street or to some Hyatt public area where we could still catch Starbucks' wi-fi. How crazy is that considering the fact you paid for the opportunity to work/surf from your room?.. Guys, do something with it - it's a total shame.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel in great area”
Reviews.Author: debofCT
Reviews.Content: My husband and I have stayed at the Grand Hyatt in SF twice and like the recently renovated accommodations. It is right in the shopping area and there are so many restaurants to choose from. We are walkers and sometimes we take the hilly route over to Fisherman's Wharf, but we can avoid the steep climb and take a flat route along the Embarcadero. We enjoy sipping our martinis with the spectacular view in the restaurant.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Stay!”
Reviews.Author: caitlin r
Reviews.Content: Had a fantastic stay at the Grand Hyatt in San Francisco. The location is excellent, the room rates are fairly reasonable and the room with a view was just absolutely breathtaking. Staff was helpful. Felt very at home.

Reviews.Title: “4++”
Reviews.Author: gat0rm0m
Reviews.Content: Attended course held at Grand Hyatt. Rooms were handsome and well-planned (with lots of guest friendly details) . Beds and pillows were very comfortable. Restaurant had wonderful view. Food was good. Location was great for shopping and site-seeing. Staff was very professional and courteous. Concierge was very helpful. Thoroughly enjoyed stay. Starbucks across the street is added bonus. Some ongoing construction in lobby.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and Views”
Reviews.Author: MarkSandieg0
Reviews.Content: I spent 3 days at the Grand Hyatt during a recent business trip to San Francisco. The rooms at the hotel were very modern and luxurious - and the bathrooms were appointed with high-end fixtures, tiles and lighting. The view from my room was spectacular with the ability to see the bay, Transamerica pyramid building and the downtown financial district. It really gave you a sense of being in 'the city'. The lobby in the hotel is pretty small and not somewhere that you can hang out, have a coffee and chat with business partners. While the 36th floor does have a bar area, it's a little more formal than just a place where you can sit in a comfy sofa and connect with colleagues. However, the views from the 36th floor are spectacular - and the service was very good. The gym at the hotel has quite a bit of good equipment (4-5 treadmills, 4-5 eliptical machines and 4 recumbant bikes - plus a variety of exercise machines for arms/legs/etc.). If you want to use the cardio equipment, you need to get to the gym around 5:30AM or you'll wait in line or simply need to use the other equipment. It's a big hotel - and there are lots of people who want to work out. Staff at the hotel was very friendly - and the hotel is in a PERFECT spot to walk to many of the parts of SFO that you'd want to visit for shopping, sights and meals. I would recommend this hotel and would stay there again on future trips.

Reviews.Title: “Great Product and Location - OK Service - Bad systems....”
Reviews.Author: foodiehotelguy
Reviews.Content: So we stayed here for one week. I don't have much time to write everything in much detail, so I would rather list in bullet points: - The rooms are newly renovated and very nice and contemporary - The lobby is small and the public space and restaurant on 36th floor are still old and dated - We used our Diamond upgrade for a suite, upon check in and arrival to our room, got an "accessible roll in shower" room - not what we wanted. The bellman kindly called the front desk, and the agent had the nerve to tell us that ALL suites were like the one we were in - really? - So the bellman, knowing I was upset, called Chris the manager, who was more than kind and accomodating - We got a regular suite which was nice until we went to take showers in BOTH bathrooms. The tubs were stopped up and within minutes of shower - we had 3 inches of water accumlated - It took 3 trips from maintenance to fix the problem - The next day - the ondemand movie system didn't work - The internet was intermittent and slow - We went to run at 7am up in the gym, surprised to find only 3 treadmills!!! All used - how can a hotel this big only have 3 treadmills! So, the location is great - the rooms look really great and bed was amazingly comfortable - but the systems in general were just not operable enough to provide a "worry-free" stay.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: IKE48
Reviews.Content: Held our Western leadership meetings at this property. Great experience. Workout facilities were nice. Make sure you get there early...no later than 5:30 am to get equipment.

Reviews.Title: “In the middle of everything! Very convenient!”
Reviews.Author: NaniSantaF
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for four nights and it is conveniently located right at one corner of Union Square, a great place to stay when in San Francisco! Nice stores and restaurants can be found all around. Market St is just a short walk, as well as the stop to get the cable car to Fisherman´s Wharf. If you are traveling by car, there´s a parking lot nearby (don´t worry - hotel staff do all the job for you...). Although a bit "business-y", the rooms are modern and relatively spacious. Breakfast (very good, by the way...) is served on top floor, with an amazing view of the Golden Gate!

Reviews.Title: “gk160@aol.com”
Reviews.Author: Windy327
Reviews.Content: While I have lived in the Bay Area in the past, this was my first stay in the city. It is conveniently located to shopping and transportation and we found that it was also quiet. The views from the restaurant on the 36th floor were amazing and we thoroughly enjoyed the breakfast buffet while enjoying the scenery. The staff was very friendly and helpful but never pushy. The room was beautifully decorated and our room on the 16th floor had a wonderful view overlooking Union Square and beyond. The beds were comfortable and had handy reading lights. We all enjoyed the push button controlled window shade. Valet parking also was efficient and easy and getting to the main thoroughfares from this location was a breeze. I would happily stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel in San Francisco”
Reviews.Author: tkhong1989
Reviews.Content: I have spent time in many hotels in downtown San Francisco. For the last two trips I have stayed at the Grand Hyatt and it has become my favorite hotel in the area. The rooms are great--I like the design and they have several design touches that make the rooms very nice to stay in--things like reading lights, TVs with adjustable viewing angles and extensions, iphone charging through the clock radios, and interesting designs in the bathrooms. I do wish that the TV stations were in HD--they TVs are HD but the broadcasts are not updated yet... Looking forward to many more stays in the future at the Grand Hyatt.

Reviews.Title: “Highly Recommended”
Reviews.Author: ddrobbs
Reviews.Content: I never write reviews but have always depended on them so I figured I would write one to help others. I read a lot of reviews and agree with them all. The staff was very friendly and the hotel itself was nice. They had staff to open the doors for you and check in was very simple while everyone was very willing to help. The rooms are very well kept and had a modern contemporary decor. The hotel on the 36th floor was nice and we enjoyed our stay...I would defiantly recommend this hotel to anyone visiting San Francisco

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommended”
Reviews.Author: Ezria
Reviews.Content: We loved it here! The room is modern, with a panoramic view of the city and the San Francisco Bay from a floor-to-ceiling window. The hotel is ideally located on Union Square, so getting anywhere is a breeze. Using public transport is more convenient here. If you drove here, you can park at the garage next door. You'll get a discount as a Hyatt guest. Alternatively, you can always valet ;) We enjoyed dinner and a night view of the city at the Grandviews Restaurant. The restaurant boasts a fantastic view overlooking San Francisco. Even if you are not staying at the hotel, do come and have a meal here. The food is pretty good and you won't be disappointed with the view.

Reviews.Title: “New Hypo-Allergenic Room and Same Convenient Location”
Reviews.Author: tripsntraps
Reviews.Content: The beauty of staying at the Grand Hyatt is it's proximity to Union Square. There is something for everyone in the area. Even after having lived in San Francisco for a number of years, the appeal of downtown never grows old. Theatres, spa treatments, music, art museums, and of course, shopping are all within walking distance. The Grand Hyatt is in the process of renovation. The lobby is all boarded up and it is quite crowded as there is little space to hang around while checking in. I was told all that would go away by Summer. We were upgraded to a city-view Pure room which has a hypo-allergenic environment. There is a HEPA filtering machine in the room -- yes, you can hear it but it didn't interfere with my sleep. The room also has individual reading lamps with adjustable goosenecks. The furniture is modern and sleek --with an electronic window shade that you can operate from your bedside. Modern and clean and very comfortable bed. We went on a AAA package which included breakfast. The wait staff was harried and the food was okay...you can dine on better fare elsewhere. But really, what you're there for is the gorgeous view. And on a day like we had, it re-emphasized why San Francisco is one of the most beautiful cities in the world. It can get expensive so always be on the look-out for specials or packages. If you want to try something touristy but different, go to Mason and O'Farrell and try the GoCar tours. Guided by a GPS you ride in a 2-person car, powered by an engine with controls akin to a motorcycle. if you follow the tour route, especially the one that takes you beneath the Golden Gate bridge, you're treated to wonderful sites with an accompanying narrative. You can't go over 30 miles per hour and you have to crank up the volume to hear the tour over the sound of the motor -- but it is fun nonetheless. Be sure to wear warm clothes and gloves as it sometimes gets windy. The perspective is great because you're in an open-air vehicle.

Reviews.Title: “All New!”
Reviews.Author: jeonyc
Reviews.Content: The Grand Hyatt is in an outstanding location. Right at Union Square and by all the tourist hot spots. The property itself is all renovated, which means the rooms are new, nice and up-to-date. Overall the employees were top notch and delightful at every encounter. Would definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location with big and clean new room”
Reviews.Author: aleterruggi
Reviews.Content: Perfect place to view all San Francisco ,near Union Square , every stores and shops you wanna go , 1 block from chinatown , 1 block to catch cable car . Clean and large room , newly recent refurbished and staff very helpful all times

Reviews.Title: “Ideal location, comfort and style”
Reviews.Author: oz_muse
Reviews.Content: We chose the Grand Hyatt due to its central location and the fact that it had been very recently refurbished. It was a great choice. Its proximity to Union Square, the cable car, good restaurants and shops was fantastic. Our room felt brand new, spotlessly clean and fresh, and was stylish and well appointed. We had a very comfortable king size bed. I particularly liked their breakfasts served in the Grandviews on top floor. The view was amazing and they had some 'stayfit' menu items that were a good healthy choice. Also a yoghurt parfait - yum. Concierge was very helpful with maps and advice and the doormen were very adept at whistling taxis for us. Overall it was an excellent stay - the only thing I was a little disappointed with was that we had booked a Bay View King room and so I was expecting a view of the Bay. The view however was of buildings with a small patch of water visible if you stood right at the corner of the window and looked very hard to find the bay between the buildings. We did not complain though, as we visited the bridge and took a cruise to Sausalito and had a great bay experience.

Reviews.Title: “Position , position , position”
Reviews.Author: lea110270
Reviews.Content: If you want to be the heart of the action, this is where you stay. My family and I were there for 5 nights. Every day we had breakfast in one of the very many lovely places near by. The concierge service was brilliant. They were on top of things and made relevant and interesting suggestions. All the shops are at your door step. Many had said the hotel would be noisy but we never found this a problem. Highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Wish I'd Had a Longer Stay”
Reviews.Author: BruceLansing
Reviews.Content: This property was the book end to a week-long business trip to California, with less than 12 hours on the grounds. Here are the highlights: - Valet parking is $49. Don't say no one told you. According to other reviewers, there are other, cheaper alternatives in the Union Square area. - There is no sundries shop at this property. Go out the main entrance, left turn, left turn, then a half a block straight ahead to the CVS. Say hi to the Drake hotel as you pass by. - Apparently the Hyatt reservations system has a problem when a customer reserves two rooms, then changes the name of the second room to a second party with a second credit card. The 2nd room retains the mailng address of the first customer. It gets even more complexicated when the 2nd customer has a Hyatt Gold Passport number. When the Hyatt Passport number is assigned, then, the orignial reservation reverts to the address of the Gold Passport holder. (Kind of like a Lucy episode, isn't it?) - The room was an outstanding contemporary design, very Euro. Of all of the hotels I've stayed at that have used energy saving lighting, this one was the brightest by far, probably because they use a combination of high-output and LED lights. The Baby Boomers and Generation X thank you. - I struggled with operation of the electric shades, mostly because there were no instructions; I almost ripped them off the top of the mount thinking they were roller shades. Country comes to town, I guess - The bathroom was well-lit, appointed with nice towels and tolietries. The sink was PERFECT for bathing a baby; the other guy I was traveling with found it so funny he e-mailed a pic back to his wife! The unecessairly large baby bath made for a cluttered sink area--no room to put my own shaving kit down over the tolietries and glasses. - The shower was good until the adjustable head came apart in my hand. Engineering was quickly dispatched, but the man making the repair struggled with the spring loaded thing-a-ma-bob that held tension on the main pole. I had to go to the hotel bar to go to the bathroom. Good call. . . - The bar was superb. Generous pour. SUPER view of SF and the Bay. Got to see the fog roll in over a bourbon. - Hotel is in the middle of the Union Square scene--you can't beat it's location or the pick of restaurants within a block--get out of the hotel and find yourself a great place to eat--it isn't hard. - The bed was excellent--not a lick of noise, and the blackout shade I almost trashed worked great. -If you plan a trip to the San Francisco area and want to be in the middle of the action, this property should be on your short list--especially if you're traveling with a significant other and no little ones--looks like it would make a nice getaway hotel. Like another hotel I rated recently, do not pay rack rate--aggressively search for a lower rate and beware the packages with breakfasts included

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: CaroVancouver
Reviews.Content: My family recently stayed here for 3 nights. It was a great location, which is why we chose it. We were happy enough with the renovated room and amenities that the hotel had to offer. The staff were also very helpful. This isn't top notch luxury, it's not a huge room, and the lobby is still undergoing renos, but overall it was a good stay. As my title says, the location is great, close to Chinatown and Union Square. For us, this was key to our weekend.

Reviews.Title: “How bad is that?”
Reviews.Author: raysy
Reviews.Content: About a month ago I decided to spend a week in San Francisco with my wife at the beginning of April 2012. I selected the Grand Hyatt as our Hotel after some extensive research. I phoned the Hotel and was offered a suitable booking with a package which offered “two-breakfasts-for-the-price-of-one”. Total cost … a not unreasonable $1,700. When the email confirmation arrived there was only one breakfast shown. I then exchanged about five emails with the Hotel to try to have them honour their original offer. They responded each time in a most curmudgeonly way - offering alternatives that were all less attractive than the original offer. After a month of emails I decided they were simply not going to give this particular potential customer a taste of their “expect nothing less than spectacular” slogan. I finally cancelled the booking and booked an alternative hotel in San Francisco. The purpose of this review is to give people a flavour of the Hyatt Hotel policy towards guests. I don’t know if the original offer was a mistake or not. No one in Hyatt referred to it in any of the exchanges. However, once made, the Hilton Staff should have set about making a potential customer happy. For the marginal cost of a breakfast they lost at least $1700 worth of business and released a dissatisfied customer into the travel world, without even having stayed at their Hotel. What a great day’s work!

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location, Location”
Reviews.Author: BLT4211
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located right in the financial district, within a block of Chinatown, luxury shops, two blocks to the cable car stop and wonderful restaurants. Taxi ride is a short distance to Harris's Steakhouse restaurant, one of the best.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay, Great Room”
Reviews.Author: trojo323
Reviews.Content: General SUMMARY: Center of it all location, renovated rooms, efficient + friendly service and wonderful views...totally satisfied. CHECK-IN: Smooth, uncomplicated and recognized as rewards program members. Only shortfall, would have beneficial for agent to ask about whether I was parking, as I called ahead and apparently given incorrect parking information. F&B: Ah...Only had a chance to enjoy breakfast buffet, but what a setting. Gorgeous views of the bay, fair value for upscale hotels and overall a really nice assortment of offerings. Not sure if there were other dining options at the hotel besides main restaurant, but plenty to choose from outside the front doors. AMENITIES: Gym was modern and set atop one of the higher floors, so once again fantastic views. I was pretty much alone, but could see it getting pretty packed at peak period. Great equipment though. LOCATION: Excellent, heart of the city on the corner of Union Square...convenient access to the Trolley, BART, public bus, and city parking. Upscale and most popular stores/shops and Chinatown are are stone's throw. Couldn't be better. ACCOMMODATIONS: Recently Renovated and gorgeous. Warm brown/orange tones, great linens and mattress. Flawless technology and electrically controlled shades. Bath was clean and super modern; nice toiletries...and the first vessel sink I actually liked...large enough to bathe a baby in. One caveat, water pressure in the shower was a little soft, so room for improvement there. Nice clean/fresh scent. SHORTFALLS: Water Pressure in the shower. Small lobby that is under renovation and can get annoyingly congested at peak check-in/check/out times. Rates encroach into luxury territory. RECOMMENDATION: One of the best upscale hotels in down San Francisco. Weekend rates were about $400 that weekend, so not cheap and at the price, you were really paying a premium, but not there was a NFL playoff game in town that weekend. Would love to stay here again, but ask for either Union Square or Bay View (Premium Rate). Also if parking, make sure to pull up to valet first and if you want to self park, they will provide you directions and a ticket. Self park is literally across the street.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: James W
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Grand Hyatt last weekend and there is only way to describe our experience 'Just Excellent'. They have a great restaurant for breakfast and their location was very convenient for our needs. Our room was great and I like the amenities and thick towels. We would recommend this Hotel to anyone who would like to stay in a quality establishment.

Reviews.Title: “Business Trip”
Reviews.Author: Christina N
Reviews.Content: I had a great stay. Was there for a meeting. My room was a bit small but that is to be expected in a standard room in the city. Location was great. Within walking distance to local restaurants and shopping.

Reviews.Title: “What an awesome hotel”
Reviews.Author: ScottM1
Reviews.Content: The location is terrific. Within walking distance of lots of shopping and great dinning. The hotel is also only a couple of blocks from BART which makes getting there from the airport easy and cheap. The rooms are great and clean. The hotel is large with several towers so each tower feels like you are in a smaller property. The Starbucks in the lobby is very well used and convenient. Their scones were always very fresh. There are street people close by once you leave, but typical urban hotel issues. I never felt in any danger from the street people and tell them to leave you alone and they will.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for exploring San Francisco!”
Reviews.Author: Serion
Reviews.Content: Location: Great location right next to Union Square. Room: I got a newly renovated suite. It was a very impressive looking room with dark hardwood floors. The room had automatic blinds and two large flat screen TVs. There was also two full bathrooms. My only grip about the bathrooms was the water pressure or the lack there of. Room View: I was on the 18th room. The view was 'ok', but nothing amazing. Club Lounge/View: We spent good amount of time in the lounge of the hotel. The view from here is VERY nice. You could see more of the Bay including Alcatraz. Diamond member get access to the lounge for free, but you can get access via certain rate plans. Well worth it if you don't have the status. The breakfast and evening h'orderves are very good. You can also get wine, beer, or anything from the bar for a very reasonable price. Parking: Is quite expensive. $32 for self parking You can park at Union Square for $27. On a side note: I could hear traffic from my room. So people on lower floors beware.

Reviews.Title: “Needs a lot of work.”
Reviews.Author: Mac147
Reviews.Content: Reaction here is a crap hole. Needs totally gutted. Grubby carpets grubby lifts. Room a bit better but small. Accessible room had no spy hole at wheelchair height. Shower would work when I used it. Lots of better hotels nearby. Wifi that you have to pay for gave me dial up speeds. No water in room and empty fridge.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT location! If looking for a centralized location.. This is the hotel for you”
Reviews.Author: 373Freida
Reviews.Content: The hotel is a very short half block from Union Square. So glad we chose this hotel! China Town's main entrance is only several blocks from the hotel and within easy walking distance. The rooms are newly renovated and very nice. Size is a bit small but we didn't spend much time in the rooms. Beds and bedding are top quality. It was like sleeping on a cloud. The staff was VERY accommodating and could not have been nicer in every way. The bar and restaurant on the top floor have the most beautiful views of the bay and Alcatraz! It's breathtaking to watch the fog roll in and over the bay and rock. What a view !! Food? Honestly, it was typical hotel food. Not terrible but not great. Mixed drinks were expensive but to be expected. Highly recommend!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, many updates”
Reviews.Author: scorco
Reviews.Content: This hotel located in Union Square is very conveniently and centrally located in San Francisco. While we were there there were many Improvements being made, especially in the lobby area. I found the staff to be helpful when in need of a taxi or advice for a nice restaurant. The room we stayed in was on the 11th floor overlooking Union Square and the bay in the distance. While we did not eat at the hotel I suggest you check out the views from the restaurant on the 36th floor. The rooms are newly updated and I found the bed and linens to be quite comfortable. I loved the automatic shade for the window. There is a great breakfast restaraunt named Honey Honey that the concierege turned us on to, it's about 4-5 blocks away. I was a little disappointed that there was not a pool or hot tub as we walked a lot and could've used a refreshing dip. We would definitely stay at this hotel again when visiting San Francisco. I should also mention I booked though Priceline for $135 a night!!! Rooms like ours were going for $301. This made the stay even that more enjoyable.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel with a View”
Reviews.Author: Colin358
Reviews.Content: Just loved this hotel even though they were refurbishing the lobby level. All the staff we had contact with were excellent, showing courtesy and respect. They were also happy to help. The room was on the 28th floor and modernly furnished and the full length windows on such a high level allowed for a spectacular view day and night. The location was excellent just adjacent to Union Square, lots of good shopping around.

Reviews.Title: “recent stay at the grand hyatt”
Reviews.Author: jsnowshoe
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a great location in San Francisco. You are able to get on the cable cars, buses and BART in a 5 minute walk from the hotel. Rooms are spacious and they provided robes on request. The gym is pretty good size and head phones and towels are provided. The concierge's were very busy and not always as patient as one would like. Shopping is great and is readily available from the hotel. Doormen were always helpful in securing a cab for guests.

Reviews.Title: “Can't wait to go back”
Reviews.Author: Sergeantino
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel as part of a surprise trip for my wife's birthday. The reviews for the hotel tempted me and I was not disappointed! I really couldn't fault this hotel and would not hesitate to recommend it. It has a great location, only a 2 minute walk from Union Square and close to lot's of restaurants and bars. The concierge service at the hotel is excellent and they can't do enough to help you. The rooms are very comfortable and I can't wait to go back here one day. Get a 3 or 5 day pass for the cablecars from Walgreen's nearby, that's the most cost effective way of using this most entertaining form of transport. Lori's Diner nearby is really good for breakfast. If you're going to SF, book this hotel. You'll love it.

Reviews.Title: “A slightly lower standard than the average of the Hyatt.”
Reviews.Author: emersonkz
Reviews.Content: We were in Grand Hyatt San Francisco last December for few nights, but the hotel is nothing beyond the basics, unlike what we expect this type of hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Not as Good the Second Time”
Reviews.Author: michbren
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a second time and were rather disappointed. We booked a Club Level room primarily to have a quiet place to go after spending the day out in busy SF and for having breakfast. Every time we were in there is was filled with young children and / or teenagers doing what kids do. Parents were using the lounge at night to feed their families dinner. The food offerings were not labeled so you had to continually ask the attendant and seating was limited. The staff in the lounge seemed overwhelmed. Breakfast was so limited the only cereal offered was granola and the only hot entree every day we were there was scrambled eggs with a type of mystery meat in it. This was not our experience during our previous stay. It was not worth the additional expense at all. Housekeeping did a great job in our room each day. Although we love the location of the hotel given the small rooms, high cost and disappointing club lounge I doubt we will return.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, pity about the noise”
Reviews.Author: RobinNewZealand
Reviews.Content: Were it not for the room noise, I would have given this hotel 5 stars. The rooms are recently refurbished, and are very nice, with excellent bathrooms, great styling and superb views from the upper floors. The location is hard to beat - lots of good restaurants nearby, about a 1 minute walk to the cable cars, handy to transport in general and just a few minutes walk from the huge Westfield mall. Unfortunately the sound insulation between rooms is poor. On the first night we were disturbed several times by a barking dog in an adjacent room, not what you expect in a hotel of this quality. On the last night the guests in an adjacent room were quite loud, and all the noise carried right into our room. This is a great pity as in all other respects, we loved this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome bay view rooms in a great central location”
Reviews.Author: Orijit
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent one night in a king size - bay view -room up on the 27th floor. We could see the city and the bay from our room which was lovely. The room itslef was very nice. Comfortable and with a pillow menu. We signed up for the amour package and got a champagne and chocolate covered strwberries - breakfast - and late checkout. I thought it was a really nice deal.. If driving. park in the stockton garage. Other wise its almost 40 USD a night. Only issue (minor) - noisy neghbors - thinnish walls.

Reviews.Title: “excellent location and very comfortable beds”
Reviews.Author: travelduesouth
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for two nights and was excellent. Top of the list is the location then followed very closely by the comfortable rooms, well fitted bathrooms, mod cons and mostly great staff. The only negative is the rooms are a bit on the small side and at check-in I had a run in with a receptionist who was not satisfied with identification. I'll put that down to a clash of personalities as the rest of the recpetion and staff were very nice and see no reason to hold the hotel for blame for this as everything else was great.

Reviews.Title: “Family values”
Reviews.Author: thedjlee
Reviews.Content: For my family, this hotel represented excellent value. Considering we stayed over the new year period, the pricing was even more astounding. As we are a family of five, two rooms are required. The first room was charged at $220/night. The second room, however, was charged at half-price - $110/night. $330 for two rooms was awesome for us. For the evening of NYE, the rate went up by $50 for the first room, and $25 for the second. Throw in the fact that breakfast was included in the rate, and we had very well-priced accommodation for the NY period. We stayed a total of five nights. Final tip: Use the parking structure on the diagonally-opposite corner of Suttor and Stockton, for reasonably-priced parking in SF.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: NJ008
Reviews.Content: Upon arrival very pleasant and efficient front desk promptly check in. Though the room size was smaller but had an excellent view of city and the bay. The hotel location makes it very desirable place to stay. The staff was very helpful. Overall this is an excellent hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great way to finish trip.”
Reviews.Author: SaltyTraveller
Reviews.Content: We are on our way home but stayed a couple of days here at the Hyatt. No better spot in this city for a central point. No need to make dinner reservations. We had a romantic dinner served in our room set up next to the large windows overlooking the Square. Must be the best dining experience ever! Hyatt's are always nice and clean and great value if you hit the weekends with good discounts.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel & Location”
Reviews.Author: ShawnNY_110
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Hyatt during Columbus day weekend of this year for a few days before a business trip began. All of the rooms in the hotel were remodeled and the rooms were really nice. There is a excellent view of the city from the upper floors and the hotel is in walking distance of Union Square, the tram to fisherman's wharf as well as the subway. It is a few blocks away from Chinatown. Cabs are easy to catch from the hotel if you don't feel like utilizing public transportation. For business it is a good hotel. If you are in town for leisure and into clubs/lounges there is a club across the street as well as a club right around the corner. There are also a bunch of small bars & other nightlife places in the immediate area as well. Because of the new room designs and the relatively cheap price as compared to some of the other hotels in the area I would highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A Little Dissapointed”
Reviews.Author: Jen0846
Reviews.Content: After staying in many hotels around the world, I can conclude that Hyatt is one of the best big hotel chains out there. For my latest visit to San Francisco, California, I chose the Grand Hyatt again after an amazing experience back in August: Spacious, modern and CLEAN room; amazing staff, nice food. Unfortunately, my recent visit was very dissapointing. My room on the 28th floor was not clean at all. Yu can see the the cleaning service did not do their job well because the batroom toilet had "residues" from the guests before me and the bathroom sink was visibly dirty. I would recommend paying more attention to the cleaning and the cleaning service.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for groups”
Reviews.Author: NewEnglandGal_11
Reviews.Content: i planned an event for my company in San Francisco and we stayed at the Grand Hyatt on Union Square. The Lobby is not very open but i understand they are making some changes there. The reno at the hotel was great - the rooms were nicely appointed. We had over 50 people on our room block - this is a great hotel for groups! The sales staff is outstanding and they are very eager to show your group a nice time. They are friendly, professional and responsive and they truly function as a team both in preparation and onsite. The food and service was impeccable. The area is currently undergoing some construction so it can be a bit noisy but that doesn't take away from the hotel at all. if you happen to get rooms overlooking Union Square, you'll seem some great sites both day and night. I recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Can be better, but if you pay standard room rate, look for other hotel in the area.”
Reviews.Author: Tommyyam
Reviews.Content: Poor Internet, poor shower , good breakfast with excellent view. We stay with a good family rate but if you pay for standard rate, it doesn't worth it. Only worth $150/ day not more than that. Good location. TV channel not enough. I will stay somewhere if I visit San Francisco again.

Reviews.Title: “Top quality in SF”
Reviews.Author: TravelProNewYork
Reviews.Content: Stayed 2 nights in December. Room: Looks newly updated. Modern, stylish, comfortable. Bathroom: Great big sink, spacious. Staff: Friendly and courteous. Lobby: Kind of small. Don't have Grand Hyatt wow feeling. Club lounge: Too many people and hard to find seats. Location: Right next to Union Sq. and convenient to train, bus, cale car. Overall great hotel and highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Near Union Square”
Reviews.Author: soettu
Reviews.Content: Was at the Grand Hyatt on Union Square from 12-16-2011 to 12-18-2011. Stayed in a non-smoking king room on the 19th floor. This property has been recently remodeled and and it shows: the: the rooms are fresh and the decor is current. The lobby can only be characterized as functional. The staff were as friendly as a major hotel in big city can afford. There are plenty of elevators, so waiting to get to your room is bearable. The rooms are large and comfortable, lots of decent lighting, no coffee maker, poor analog TV. Nice views with handy retractable window shades for privacy. You can still hear all the racket from the street and you can hear your neighbors come and go. The resturant on the 36 th floor is lovely with decent food and service. Free wifi only in selected downstairs areas, otherwise big charge for access in your room. Hotel location very handy for forays into nearby city attractions and then being able to retreat into room when it all gets to be too much. Overall, very decent and, if you shop around a little bit, you can get a decent room with breakfast included for around $160.00 US dollars per night.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay at the Grand Hyatt SF”
Reviews.Author: dannybcanada
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Grand Hyatt SF for three nights in October. The Grand Hyatt SF is located right next to Union Square. It's a convenient location as it's right near major shopping destinations, Chinatown, and the business district. It is also a close walk to the Port of San Francisco (which is a must if you enjoy good oysters and like a market atmosphere). The hotel is also a block away from the Canal streetcar, which is worth the ride if you've never done it before. The stay itself was very pleasant. The rooms are well appointed and modern, the staff are friendly, and the hotel is cleaner than most in its category. The room is a bit smaller than average, but there was plenty of storage and closet space to make up for it. One recommendation: If you're facing east or west, you will want to put the sunscreen down either in the am or pm, depending on when you get sun. I found that during the afternoon (we were facing west) the sun really heated up the room. Overall, I would definitely return to the hotel. I usually expect quite a bit from a hotel of this class, and they delivered and then some.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant hotel, great staff but few amenities”
Reviews.Author: FlyingScotsman09
Reviews.Content: The Grand Hyatt San Francisco stands on Union Square and so is in a great location. It's a very pleasant hotel. My room was clean and nicely furnished. All the staff were very helpful and nice throughout my stay and the concierge was most helpful in finding me a place to purchase emergency eyeglass replacements. My only complaint is that there are really rather few amenities. There is a smallish fitness center on the 35th floor and a rather small bar and dining room on the 36th floor. The view is great but it feels rather cramped. The food was just ok both dinner and breakfast. There's no lobby to speak of and no gift shop to buy even a bottle of water (I walked across the street to Starbucks for that). I've also stayed at the Westin Saint Francis also on Union Square and find that it really has more amenities for the same price. So overall I liked the hotel an can recommend it if you don't mind the lack of amenities.

Reviews.Title: “Upscale hotel in the heart of SF”
Reviews.Author: Viking71
Reviews.Content: Stayed here 3 nights after two nights at the hyatt regency SF. Really liked the hotel stayed in a suite on 30 something floor. Since we were a family group we booked two large suites with amazing amazing view!wow! Service at high level and excellent concierge. The refurbish was due, but now excellent interiors. The design of the Grand & Regency is rather cool if you'r into contemporary architecture. You will indeed find moore personal hotels but I would stay again for sure. The lounge was comfortable with good selections. Ok gym and excellent to travel here with children.

Reviews.Title: “Nice rooms though small. Good location.”
Reviews.Author: Bkmummy
Reviews.Content: Rooms are nicely renovated but a little small. Breakfast was at top of hotel which had beautiful views of san Francisco. We love the view. Location is good, just a block away from union square where all the shopping is. Reception and bell service was good. However as we needed some help in deciding what to do, the service at concierge wasn't as helpful or friendly. The stay would have been much better if the service we encounter at concierge could be better. Hotel rates considered high for the room size. Would recommend if location is main consideration without regard for room size.

Reviews.Title: “hotel”
Reviews.Author: kalagapp
Reviews.Content: Great hotel by Union square. It is very conveniently located to all retsuarants, attractions and near the convention center. One of the best amenities here is the use of the Regency club. this lounge is open for breakfast and then is open for coffee and soft drinks all day. in the evening there are hors doeurves and drinks (small charge). A lovely hotel

Reviews.Title: “Check teh weather forecast BEFORE you check in.”
Reviews.Author: davekv
Reviews.Content: This is a fine Hyatt hotel – unless the weather is bad – then forget it! The rooms were remodeled in 2010 and 2011 and are typical Hyatt so no issues with that. All have comfortable beds, flat panel TV’s, convenient electrical outlets, wireless internet and so on. I stayed at this property 8 times this year and each stay was fine EXCEPT for my most recent visit. I was on the 26th floor and the wind picked up about 2 in the morning and the room creaked like one would imagine an old wooden sailing ship. It was so loud that sleep was very difficult. I complained to the front desk and they immediately offered to move me to the 7th floor saying that all rooms on high floors had creaking noises when the winds picked up. So, off to the seventh floor I went. But, the next night same issue occurred. I even found a letter from the Front Office Manager in the room. The letter said: “Dear Grand Hyatt Guest, …Due to severe weather conditions and high winds, you may experience intermittent sounds in your guest room. Please be assured, this is common in high-rise buildings shifting with the pressure of the wind…..” What? Are you kidding me? Wake up, Hyatt - all high rises don't creak in the wind! Bottom line: check the weather forecast before you decide to stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Surpassed my expectations”
Reviews.Author: epicuriousinla
Reviews.Content: I recently attended a conference that was being held at the Grand Hyatt, so for convenience booked a 2 night stay at the hotel. I usually like to stay at boutique hotels for a more personal touch. I was a bit wary that the Grand Hyatt would be like a "convention center" type hotel, but had a really wonderful time. The location is perfect. I was fortunate to get a room overlooking Union square with the Christmas tree and ice-rink in view. Macys, Saks, and Barneys are just down the street and so cute to see the SPCA dogs and cats up for adoption in the windows of Macys. It is a few blocks north of the Montgomery BART stop. The room was spacious, modern and bright. Instead of drapery, there was a button operated window screen. I felt so relaxed. The only thing that I disliked was that one could hear the wind, but I was so tired that once I fell asleep, it wasn't an issue. The restaurant on the 37th floor has panoramic views of the bay and city. Unfortunately the area reserved for happy hour is limited, so it was packed at 5pm. With so many great restaurants in San Francisco including those with Michelin stars, I ended up eating outside the restaurant. I am definitely looking forward to returning to San Francisco and a stay at the Grand Hyatt!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Choice for downtown SF”
Reviews.Author: traveldream
Reviews.Content: This newly refurbished Grand Hyatt is very comfortable, well located, with a professional staff. Accommodations are very contemporary, with clean lines and relaxing colors. Our room was a good size for a city hotel. Every hotel and cruise ship seems to love those duvets on the (very comfortable) bed. They look lovely but are so hot and you can't turn down the thermostat low enough to be comfortable. That aside, I enjoyed having a great choice of pillow comfort on the bed - from soft to very firm - take your pick. Bathroom was clean, comfortable and well-laid out. A small "dressing" area was located between the bath and the room, opposite the large closet. There was some noisy construction going on across the street, a higher floor would have been a good choice (at a higher price) another time. This 36 story hotel has a very nice restaurant on the 36th floor with spectacular views, good menu, food, and attentive staff. We had both dinner and breakfast there. Prices were in line with any nice city restaurant. Super Shuttle service from the airport was fast and priced at $17 per person. We look forward to staying at the Grand Hyatt again in the near future.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location for Union Square shopping. But can be noisy.”
Reviews.Author: samthefish06
Reviews.Content: Excellent location for shopping in Union Square, located on the same street as Niketown, Disney Store, Macy's, and Neiman Marcus. However, the central location perhaps is also a weakness, as it is close to the sounds of traffic. I stayed at the hotel for 2 nights for business. The front desk upgraded my room to a higher floor with a better view, which was a nice touch and completely unexpected. My room was right next to the ice machine - I initially worried that it might be noisy, but actually I could not hear any noise in the room, which was great. In terms of outside noise, a slightly different situation. On the first night it was difficult to fall asleep as there were construction sounds going on all night. No issue on the second night. The room and bathroom are spacious and clean, and recently refurbished and so appears very new and modern. The amenities are also very nice.
