I did use the in-room coffee machine as I didn't have time to run to Starbucks in the morning, and I was pleasantly surprised at the quality of the coffee. The hotel does not provide any complimentary bottles of water, which I found unusual for such a class of hotel such as this one. I would definitely recommend this hotel for tourists or business-people who are visiting SF and would like a central location. I may suggest to request the highest floor rooms possible to have a quiet night of sleep. PLEASE NOTE : The staff at the Grand Hyatt are all very warm, friendly, and prompt. I was very impressed at the speed which the valet retrieved my car from parking and had it ready for me. I also was impressed at how they remembered me and greeted me as I returned back at the hotel. I did not expect this from such a large hotel in a big city. The front desk was equally impressive. A definite positive!

Reviews.Title: “Renovated rooms, review your bill carefully, though”
Reviews.Author: Hongdemao
Reviews.Content: The Grand Hyatt had nicely renovated, modern rooms. There are electric shades, which makes waking up easy- just flip the switch built into the headboard for natural light, while still having privacy from the perforated metallic vertical shades. There are plenty of outlets for recharging your electronics, including outlets built right into the headboard, which allows for reading, etc., on your ipad while plugged in. There is a dock/ recharger for ipods built into the clock radio. The minibar was thankfully empty, which meant you could use it without being charged for moving anything. There is a Walgreens nearby for loading up on drinks and snacks inexpensively. That Walgreens even stocks salads and fresh fruit. The bathroom was modern and there was a dressing table area, which was nice. The only thing was that there were eye pencil shavings from the previous guest left underneath it, on the floor, which remained there for my multi day stay, so one is left to wonder how thorough the cleaning is. There were also dried makeup smudges on the makeup mirror on the dressing table which was also not cleaned during my stay. The check-in was fast and courteous; however, I realized afterwards that the rate was different than what I had confirmed online. When I went down to ask why, I was told that I had received some of the paid-for upgrades they now offer online. Okay the extra few $ for a higher floor room; however, I was also charged a hefty upgrade fee for a Club Room, which I didn't receive. I also didn't receive access to the Club Lounge or notification from the check-in person that I had been upgraded. After about 15 minutes, the front desk attendant agreed to remove the upgrade fee for the Club Room. If I hadn't been alert, I would not only have been charged, but also never received either the Club Room or Lounge access. The concierge was very polite and responsive to a recommendation for a good sushi restaurant. When I went there, though, I thought that the sushi was just mediocre. I will trust Tripadvisor and Zagat reviews next time. The location is terrific for pedestrians and a nightmare for cars. It is next to Union Square and shopping and restaurants. It is close enough that you can make multiple trips to the big department stores and back to the hotel to drop off purchases. There is construction going on in the area which, combined with traffic, can lead to long delays in taxis. All in all, with a few minor glitches, the stay was enjoyable, with nice rooms and an unbeatable location for shopping and food.

Reviews.Title: “Top Notch off Union Square”
Reviews.Author: BocaBlocks
Reviews.Content: All personnel were extremely pleasant and knowledgeable. Great service from doormen, to check-in, to cleaning staff. Newly redecorated room with flat screen TV. Rewired with easy access to outlets to charge electronic gear, plug in iPod to telephone speaker system, USB port, etc. Unfortunately, room has very little drawer space, which is OK if u are here for 1 night. We were here for a week. Do hotel room designers ever stay in a hotel room? They charge for WiFi access & busn ctr! Seems they are stuck in the 90s. Why is it that lower priced hotels provide these necessities free while more expensive hotels want to nickel & dime u [I mean $5 and $10 u]? Location 1 block N of Union Sq, Macy's, Geary St art galleries, 2 blocks N of Westfield Mall & 1 block W of Gump's is great.

Reviews.Title: “Best Nights Sleep in my life!”
Reviews.Author: Jacmor63
Reviews.Content: Ok it may have been partly due to jetlag but the super large bed at the Grand Hyatt was luxurious! Our room had traditional decor and was spacious with ample wardrobe space, drawer and desk space and coffee machine. Our views were good and if you want a suer view without paying the price for the restaurant just go up to the top floor bar and order .... for me, a cocktail thanks! Was lovely! We did visit the restaurant on the final night of our stay and the view was....clouds mainly! The meal was lovely although priced to match! This hotel has an ideal location and Id suggest that if you are staying even just a few days go for this location over the pier/seafront - you can easily get the wooden cable car right down to the seafront from here. Even better its a quality location with a super "square" - Union Square which often has dancing/music on its little stage - nice little benches to sit and watch the world go by. Fantastic shops in the vicinity - Ugg, Tiffany, all the high end "stores" to try out makeup, clothing, etc and a super indoor shopping mall with an Abercrombie and Fitch down the road at much cheaper than New York prices! Do try out the cable cars - you really have to experience it! We went to Teattro Zinzanni and it was one of the best theatre/entertainment experiences we have ever had. Do Alcatraz, go on a wine tour - oh theres so much to do I just want to go back! Take clothing to suit any weather as the seafront really can be blowy. Being Scottish I am quite used to it but if you are not, you will feel the chill! Then up at Union Square roasting sunshine! Layers I believe are the way to go! Enjoy San Fransisco!

Reviews.Title: “Average with some good aspects”
Reviews.Author: thisisme?ok
Reviews.Content: Room is great for price and number of stars. Lobby is cold. Breakfast is very good. Gym is superb, bar at the top is somewhat stylish with great views bud bad service. Location is amazing. Valet parking is expensive but there is cheap alternative across the street. First night the room on lower floor was very noisy (they did get the insulation wrong) so we had to move at 3am to a higher floor which had no problems with noise (rubbish men lingered below our window for more than an hour). Second day the room was not cleaned and we realised at 9pm by which time it was too late for them to clean. They did give us free breakfast (and also offered to waive the rate for one night but our rate was prepaid) . Would give it 4 stars for the price etc. but they lose a star for insulation and bad housekeeping on one day (to be fair the room was spotless for the rest of the days)

Reviews.Title: “Nice location but service could be better”
Reviews.Author: daikin
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel at a great location. However service could be better. At check-in I was told the room they reserved for me was a handicap room and asked if I wanted to change to a different room. I said fine but he ended up giving me a 5th floor room! No view and the drain for the bathtub didn't even work! The electric curtains were nice though.

Reviews.Title: “Lots of maintenance work”
Reviews.Author: XathrasManchester
Reviews.Content: As a diamond member, I would of expected a slightly better service. but I guess being treated as a single guest and looking quite young - there was some form of assessment they got wrong. The food from the upper restraunt was ok, service was ok, and the rooms you guessed it. There was lots of maintenance work going on in the and around the building and I wasn't made aware of that prior to the booking. Next time, I'll try another location.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent renovation of rooms”
Reviews.Author: Chicago60604
Reviews.Content: The rooms have been sleekly redone, lots of counterspace and our room was quite large with good lighting. We had a high floor and a view over the city to the bay which was very nice, better than I have had at other SF hotels. The closet was awkward and a little small with little drawer room unfortunately and the bathroom was on the smallish size. Excellent location, only a block from Union Square. The lobby however has few places to sit and is cold and somewhat confusing. Personnel were friendly for the most part but we did not use many of the services. San Francisco is an expensive hotel city and this space is no different. I would however stay again, at least in a view room

Reviews.Title: “Grand Hyatt right on Unuion Square”
Reviews.Author: Kevinprin
Reviews.Content: A very nice weekend stay at the Grand Hyatt San Francisco. The hotel is in a great location, next to all the major shopping in Union Square, most of the live theaters, easy walk to Chinatown, North Beach, Ferry Building and Fisherman's Wharf. The rooms have been completely remodeled since my last stay two years ago. Very nice rooms, the higher floors have great views of the city.

Reviews.Title: “Not the best hyatt you can stay at”
Reviews.Author: Dmitryvulkan
Reviews.Content: This is a good but pricey option for tourists not business travelers - i think i did not call to housekeeping as often anywhere I stayed as in this hotel. You need to ask for everything - water, shoe horn (!), vanity set ... I just cant name everything that was not in the room! The seemed refurbished the hotel but not everything - for example the doors remain very old, may be as a consequence you can hear how your next door guest is taking a shower... The breakfast - you don't really want it in the hotel - try to find it outside, even Starbucks will be better and be open earlier then a restaurant in the hotel. Try to avoid if you can...

Reviews.Title: “Great location, good hotel”
Reviews.Author: Hamish11
Reviews.Content: The location of the Grand Hyatt is pretty much perfect - less than 100yds from Union Square, 5 minutes walk from Chinatown, perhaps 15 minutes walk or so to North Beach, and within 2 blocks of the cable car terminus. The hotel is very large, but the service is excellent. I would say that this is obviously a business hotel, but is also great for the leisure traveller if you can secure a decent rate (as we did). Rooms are quite small, especially the bathrooms, but are recently and stylishly refurbished and very comfortable indeed. Every amenity is provided and of good quality. Huge windows (with electric blinds - cool!) offer great views, so be sure to try to get a room on a high floor, preferably with bay or Union Sq view. The restaurant and bar on the top floor afford magnificent views of the bay, and have a great atmosphere. There is valet parking or assisted self service at nearly garages, but expect to pay a minimum of $34/night for the latter (and over $50 I think for valet). If you don't need a car whilst in SF, it may be better to collect from a downtown location on your departure from the city. My only suggestions for improvement would be: WiFi - come on, even basic roadside inns now offer this free and this was the only hotel in my week long trip that charged. I enjoyed my stay at the Grand Hyatt and would highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous views of the city!”
Reviews.Author: gapgrl4496
Reviews.Content: This was a beautiful, classic hotel. The rooms have some amazing views of the city, but also feature electric shades that will completely block out all the light for when you're ready to sleep. Pretty good sized rooms for the price. Very high quality and clean! Great customer service. Will print your plane tickets home for free. In a great location -- far enough away from the Fisherman's Wharf that it doesn't feel too, too touristy, without being too far to walk to attractions. Only two complaints: - The business center that they advertise is NOT free. You must pay to use their two, extremely slow, computers. Had I known I would've brought my own laptop for when I needed to look up attractions. - They have this auto HVAC unit... I'm not sure if ours was broken but it must have been motion sensored because when we would go to sleep it would completely shut off and then every time one of us would move or get up to use the bathroom it would kick on and then shut off 5 minutes later. Extremely disruptive.

Reviews.Title: “Weekend Getaway”
Reviews.Author: tmurph99CV
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for our 10 yr anniversay. Neither of us had ever been to SF so it was nervous to book not really knowing the city. After reading other reviews that talked about location, I booked and so glad I did. We looked at other cheaper hotels but so very happy we decided to book at the Grand Hyatt. This was our 10 yr anniversay and Glietz at the Front Desk made us feel welcome from the get go. They upgraded our room to a higher floor with a awesome city view. They also offered us a bottle of wine and choice of a food item. Nice touch and very much appreciated. There are plenty of staff in the lobby area ready to assist with any needs. The Concierge was very friendly and helpful. It rained most of the weekend and they even offered us the use of an umbrella the entire weekend. This might be the norm for a 4 or 5 star hotel but i had never experienced this before and it was very much appreciated. It kept us dry while we walked around the entire city! Right next to plenty of shopping, Chinatown or a Cable car or Street Car. I did read some reviews about street noise but i guess that would be common in a "City" type of atmosphere with tall buildings echoing sounds. I don't have any complaints about the hotel. The rooms were very nice and the beds were extremely comfortable. I didn't realize there was a small fridge or coffee maker in the room until the day we checked out but oh well. Starbucks is directly accross the street. North Beach (Italian neighborhood is with in walking distance) We ate breakfast at Lori's a block away from the hotel and it was very good. I recommend Tony's Pizza in North Beach. Very good pizza! We stayed 2 days and could not get it all in. If you stay on pleasure, it is worth the Open Air Bus tour of the city. It hits all the major sites and you can get on and off at your leisure. And the price is reasonable. Thank you to all the great staff that made our stay such a nice and memorable one! Perfect Location too!

Reviews.Title: “Tiny room, awesome view”
Reviews.Author: WA35
Reviews.Content: Having just spent a long weekend at the Grand Hyatt Union Square there are certainly a lot of great things about this hotel - the staff, the view and the location, but a few things let down the hotel for us. I had Hyatt points to spend, so I booked three nights for my family of 2 adults and 2 kids (8 and 10) in a Club room. I had thought (mistakenly) that the rooms with two beds were king/king - so on arrival I was very surprised to find that the rooms were actually double/double and in fact - tiny. We had an adjoining King room for other family members and the King, same size as the double, really seemed a lot roomier. To the hotel's credit my husband spoke with a member of staff who showed him a number of different rooms and allocated us a Bay view room for our 2nd and 3rd nights, with a complementary bottle of wine for the inconvenience, but the room was still the same small size. Bathrooms are also small but well fitted, big sink, modern fittings - but the shower is over the bath, even on the Club rooms. The hotel has no real lobby to speak of but the decor around the hotel is updated, modern and very clean. The Club dining room has a fabulous view of San Francisco and the Bay - and the staff in the evening were incredibly polite and helpful. Wine is self-service on an 'honor' system for $3 per glass and staff ordered a very reasonable bottle of bubbly for us on the first night. The food in the Club was ok, but compared to other Hyatt Clubs (or the Ritz Clubs) was only really average. Breakfast was mostly pastries and fruits and a different dried up egg dish each day. In the evening two appetizers were served with a block of cheese (that was not renewed). Soft drinks and coffee/teas were amply supplied. The location of the hotel is great, just a short walk from the BART station, a cable car stop and within a stone's throw of major shopping, restaurants and Union Square. All-in-all great staff, great view - still tiny room!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel-Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: travelsavant
Reviews.Content: Stayed here late Oct 2011, for sister's weekend birthday celebration. Hotel was sold out while we where there but check-in was friendly & easy; desk clerk was very helpful getting us 2 nearby rooms on same floor, both with excellent city views. Status upgrades were also given from standard to high floor deluxe, with Club room access. Newly renovated rooms are very nice; king corner rooms are quite spacious with separate dressing area from room & large bath. Really liked the new decor & modern tech amenities (all is very much like their website photos & descriptions.) Excellent AC - was quite hot for SF at that time of year. Hotel valet parking is reasonable for SF but directly across the street is parking garage that is $26 for 24 hrs; so drop your bags with bellman & then park it yourself.

Reviews.Title: “Beautifully done rooms, nice location”
Reviews.Author: dokness
Reviews.Content: This is a pretty fancy hotel right in downtown San Francisco. The rooms are pretty small, but beautifully done in a the "moderne" minimalist style. The flat screet TVs are a waste since they only have analog low res quality and only a handful of channels. Internet is not free, not even in the business center. No coffee maker or fridge. Good location right on the edge of Chinatown and close to everything.

Reviews.Title: “The Hyatt is truly GRAND”
Reviews.Author: mithi
Reviews.Content: The Hyatt is simply the perfect choice for any traveller to San Francisco. I loved our suite, it had a balcony overlooking the bay, two bathrooms (one even had a flat screen tv !!) the living room had a huge TV and my kids loved our 5 day stay. The hotel lobby was beautiful, the staff very helpful and even upgraded one of our rooms. There was wi fi everywhere, the gym was well positioned and the views were great !!! It was a great great holiday !!

Reviews.Title: “Great stay!”
Reviews.Author: LiveToEat-DC
Reviews.Content: We loved our room at the Grand Hyatt. It was spacious and clean with a nice view of downtown. The bed was so comfortable. The concierges were also fantastic. They were able to arrange for a last minute rental car for us as well as give us some great guidance about our destinations of Sausalito and Muir Woods. Small issues were that the first night it was windy so the building was creaking - nothing the hotel could do about this and it didn't end up keeping us up like we had feared it would - so not too big of a deal. Also, the window shade is controlled by switches next to the bed and door. I must have put it up to far when we got in to the room because when we tried to put it down when we got back it jammed. The hotel sent someone up very quickly to resolve the issue. Due to a business trip and room availability we stayed in 3 different hotels while in San Francisco. This was the first and we just kept wishing to come back to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal location, great service, very comfortable room”
Reviews.Author: lordoftheonionrings
Reviews.Content: I just returned from a 5-night stay at this lovely hotel in San Francisco's Union Square. The hotel is very nicely situated in the heart of Union Square, just steps away from all the shopping and great restaurants this neighborhood is known for. It's also just a few blocks from Chinatown, and a metro/bus ride to almost anywhere in the city. I was in town for a conference at the Moscone Center, which was an easy 8-minute walk away. The location is one of the best features of this hotel. The hotel itself is very nice. The rooms are very comfortable, with modern decor and lots of great practical elements like a big desk, lots of easy to reach outlets and internet connections (and not just at the desk, but next to the bed as well), and a very nice bathroom with one of the best lit mirrors I've seen (great for makeup application). The view from my room was great- mostly city, with peeks of the bay behind the buildings. I would highly recommend you try to get a bay-view room on as high a floor as possible for the best view. The only issue I ran into during my stay was the lack of sound insulation in my room. There was a connecting door with the adjacent room, which was closed the entire time, but which let a surprising amount of noise from the other room into mine (and vice versa I imagine). I could hear conversations from the other room clearly from mine, and I did feel a bit self conscious that everything that I was saying could be heard by my neighbor as well. It didn't bother me enough to switch rooms, but if you're a light sleeper or are bothered by this, I would request a room without a connecting door. Overall, I really enjoyed my stay. The service was great (super fast room service), the rooms were very comfortable, the restaurant on the 36th floor had spectacular views, and the location is really ideal. I would definitely return to this hotel, and would recommend it highly to others.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing!”
Reviews.Author: jtaw
Reviews.Content: Travelled to SF in July 2011 with my sister. This hotel is spectacular. We requested a double room very early on, a high floor and a renovated room - they gave us all 3. The rest of the hotel, e.g. the bar and the lobby, needs updating to bring it in line with the rooms. The hotel is ridiculously central. 5mins from China Town, another 10 mins from China Town to North Beach. So very central to everything else - like the shops around Union Sq. It's close to all kinds of cafes and restaruants too, and a stroll away from Zara/H&M/Levis/T&Co. The service is great and the concierges were ridiculously helpful with directions to EVERYTHING! They helped us with public transport, bus routes, cable cars etc. No need to feel like a novice / research your trip with concierges like this! Although they did give us one bad restaurant recommendation in North Beach.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant stay, stunning bay views, relaxing Regency lounge”
Reviews.Author: Empress777
Reviews.Content: Had a pleasant stay at the Grand Hyatt San Francisco. Was in town for the Nike Women's Marathon and this hotel is steps away from Union Square. Upon check-in, I was offered a room on a high floor with stunning views of the bay, but unfortunately, the room was next to an ice machine. I am sensitive to noise, so reluctantly I asked if I could be switched to another room. Fortunately, they were able to offer a similar room on a high floor with a great city/partial bay view, and the staff member made an extra effort to show me access to an unbostructed view of the city and the bay. Nice touch. Room is not large, but this being a business hotel, layout is practical and convenient. Had access to the Regency Lounge and this premium amenity is a nice luxury! Full breakfast buffet in the mornings, dessert pastries in the evenings, plenty of beverage options, honor bar for wine and liquor, all while enjoying gorgeous views of the city. A pleasant stay overall. Would consider coming back here again.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing!”
Reviews.Author: v4singhi
Reviews.Content: Located bang at union square the out appearance isnt very great but once you're in the hotel its a totally different world......when i checked in I got a room facing the other side (of union square) and spent a night there but there were some quirky noises coming for some reasons and one complaining the same I was given a room on a higher floor facing the union square which was truly a great experience. Also, they kind of surprised us when we returned back in the evening to find a nice bottle of wine and freshly cut fruits as a courtesy.....didnt try any of the restaurants in the hotel but i will never forget my stay here....3 cheers!

Reviews.Title: “Can't go wrong with this hotel”
Reviews.Author: brownstravelgirl
Reviews.Content: We "named our own price" and were very, very pleased. We arrived on Wednesday at 1pm. Room was ready. We had our choice between 2 doubles or a king. Check-in was friendly and fast. Room was clean. Not huge, but certainly big enough for our needs. Small dresser in the closet and two drawers in the nightstand; that was all for storing clothes. A nice flat-screen TV. A small desk and chair. Plugs for all your electronic gadgets. We had a bathtub. No adjoining door. We were close to the elevators and never heard any noise. We were on the 21st floor and did hear some dumpsters in the early morning but noise doesn't bother us. The window shade came in handy because all of the buildings around Union Square give off quite a bit of light. The beds were very comfy---a bit on the soft side, but that's what we like. We did not use the restaurant or room service. We did have some drinks in the lounge. Fabulous view, prices what I came to expect in San Fran. Friendly staff. Housekeeping did an excellent job. We were out of the room by 9 each morning and never saw them---they came after we left. All staff was friendly and had a smile. The concierge services were outstanding. They helped with anything, always quick with an answer or suggestion. Never made us feel like we were being a bother, and they had excellent information. The lobby is small, but that doesn't matter to us. LOCATION is key for this hotel. Right at Union Square, so all of the shopping and hustle and bustle. Straight, easy walk to/from the BART station so we paid the $8.10 each way for the airport train. Also straight, easy walk to catch the F streetcar to get to Fisherman's Wharf, Pier 39, etc. I suggest getting a 3-day pass (or 7 if you're there that long). You just flash it to the driver and can ride any bus, cable car, or streetcar. Very handy. I also suggest doing some free San Fran city guide tours. Google them. We did one of China Town (close to hotel) and it was very interesting and well worth the time. I felt safe around the hotel, but there are a ton of homeless people and con artists. Also some street musicians. You can choose to ignore them or you can give them some change. No one got up in our face. We walked to the BART station at 5:45am to catch a train to the airport on Monday, and encountered no issues whatsoever. If you are going to a 49ers game, it is SUPER EASY and the concierge can tell you which bus to catch (1.5 blocks from the hotel). Starbucks is across the street from the entrance. Another around the corner, so we used the free itnernet there. (the hotel charges TOO MUCH) A liquor store close by, and also a Walgreens, so easy to grab some refreshments for the mini fridge in the room. We did not check out the exercise room. We did not have a car to park. We were very pleased with this hotel, for the price we paid.

Reviews.Title: “great experience and the concierge ROCKS!”
Reviews.Author: lebh2o
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Grand Hyatt last week for a conference. Room was very clean and loved the remote blinds feature. What was the best part about the hotel? The concierge desk went above and beyond with suggestions and recommendations that absolutely made our "off time" great! Simply stopped by to get directions for a good place to eat dinner and ended up going to the opening night of the Broadway play "Hair", front row seats, for a great price thanks to the wonderful concierge desk! In my opinion, this kind of service is what sets this hotel apart from the rest.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, beautiful views, noisy”
Reviews.Author: RVJV1985
Reviews.Content: Very large hotel, with friendly staff. Right in the center of Union Square and easy to get to from SFO via the BART train ($8 train trip as opposed to a $50 cab ride). Easy to walk to many great places in San Fran, including lots of hills. The rooms were lovely, clean and amazing views of the city and/or bay. The only negative was noise that made it hard to sleep. Of course there's city street noise, nothing can be done about that. However, the first night I was in a room that was a "connecting room" and I could hear my inconsiderate, loud neighbors as if they were in the room with me. The second night I changed rooms and heard a loud mechanical noise all night long that I imagine was the elevator. Bring ear plugs and all will be perfect.

Reviews.Title: “The Grand Hyatt was great”
Reviews.Author: mburtonslc
Reviews.Content: My husband and I recently extended a business trip to San Francisco into a short vacation, and stayed at the Grand Hyatt on Stockton Ave. It was a great experience. The room was modern, large enough for our comfort. The staff was very helpful. The location was great--just across the street from Union Square. A great value, particularly since the rates we got through Trip Advisor were better than I was quoted by our local travel agent. I highly recommend it. Our next trip to SF will include a stay at the Grand Hyatt.

Reviews.Title: “Grandviews and great rooms”
Reviews.Author: travelmystic
Reviews.Content: Just stayed at the fully remodeled Grand Hyatt in SF last weekend and really liked the new look of the rooms. We had a room on the 24th floor with views of the Starlight room and the city. The room was a generous size with a great bed, good linens, Ipod docking station, marble bathroom, etc. My sisters corner room on the same floor was even larger with a separate dressing area. The bar & restaurant on the top floor has excellent views of the Golden Gate Bridge, Alcatraz, Coit Tower and the Bay. I live in the Bay Area and have to say this is one of the best views in the city. The easy parking across the street at the Stockton Street garage was $26 for 24 hours (no in or out). The Grand Hyatt is on the corner above Union Square so shopping, great restaurants, Theaters, etc are all easy walking distance. The main entrance to Chinatown is one block away. A car is not needed unless you want to go out to the DeYoung Museum, etc.

Reviews.Title: “Re-Done rooms, what's next?”
Reviews.Author: goninety54
Reviews.Content: Spent 3 nights at the Grand Hyatt, SF. Rooms have been completely re-done and are VERY nice. Super comfy king beds, nice large flat screen TV's, and very modern. The lounge on the 36th floor offers great views for drinks in the evening and then again at breakfast. Close to everything. Staff was great and very helpful.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT HOTEL, GREAT LOCATION!”
Reviews.Author: LLaker
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed for 5 nights on a holiday with my mother. The hotel was terrific from check in to check out. We had a georgeous room on the 25th floor, newly renovated with top notch ammenities. Being on the 25th floor we did not find noise to be an issue, and we never had to wait for an elevator. The location is superb right in the heart of Union Square, close to shopping, restaurants, streetcars and cablecars. The concierge desk was fantastic about giving us tips and pointers on what to do in SF. I would highly recommend this hotel, and would be happy to stay again at the Grand Hyatt SF.

Reviews.Title: “not much to say but class act”
Reviews.Author: stampmouse
Reviews.Content: great room, I was on the 10th floor (not the best view I would say) for the nike womens marathon. Union square is pretty much right out the door. great shopping near by. Public transporation was easy to get to and get around with. The conceirge desk was extremely helpful in directing to activties, places to eat and transporation. the bed alone will make you never want to leave very comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Nicely renovated room, good location”
Reviews.Author: travelm0m64
Reviews.Content: Newly renovated room was great - modern and clean with a huge bathroom. This is a very convenient location with Starbucks right across the street, Union Square and shopping all around and easy access to Chinatown. The gym is also a standout. It has all of the expected cardio machines, which by the way, offer an amazing view from the 35th floor. In addition, it has a lot of free weights, exercise balls, mats, etc. The only reason I gave this hotel 4 stars instead of 5 is that the lobby is nothing special. There's really no place to sit and visit. Also, the choice of bars and restaurants within the hotel is very limited. There is a bar/restaurant on the top floor with spectacular views. However, the menu is limited and pricy. There are many fine restaurants and bars within walking distance, though.

Reviews.Title: “contemporary stay for a contemporary chick :)”
Reviews.Author: hkosovich
Reviews.Content: i recently stayed here for 6-day business trip. I was given a corner room on 17th floor - #1708. While i loved my stay, comfy, cozy.. having starbucks across the street, union square 1-block away, macy's cheesecake factory and rice-a-roni trolley cars, the one negative is that dam whistle. Oh well, someone has to keep earplugs in business. Definitely check out the AMAZING gym on the 35th floor (turn left and go thru doors to get into gym). Also, must have drink on the 36th floor - little pricey but awesome views. Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “RENOVATED, CLEAN, MODERN & BEST LOCATION!”
Reviews.Author: LetsPack!
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Grand Hyatt the second week of October, 2011 with my husband and 4 year old son. I had stayed here years ago and must say that the renovations are amazing. The hotel interior is stunning. If you are into the ultra modern style - this is the place for you. Our room was on the 32nd floor club level and was gorgeous. It was not huge, but we had laminate floors and a view of the bay. The bathroom lacked a tub which I always wish for, but I think space is limited in these tower like hotel structures in the city. The bathroom was ultra modern with the raised sink and plentiful Portico toiletries. The bed was very comfortable. The flat panel TV and all amenities were perfect, including the electric sun shade on the ceiling to floor windows, and modern bed lamps attached to the bed posts. They delivered a DVD player for our son at no charge. The problems: Oh Boy! We picked a terrible time to go there since they had an employee strike every day that we were there. The employees were shouting (no screaming) on the street level - and we could hear it from our room on the 32nd floor up until 10pm!!!! It was terrible! They actually even ran into my husband on two separate occasions when we exited the hotel! They shouted at us not to check in on the 1st day too. They kept crossing the line that was drawn out for them on the pavement. It was very rude and unruly!The DVD Player took 2 hours to arrive at our room. The front desk lied to us - (as admitted by their own engineer who said he told them he could not find a DVD player and was looking for one). They told us he would be there in 10 minutes. Well try explaining the lies to a 4 year old 2 hours later as we are stuck waiting in the room! The room service was not the greatest either. This was obviously an exception since we have never had this kind of problem in the past - and they were seriously low on staff with everyone picketing outside. They should have just been honest about things. We also got our room 2 hours after we arrived with the manager's apologies. The club lounge was wonderful. It had private areas to get work done, have a private meeting or just relax. It is beautifully designed. The breakfasts were delicious, as well as the evening snacks and drinks. We also had dinner at the GrandViews Restaurant. They have a breathtaking view, and the service was wonderful. They were extremely accomodating in finding us a perfect table. We had invited another family to have dinner with us. The food was extremely disappointing though. I am not a picky eater, but the pasta was like simple boiled pasta with canned tomato stew on top, and the fish dishes were embarrassing! If you read my other reviews you will see that I can eat at the Four Seasons or McDonalds - again I am not picky, BUT the food we were served was truly pathetic. We were in a great location with good friends and good service, so I never complained. The location of the hotel is PERFECT! We were close to everything. The friendly concierge helped us with all reservations including the open top blue bus tour for 2 days which enabled us to see and tour everywhere.. Whether you are into shopping, dining or touring - this is the location to be. Absent the strike of the employees - we were very happy and would return in a heart beat!

Reviews.Title: “small but standard”
Reviews.Author: kellogs_kid
Reviews.Content: We had a king size bed on the 6th floor. The room was very modern. The washroom pieces were very modern. The shower head could not be adjusted to spray water out to the middle of the tub. I had to bend my head right next to the wall to get wet. The room was small but acceptable. The view was poor. We looked out at the side of a white building. The was a french balcony, but the sliding door could not open. The room was clean and quiet. We found the mattress was too soft. It caused some back aches. The internet was under $20 per 48 hours which is pretty standard. The gym was on the top floor and had a great view. It was a 1st class gym with very good equipment. There is no extra cost for the gym. The housekeeping was good and the front desk staff was fine. The kids loved the candies that were at the front desk. There was a housekeeping strike while we were there, but it did not affect us. Parking is scary expensive. Its in a building across the street. The location of the hotel is ideal. There are lots of shops and restaurants right at the door. Market street,Macy's,Saks,Union square are less than a 5 minute walk away.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: PJZinLA
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the hotel for a work event in October. Large room, great design, very comfortable. I liked the design so much I took some pics for decorating ideas at home. Staff were helpful and prompt. Great location as well. We have stayed at the Westin St Francis in the past and the Hyatt is considerably nicer in my book.

Reviews.Title: “Modern with Great Service”
Reviews.Author: WarmTradewinds
Reviews.Content: I found the service impeccable, from valet service, to entering the lobby, to checking in, to being shown the way to the elevators, to everyone in the restaurant and lounge. I was surprisingly pleased with how modern the room was -- very nice. It included electrically-controlled blinds, headboard with reading lamps, and very stylish hardware in the bathroom.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful and Comfortable room”
Reviews.Author: dfodor
Reviews.Content: We loved the modern yet natural decor. Super cozy and comfy beds. Beautiful modern bathroom Friendly staff

Reviews.Title: “Older location that has been kept up well”
Reviews.Author: Creengr
Reviews.Content: I liked the hotel and the rooms and lobby were modern and new. Do not miss the floor from the top floor.. absolutely great. There are only few smallish reasons this hotel did not get 4 or 5 stars. First and foremost there were sewer vapors coming from one of the bathroom fixtures resulting a quite foul odor. As long as I kept the bathroom door closed the rest of the room was okay. Price was another issue. We had a group corporate rate for a function being held in the hotel. Despite this we still paid what I would have consider to be top dollar. Other than that the stay was great. The bed was one of the best I have come across in a hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Grand Hyatt San Francisco Wonderful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: thespottedtraveler
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel for a conference at the convention center... having stayed at several downtown San Francisco hotels over the last year for various conferences I can say that this hotel was excellent. 4 people working the check in on a very busy weekend. The Nike womens marathon was happening down the street and the Hyatt was one of the main hotels. Check in was smooth and seamless. My room was ready at noon and early check in was no problem. The room was clean and spacious, plenty of room for our bags in the closet. King bed with 6 pillows, desk area, sitting chair with ottoman, nice bathroom, very clean and well maintained, large closet for bags. Room was a standard king room, the bed extremely comfortable and came with a mini fridge, and coffee maker. The floor to ceiling windows gave us a wonderful view of the park where the marathon stuff was going on and the view of the city at night was breathtaking. Our room was cleaned every day promptly and nothing was stolen or "misplaced". The hotel restaurant has good food and a killer view of the bay. The service is excellent but as you suspect a little pricey, but most things are in San Francisco! Worth going up for cocktails at night their bar area is hopping with the best views of the city, and they make killer drinks! Doormen are very exceptional, hailing cabs, giving directions, and in general being interested in making your stay excellent!! Room service- on time and food was hot. Only detraction from this hotel is that wi-fi is NOT free. Overall I would definitely stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Time!”
Reviews.Author: JASONDOD
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed here for 6 nights. I used a suite upgrade and was given an awesome hospitality suite on the 32nd floor with views to the east. The room was nicely appointed and clean. The one bad thing the suite had no bath tub. I asked the front desk about this as I was traveling with an 11 month old and later that afternoon a Hyatt employee knocked on our door with a baby bath tub filled with toys and accessories. AWESOME! The location is great too, walking distance to everything and great public transportation.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Remodel, if you can get a deal.”
Reviews.Author: NYCJoePItt
Reviews.Content: Remodeled room was excellent and comfy. They put me in handicap accessible room without asking me first. I hate when they do that. Those high toilets are uncomfortable. The elevators are really slow, couldn't figure out why. The dining room on the 36th floor was decent for breakfast and reasonable for what goes these days. The front desk was mostly helpful, but sometimes copped an attitude. For such a nice place, they need to finish getting their act together.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location in DT SF”
Reviews.Author: Nicole S
Reviews.Content: This hotel is perfect in terms of it's location. The gym is up to date with new equipment and has an amazing view of downtown San Francisco from the 35th floor. The restaurant on the 36th floor has great food and an even better panoramic view. The rooms were a touch on the small side, but we only needed it for sleep so it wasn't a problem for us. The front door men were always so friendly, accommodating and knowledgable. This hotel was very central and at max. a 10 minute cab ride to anywhere we wanted to go. The housekeeping staff were very friendly. We really enjoyed our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Construction issues. Bonus point for service.”
Reviews.Author: vanbecky
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for two nights in Oct 2011. While this hotel has been updated recently, you can tell it's a bit aged underneath it all. Our room was very comfortable, except for the constant construction surrounding Union Sq, which our room overlooked. We're talking 2:30 a.m. construction noise. Yeah, we were not impressed at all! If you are staying here after construction has finished (no idea when that will be, it's a big project) then you'll probably be happy. Until then, make sure they do not put you in any of the rooms overlooking the square. After calling down at 2:30 they offered to comp our bar charges, which was nice, but the issue remains for the next guest and the next. We gave them 4/5 here because of the quick response to the complaint, and because they very kindly let us store bags with them for an afternoon/evening two days after we checked out. That was really fantastic. Also, taxis were a slight pain because consutrction made the area a mess, and depending on which direction you were going it could be slow. Sometimes it was better to walk a block or so and catch one on the next street up to avoid sitting in traffic for a long time.

Reviews.Title: “Best place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Deanjgendron
Reviews.Content: I recommend the Grand Hyatt to anyone going to San Fran. The accommodations are very current, the staff is exceptional, and the location couldn't be better. This hotel is perfect for personal or business

Reviews.Title: “Not a 5 star hotel”
Reviews.Author: mayetis
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the hyatt for almost a week. The location is great and the concierge and front desk try their best. When I made the reservation it mentioned 5 stars; but: roomservice is not available 24 hours minibars are empty housekeeping is very slow and not very detailed I am truly disapointed, I have stayed at other hyatt properties and the service is trully 5 stars. I feel I was charged a 5 star price for a 31/2 star service.

Reviews.Title: “fantastic stay”
Reviews.Author: LBMounty
Reviews.Content: we arrived very early in the morning after a night flight from hawaii and did not expect to be able to check in early, but the gentlemen behind the desk said our rooms were ready and not a problem. Our room was great with fantastic views of the city with floor to sealing windows, the bed was amazing and just what we needed after a 7hr flight with no sleep. the room is a very good size and the bathroom was well appointed and they had nice touches like complimentary toothpaste. The first morning we ventured out it was raining so we asked for an umbrella which was no problem we had a choice of large or small again a very nice touch. The bar on the 36th floor has the most amazing views of the city and is well worth a visit at sundown although i think the drinks are a bit expensive it was $28 for two cocktails and $36 for a bottle of wine, but a guess this is on par with most other large city's. the hotel is in a good location and a 30min walk from the fisherman's wharf and china town is just 5mins away. i will definitely be staying at this hotel again

Reviews.Title: “Needs more improvement”
Reviews.Author: Texaskitty6
Reviews.Content: Our room was very nice; however, we had to ask for a kingside bed as they had booked us into 2 doubles, despite our reservation. The hotel just underwent renovation and updates and it is apparent as soon as you enter the actual room. We had a corner room which was spacious, minimal, and clean. The refrigerator is a nice touch as well. The lobby needs work. There are very few places to sit and wait for people or rides & in a city of this size, many people are traveling with family or groups. There are no bathrooms available on main lobby floor & the restrooms downstairs were crowded due to conference attendees. Desk staff is, for the most part, not to friendly & seem to want to just get you to move on, even when slow. Baggage staff not much better, & though there are considerate staff, they are overshadowed by the others. The location is very good..great shopping, convenient transportation, and great restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic!”
Reviews.Author: ktdipaula
Reviews.Content: You can't ask for more. The Hyatt is centrally located, in Union Square, a block from the cable car stop, a few blocks from BART and on several main bus routes. The rooms were gorgeous. Recently renovated, we were completely impressed by the decor and spent a little too much time mesmerized by the window shades that were controlled by a button in the end table. Room also came with a minifridge (no mini bar, which I prefer because then you can't fit anything into the fridge!) We were also very excited by the view, until we were told about the restaurant on the 36th floor. Amazing!!! I didn't have too much interaction with the staff, but the little I did was wonderful. Everyone was pleasant and helpful. I'm trying hard to think of a negative to add, and am struggling to think of one. I'm not someone who gives 5 stars out easily, so please know that I was very impressed and would most definitely go back.

Reviews.Title: “Best bed I've ever slept in!”
Reviews.Author: dynahthirst
Reviews.Content: The newly-renovated Grand Hyatt was clean, comfortable, welcoming, and perfectly located. The newly-renovated rooms are stylish and warm. The staff was helpful at all times, even with three demonstrations happening on their doorstep. The bar on the 36th floor had an incredible view and was an excellent way to end a long day out sight-seeing. An even better end to a long day was the luxurious, king-sized bed! It was like slipping into a cloud every night and made it hard to get up and start the next day. We just wanted to stay in that bed!

Reviews.Title: “Great Experience”
Reviews.Author: Cyril59
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 4 nights at the Grand Hyatt. We had a great view of the skyline and the bay. We were celebrating a birthday that weekend and the Hyatt sent us a complimentary bottle of wine and food platter the 1st night. That kicked off 4 great days. We were lucky and caught a fleet week air show over the bay and a Columus Day Parade in North Beach. The rooms have been updated since we were here in 2008 and the Hyatt did a great job. The room was very clean and the front desk was very helpful. It is a great location and good hotel

Reviews.Title: “Lots of Plusses!”
Reviews.Author: TMLAalum
Reviews.Content: Location is excellent and the views from the Grandview Restaurant and Lounge are breathtaking. The recent renovation is well done- love the remote control windowshade and the babybath size sink. We were on a lower floor- room 606 and unlike other reviewers weren't bothered by noise of neighbors and fully expect to hear city noises in a city. Prices in the Grandview lounge are relatively reasonable for a bar menu that equates to lunch-size portions. Wish that there were a couple more eating options like a coffee/breakfast/snack bar. Also there aren't any vending machines in the hotel, so hard to grab a bottle of water or a soft drink before setting out for a day of sightseeing.

Reviews.Title: “Paper Thin Walls”
Reviews.Author: YadiDadi
Reviews.Content: The location is great. The rooms are extremely nice and well appointed. The only complain would be the noise. The walls are paper thin. We could hear everything in the hallways every time someone was near our room. Street noise was also bothersome, but likely due to our being on a low floor. Overall, it's a good hotel if you go the Priceline route, but not worth the standard rate compared to other hotels in the area.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Nice Renovation, Very Nice Service”
Reviews.Author: STYLEONTHEGO
Reviews.Content: Surprisingly good experience at this large hotel right off Union Square. Set at the top of Stockton Street and surrounded by great shopping and dining, this is the choice among the big chain hotels in the downtown/financial district area at this service category. The staff are very curteous and pleasant, from the reception desk to the concierge team. The rooms, though not large, have been nicely and comfortably renovated and feature nice amenities like a fridge, large flat panel TV, window shades that work, and great bath products. The hotel property is definitely showing its age and despite the renovation, which has not yet extended to the public areas, doesn't feel as crisp or fresh as other Hyatt properties but if you're looking for a great location with many of the city's top locations within easy walking distance and great views (be sure to check out the bar on the 36th floor), this is the place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great view, great service.”
Reviews.Author: BartFargo
Reviews.Content: Had an excellent three night stay here, the room was clean and quiet and all of my interactions with the staff were excellent. The floors are divided into four sectors or clusters of rooms so you don't get that oppressive long-hallway hotel feel, which is nice. My only complaint is that the room layout is a little weird but other than that it was recently redone with modern finishes and looked great.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful rooms. Still owe me $610!”
Reviews.Author: Joss48
Reviews.Content: Stayed july 2011. Excellent location if you want down town. wonderfully, relaxing rooms. Reception desk staff were distant and standoffish. Must see veiw from top floor restaurant/bar. Messed up my credit card by charging too many things on one day so bank stopped it, then they charged me twice! Writing this on 11 oct and still no refund. Not impressed with the customer service either. Lovely hotel spoilt by people who work there. I will update this when I get a refund.

Reviews.Title: “Best location in town.”
Reviews.Author: gizm0sm0m
Reviews.Content: I liked everything about this hotel. It has recently been renovated so the rooms are clean and bright. There is lots of storage space, a small fridge, a safe big enough to hold both of our laptops, nice big windows. The bed was comfortable, the location is fantastic...just steps away from Union Square. The staff were all friendly and accommodating. The room was made up promptly each day. The only very, very minor annoyance was the noise through the adjoining door. If you can get a room without one of those it would be as close to perfect as a hotel can get!

Reviews.Title: “Great start to our first USA trip!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Vess45
Reviews.Content: We are a family with 2 young children, so we decided to stay in the heart of this beaufitul city of San Francisco, as this was our firt trip to USA. We picked to stay at Grand Hyatt simply becasue it was affordable and after reading many of the reviews if was an easy decission. SO here is what we though about our stay at Grand Hyatt. Staff at the hotel was outstanding, very helpfull and always willing and able to answer all of out questions. Concierge staff we especially helpfull (one in partucular, from memory i think his name was Tom), he helped us organise our day tours and tickets to the Alkatraz. Rooms: We had a pleasure at staying in one of high flood rooms (2919) and we loved it. The view was just breath taking overlooking Union Square. Decor was modern and very sleek. Beds were very comfourtable which really help to have a good nights rest after a very long day of exploaring the city. Each morning we had our breakfast at the floor restaurant and the food was fantastic. Service was just as great. And the view amazing!!!! So thank you to everyone at Grand Hyatt for the start to our holiday to be one very unfogetfull and plasurable experience. If we come again to San Francisco we will definitelly be choosing Grand Hyatt as our accomodation. We loved every day we spent there!!!! Thank you!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great service”
Reviews.Author: CJPJ
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for business for two nights at the end of September. The location is great--right next to Union Square (I could see it from my window) and great shopping, yet close to the financial district, good restaurants and a short taxi ride from the Ferry Terminal. Fisherman's Wharf was a few minutes by taxi. The cable car was just a few blocks away. Check in was great-- ultra friendly and helpful. My room was on a high floor and had a fantastic view over Union Square and could see bits of the bay. They have these new electronic window shades which were really cool. The room was obviously recently refurbished--flat screen TV, funky orange and beige bathroom (the sink looked like a baby bathtub sitting on the orange glass counter). The decor was in beiges and oranges and was crisp and modern. There was even a clock radio (it may have been an iPod docking station also but I didn't have an iPod so did not really notice). The only thing that was a little disappointing was that there was a balcony but I could not open the door. I callled downstairs and they said someone could come up and open it for me. It seemed that this was the only way to access the balcony. Since I just wanted to snap a photo I declined. I think the balconies are from the 80s or something and the railings appear to be kind of low so it seemed like a safety issue. But really, the view from the nearly floor to ceiling window was spectacular enough without going out on the balcony so I did not mind. One evening my colleagues and I went upstairs to the bar on the 36th floor for drinks-- great view from up there! I did not eat in the hotel so could not comment on that. Taxis were readily available upon checkout. The doorman tried to get us to "upgrade" to a black town car and it seemed like he had some sort of "arrangement" with these cars but we just took a yellow taxi. I would highly recommend this hotel and the city of San Francisco!

Reviews.Title: “Ideal location”
Reviews.Author: UtOpia210
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for four nights and paid extra to use the "Club" facilities. The room we were allocated was on the 31st floor and was newly refurbished to a high standard. The hotel is well located for both shopping and access to the MUNI transport system. ( We paid $21 for a three day pass) The club area is located on the 26th floor and has full length windows overlooking the Bay and Alcatraz. Breakfast was freshly prepared and of the continental type. Tea, coffee and soft drinks were available all day and from 5pm until 9pm canapes followed by desserts are served. Alcoholic drinks are available from an honesty bar. Wine and beer cost $3 while spirits cost $4. After a long day sightseeing it was a welcome respite to relax and have a nibble and a drink while enjoying the views of The Bay.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice location and hotel”
Reviews.Author: Prefer5Stars
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 1 night for business. Location is right in the middle of Union Square so it is convenient to all. The hotel itself is very nice and staff is very friendly and helpful. The decor is updated with nice amenities. I had a fantastic view of the square and the noise level was very minimal. I do plan on returning to this location so that I may enjoy all that they have to offer.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Doooood
Reviews.Content: Right on Union Square, in the heart of downtown San Francisco. Easy to get to anywhere in the city from the Grand Hyatt - there is a BART station at Union Square, and the cable car line is across the street. The hotel itself is very nice. Rooms are recently renovated, nice workout facilities, and a bar on the top floor with nice views of downtown. The only potential downside I could see for people staying at this hotel is that since the hotel is in a high-traffic area, there is a lot of street noise that can be heard from your hotel room (we were on the 12th floor). On our vacation we also stayed a few nights in Fisherman's Wharf and it was much quieter there.

Reviews.Title: “Simply Excellent!”
Reviews.Author: dcslatts
Reviews.Content: The experience matches the expectation. You expect a great hotel, a great room and a receptive and friendly staff. You get all of this with a central downtown location. Modern decor and amenities in the refurbished room I had on the 14th floor including iPhone and USB ports on the bedside radio and lots of charging outlets. Will definitely be back!

Reviews.Title: “Central Location for SF”
Reviews.Author: WiltshireDruid
Reviews.Content: Usual high-end corporate luxury hotel, very comfortable. That said it suits holiday makers as well who do not feel out of place. Location is great, right on Union Square, so all the major shopping outlets in SF are no more than 2 blocks walk any direction (Macy's, Barney's designer stores). We had no need of a car when staying here for 3 days, it is one block from a stop on 2 SF cable car routes and on bus routes as well. 5 mins walk to Market Street where many department stores are situated, and a further bus routes to Fisherman's Wharf and Pier 39 etc. To get to the waterfront at Pier 39 on public Transport takes 20 minutes including waiting and walking to bus / cable car stops! The down-town car hire return area for all firms, is an easy 3 blocks walk from the hotel. Don't breakfast in hotel, a Lori's diner is 1 block away and this is great value and fun, use it! Dinner should be in any one of a huge choice of restaurants within 2 blocks of this hotel, but use the hotel bar on the 36th floor before you go out. Fantastic views ove rthe whole city right down to the bay and Alcatraz (and the GG bridge if you crane your neck!), it has a good feeling to it Staff were friendly and helpful, probably more so than usual because we arrived on day 7 of a strike of housemaids which had a noisy demonstration outside the hotel for a few hours. Overal a great location for SF city, and a $16 shuttle ride to SFO airport.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Stop”
Reviews.Author: wesoc
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 3 nights in June 2011. The room was small, but it was updated very well and had great views of the city. We tried to print our boarding passes but were told we had to pay :( Overall the stay was pleasent and we had no problems

Reviews.Title: “Great location!”
Reviews.Author: Sauce_Diesel
Reviews.Content: I can't comment on pricing (was there on business) but the location was amazing. Right beside Union Square with walking distance to all kinds of shopping and amazing restaurants. There was a strike going on but the staff on site worked hard to ensure that guests weren't disrupted. The Concierge desk was very helpful and provided great advice on local eateries, etc. The on site gym is very good with everything you could need. The service in the lounge on the top floor did leave something to be desired so would not recommend spending any time/money there - especially given the fact that there are so many great bars and restaurants within easy walking distance.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the hotel !”
Reviews.Author: Pepperridge
Reviews.Content: Love this hotel and I work for their competitor!! There was a strike going on and I cannot say enough about how accommodating the staff was.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: eeliechick
Reviews.Content: Great location although a little overpriced for this hotel. It has been recently renovated which was nice however the rooms are very small. Was not happy about the staff striking outside of the hotel from 6am to 10.30pm eachday! We could hear the noise which woke me up & delayed us getting to sleep at night, the best staff could offer were ear plugs which I thought was poor customer service!

Reviews.Title: “perfect hotel, perfect location...”
Reviews.Author: tmorty49
Reviews.Content: This hotel offered every thing we were looking for in our vacation. The location on Union Square was ideal, the newly renovated rooms were spacious, and our view on the 27th floor was perfect. I loved the remote control shade in the room...Superb idea!

Reviews.Title: “Renovation just misses being great”
Reviews.Author: Stephen999123
Reviews.Content: I stayed in the recently renovated hotel. Most of the renovations are great. In addition to comfortable beds and directed bed reading lights, the window shade can be operated from the bed. There were a few negatives, especially in the bath. The sink takes up a lot of the counter and there are no drawers, so the vanity can get cluttered with toiletry items. The rain shower head can not be tilted, so you end up standing very close to the wall to get the full stream of water. Perhaps the biggest issue was the lack of drawer space in the room. What looks like a chest of drawers contains a small refrigerator and a safe. There are 3 very small drawers in the closet, which takes up room that could hold suitcases. So the suitcases end up in the room.

Reviews.Title: “Grander Than Expected”
Reviews.Author: Tellurian
Reviews.Content: Unable to secure reservations at the nearby Hyatt Regency Embarcadero because of a convention, my husband and I opted to give the Grand Hyatt a try. Having booked 2 award nights, we were only entitled to a standard 2-double bedded room on a low floor. Upon arrival however, our Platinum level membership in the Hyatt Gold Passport program was acknowledged and we were upgraded to a king-bedded room-with-a-view on the 30th floor. Any lingering disappointment we may felt with settling for our second choice hotel disappeared. The recently-renovated room served as a plush eyrie for the finale of our California vacation. We enjoyed our stay, although the high tech room fittings may need some adjustments; you can control lights and the electric window shade from both bedsides; during the wee hours of our second night, we were awakened twice by the lights coming on and shade going up inexplicably. We could find no way that either one of us had tripped the buttons, but since we were departing at an ungodly hour for an early flight, we never pursued it further beyond a post-stay email to management to note the glitch.

Reviews.Title: “Overpriced”
Reviews.Author: Joy2Paris_France
Reviews.Content: Strange hotel with no lobby so to speak - friends meeting me at the hotel had to stand up near the doorway. Fabulous location in the heart of Union Square shopping district. The room is very nice and the view is spectacular. I did not have breakfast nor use room service. The hotel is totally overpriced, very impersonal as is the staff.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect!!!”
Reviews.Author: VassarJean
Reviews.Content: We took BART from the airport to Powell Street and then walked the 4 blocks to the hotel- very convenient. Rooms are very well-appointed and have been recently redone. Appreciated having a coffee maker and refrigerator in the room and having the reading lights by the side of the bed and the darkening shade for the window that was controlled from the bedside. We had a nice view of Union Square from our 24th floor room and could have also seen the water if the fog had not been so thick!!! We booked a AAA rate that included breakfast which ended up to be a $50 credit each day for breakfast. That more than covered the cost of the buffet plus part of the tip. I think the buffet was about $23 pp, but was very good and included eggs, meats, cereals, fruits, oatmeal, yogurt, granola and breads with french toast, pancakes and waffles made to order. They had a scrambled egg with chorizo that was wonderful. There was also a separate breakfast menu to order from. I tried the Orange Brioche French Toast one morning that I can still taste. Also, complimentary papers each morning by the elevators. Everything about the hotel, including the location, is perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: dawisemd
Reviews.Content: Was here for a conference in late August. Nicely located just off Union Square. Given a room on the 32nd floor which offered nice views, although the views are much better on the side facing east. Rooms are comfortable and clean. Wi-fi about $10/day.

Reviews.Title: “Great location for SF shopper!”
Reviews.Author: rokalada
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 4 nights in August/Sept while my husband attended a conference. We went for the "Regency Club" rooms, so that I would have a place to go for breakfast in the mornings, and they had a cocktail setup there in the evenings. I recommend paying a little more for this - a nice lounge, great breakfast buffet, and appetizers/desserts in the evening. Our first night at the hotel, we had the misfortune of having a crying baby in the next room on the other side of a connecting door! Admittedly, not the hotel's fault, but at my request, they did move us to another room on the same floor the next day. It had a connecting door, too, but that was to a suite that was not in use, so it was blissfully quiet and looked down on Union Square and out at Mount Sutro with a sliver of a Bay view. My biggest complaint about this hotel is their elevators. Usually, buildings that are as many floors have two banks of elevators - one for the lower floors and one for the upper floors. The Hyatt has 8 or 10 elevators, and they all go to the 30-something floors. Also, don't bring a car and valet park. It was something we had to do with plans ahead of and behind our stay here, but we paid for it. The first night, we did valet, and after that, it was put at the self-park option. The staff at the hotel was unfailingly wonderful, from the front desk people, to the servers upstairs, the concierge, and the room attendants --- all top notch and all noticeably happy to be working there. Kudos to John, the concierge and the front desk person from Peru (was his name Roberto -no, but it was something like that-sorry for forgetting) for giving that little extra bit of service that made us feel special! The young man from Peru even took me back into my old room to search for a missing item, which I later found tucked into something I had packed. What an asset he is to Hyatt!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: RACCAustralia
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this Hotel in Dec 2010 with a family of 5, 3 adults 2 childlren for 5 nights. We chose the "Club Rooms" to get higher floors and access to the club lounge. We booked months prior and I am sure we were given the 2 smallest rooms in the hotel. We had a queen bed and a single rollout up against the window and could barely move. We were unable to get a Kettle or anything to heat water for a cup of tea, something you cannot easily get anywhere in Amercian hotels. The club rooms was good for breakfast and late afternoon snacks but not alot of choice for snacks. Don't go there expecting food, its snacks. The Hotel has ONE great thing going for it and its the lcoation. You walk out the door and within 30 seconds you are at Macy's, Tiffany's, hop on/off buses and the famous Ice rink. It is also walking distance to great resturants and we felt VERY SAFE walking with young children and Grandma each night. I am not sure if i would stay there again as I know they have better rooms but we certainly had no chance of getting one. The hotel was under Renovation so perhaps when ALL ROOMS have been done it may be better but the rooms we had were just so small.

Reviews.Title: “Fine hotel for business travel...”
Reviews.Author: leom5558
Reviews.Content: I have stayed here on business several times and it is perfectly adequate. I find breakfast to be rediculously expensive... The rooms are fine. Location is excellent, and it is very close to the Ferry Building which has some nice places to eat and a great wine bar.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, great view”
Reviews.Author: BMW_KY
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Grand Hyatt on a recent business trip. My expectations were high going into my stay and the Grand Hyatt met my expectations. I was greeted promptly at check-in and welcomed by the desk staff; very personable and friendly. My room was on the 27th floor overlooking Union Square...great view through the floor to ceiling windows! Amenities were good, room was clean, bed was comfortable. My only small complaint was the bathtub and shower head. Hotels in a similar class often have deep soaking tubs which are nice after the walking you are likely to do in San Francisco. Shower left a bit to be desired, not sure if it was the shower head or the water pressure. Top floor restaurant and bar was nice; average food, strong drinks, great views in every direction. Overall I would stay at the Grand Hyatt again and would recommend for others, particularly business travelers or couples.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel”
Reviews.Author: BirminghamGooch
Reviews.Content: Really enjoyed our stay here,judging by some of the previous comments was a bit worried about what we were about to find. It's a modern high rise and we were on the 26th floor.the room looked brand new with the furnishings and wide screen tv. Staff were helpful and the hotel is ideally situated just off Union Sq. We walked down to Fishermans Wharf and caught the cable car back which dropped us just around the corner of the hotel. would definatly stay here again and would recommend to anyone. Ps large modern gym on the 32nd floor with amazing views across the bay onto Alcatraz.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice and Good Location”
Reviews.Author: MDtravelertoo
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here after fretting for weeks over which hotel to choose in San Francisco. I knew it was a chain and wouldn't have "local flavor", but also knew it would have good size rooms and we'd avoid the "boutique but tiny" conditions at some others. I am happy with my decision. The rooms are newly remodeled and very comfortable. Having an in-room fridge is also a nice benefit not found in many others. We got a great deal here through AAA that included the buffet breakfast daily, which normally would have been @$25/person. The buffet was nice and you could also order pancakes, belgian waffles, or eggs to order if desired. Filling up on this meal allowed us to go without lunch and saved us a bundle! Great location, as much of San Francisco is within walking distance. Concierge staff was most helpful and pleasant. You can't go wrong staying here.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location, Modern Updates”
Reviews.Author: Yipee43
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for two nights during Labor Day weekend with my boyfriend. The front desk staff happily accommodated our request for a room near our friends. We stayed on the 26th floor, which had great views. The rooms facing the Bay are probably the best, but the view of Union Square is also very cool. Loved the bathroom sinks, reading lights, ipod charger plugs and the electric window shade that you can easily open and close while laying on the bed. Also really liked the modern decor and remodeled bathroom, with separate vanity area. The only con is how long it took to get an elevator Saturday morning around 10am. It took about 15 minutes, maybe longer. If you run into the same problem, just get on one that's going up and ride it back down to the lobby. That finally worked for us.

Reviews.Title: “excellent location great stay”
Reviews.Author: perrotta
Reviews.Content: Location Location Location! Nice rooms, very clean. Excellent view, loved the balcony. A balcony is a treat in San Fran. Out the door and you are in a great spot. Ferry building right there. Liked that we were left alone. You only saw staff if you needed something and then they were right there. Would stay again if my budget allowed, it is a little expensive.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and wonderful view”
Reviews.Author: Georgia C
Reviews.Content: Great hotel, gentle staff and very nice view. Complimentary coffee and amenities. The view of the top-floor bar and restaurant is amazing. Downside: the wi-fi is not free.

Reviews.Title: “Very sleek and well appointed rooms”
Reviews.Author: hoos90
Reviews.Content: The rooms have been redone since the last time we stayed here. They are very modern and well appointed. The hotel is quiet and comfortable despite being busy. The staff was very courteous.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay at the Hyatt”
Reviews.Author: miche26
Reviews.Content: Faultless stay at the Hyatt! We had a lovely room that had recently been refurbished so was very modern and clean, with the best bed ever! Great location too, good for shopping and restaurants, although because of our long day we ate in the Hotel restaurant on the top floor and were not disappointed. The service from Frank and team was fantastic, and the piano player in the bar afterwards was brilliant. Will definitely recommend this Hotel to anyone!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in good location..”
Reviews.Author: DoubleA_8
Reviews.Content: Enjoyed my stay here, very good hotel in good location. Would definitely recommend it to everyone.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel and Location”
Reviews.Author: Holiday2010oct
Reviews.Content: We stay at the hyatt for 4 nights from the 22nd to the 25th Aug, we are a family of 4 and our standard room was a good size for a city hotel, on checking in we asked for a room with a view and 'Ryan' was so helpful. We had a room on the 27th Floor with great views over the city and the bar on the top floor is a must for a late night drink the views are outstanding. All the staff that we dealt with were very helpful, the hotel is clean, the rooms are quite and the beds just so comfortable. The location is fantastic for restaurants, shopping, tram-line, we really enjoyed our stay and would recommend this hotel we can't wait to go back!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel, great location!!!”
Reviews.Author: ANNEGROVE
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Grand hyatt from 22nd -27th August, it was fabulous right from the start! Check in was quick and easy, we had a fabulous room on the 23rd floor, overlooking the city. Our room was recently refurbished, the room was very spacious with lovely matching bedding and curtains. We had an electronic blind which was super. Everywhere was lovely and clean. The bathroom was maybe a little small but that didnt really bother us. Plenty of hanging space for our clothes. The hotel itself was very clean, the lobby was very pleasant. All of the staff were very polite and helpful especially Elaine the conciege, who was very helpful to us. The location of the hotel was perfect, just a block away from Macys, saks, tiffanys and lots of great resturants nearby. China town was very close, we had an easy walk through Chinatown and on to Northbeach from there we found Lombard street, which we walked up and got some wonderful views of the city. I would definetly recommend the sightseeing hop on hop off bus, this was a great way of seeing the city highlights.Recommended restuarants: Lories diner, Maxs, Bubba Gumps and the Hard rock cafe. With such a fabulous city to explore it was great to know we had a lovely comfy bed to fall into at the end of a very busy and fun day. We would definetly stay at this hotel again it was brilliant!

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding Service and great location !”
Reviews.Author: Conchliver123
Reviews.Content: We have stayed in hotels all over the world and I must say the Hyatts are always number one hands down! This one location was in the middle of everything! Don't rent a car because not needed and parking is outrageous. Service was very impressive. Concierge really knowledgeable and seemed caring. The city itself was awesome and we will definitely go back again.

Reviews.Title: “loved it-would stay here again”
Reviews.Author: richar b
Reviews.Content: had 5 nts in this lovely hotel. excellent service, large very comfortable room, spotlessly clean. our room on the 8th floor had quite good views but not exceptional.
