The food and service on the 36th floor dining room was very good, and not much more expensive than some of the cheapish diners in the area. the hotel is only a block from Powell street, union square, and about 5 flat (ie no hills) blocks from chinatown leading into little italy. tip. buy the 7 day pass if you plan to use the cable cars-which charge $3.95 per journey. the Pass allows unlimited cable car rides and most of the trolley buses for the week. tip.if you want breakfast away from the hotel, go to Mamas, on the corner of Washington Square. It is quite a walk from the Hyatt, but the food is superb, prices are very reasonable. But-it is small and gets crowded. we had to wait for an hour to get in, and this was 10 in the morning. tip. lots of ways to get from SFO to city centre. we recommend just taking a standard taxi, which although will cost a bit more, is worth it as it will take you direct to your hotel in half the time of one of the other transfer methods. we would certainly go back to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great location!”
Reviews.Author: VT1984
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 4 nights in a 10th floor room: Positives: 1) Location - fantastic!! close to all the shops of union square and walkable to all attractions including Pier 33 for Alcatraz (approx 40 mins) 2) Clean room which had everything you needed 3) Helpful concierge - provided useful maps and books (which had discount vouchers for local stores) Negatives: 1) Check in took a long time as the woman serving us was rather confused about what she was doing and took a while to get the room Overall a very positive experience and a fantastic location for walking through a wonderful city.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel in a good location for Union Square”
Reviews.Author: honora44
Reviews.Content: I enjoyed my stay at the hotel and the service was up to Hyatt standards. As a Diamond member I was treated very well, however, they were very busy and not able to check us in for quite some time. The only downfall was the $42 valet parking. I will admit the valets were quick with getting you your car, but it is still not worth the money.

Reviews.Title: “we loved it and we'll be back”
Reviews.Author: Dr Richard O
Reviews.Content: We took the subway from the airport to the powell st station(9 bucks) and walked the 4 blocks to the hotel. We stayed in room 3105 a grand club room with access to the grand club on the 32nd floor. The view from our room on the 31st floor faced directly at the fishermans wharf, alcatraz island and bay which was awesome. The same view you get from the restaurant on the 36th floor. Check in was quick and efficient. Any of the 6 elevators are fast ! The room looked just as beautiful as the hyatt website which included a mini fridge, safe, full closet, very comfortable bed and electric shade controlled by a button by the bed and door. If you get a grand club room, you will have access to the grand club concierge room on the 32nd floor which opens at 6am to 9pm. It provides free hot breakfast with fresh fruit as well as beverages, in fact you can get coffee tea soda and juices all day. From 5-7pm there is hot hor duerves , vegetables, cheeses, bread and about 10 name brand liquors including beer and wine. Aside from the food, its a nice room to relax and enjoy the view of the bay. The staff out front will hail cabs for you. There is a starbucks across the st and another starbucks one block away on powell st across from the 24 hr walgreens that sells sandwhiches and grocery store type food. The cable car is one block away(powell/hyde line) and will take you to ghiradelli square/fishermans wharf district. We met numerous other people on the various tours we took and not too many liked thier hotel but, they all knew the grand hyatt was wonderful. Oh yeah, the water pressure was fine on the 31st floor. Personally, I think the lobby looks good no need to remodel it next year. The exercise room on the 35th floor was awesome with 4 treadmills 3-4 bikes and all new equipment for every muscle group, 30 to 40 dumbell free weights and TV screens everywhere and head sets and towels provided along with a small fridge next to the elevator of rolled chilled towelettes to wipe off the face and body after working out. We enjoyed the friendly concierge downstairs as well as the ones on the 32nd floor grand club. Thanks for a great vacation !

Reviews.Title: “Great location and hotel.”
Reviews.Author: oneslicetoomany
Reviews.Content: This was our first time to San Francisco and I went with my wife and 4 kids. The hotel was very centrally located to various shopping districts and restaurants, all within walking distance. The cable cars were simply 2 blocks away so we were never far away from too much. Check in and check out were easy and efficient and room was really perfect with 2 adjoining rooms. The only item that was missing was a pool - not sure why they didnt include one. Other than that, gym and restaurant on top floor were great too. Highly recommended ......

Reviews.Title: “A new touch of luxury in San Francisco”
Reviews.Author: yacineawt
Reviews.Content: The location was very good because Union Square is at walking distance. People were very polite and the service was good and effective. The rooms all have a plasma TV (which is important for some people). The view was my favorite part because you had a view of the buildings of San Francisco and The Transamerican Building

Reviews.Title: “A Room with a View”
Reviews.Author: Mezmerized
Reviews.Content: At the last minute, I booked a room at the Grand Hyatt. They've recently renovated with a clean, european lines but with a touch of Asian inspired colors and deco. Clean, comfy and fantastic service. Plus, I got a marvelous view of Union Square from my room. Great amenities like convenient bedside plugs; wireless internet (for a fee) and a push button electric shade for the windows.

Reviews.Title: “Will stay here next time I go to San Fran!”
Reviews.Author: monaboots
Reviews.Content: This is an awesome hotel. The location is perfect. Easy access to subway, bus, taxi, any other way you like to get around! Located in Union Square, there are many shops and restaurants within walking distance. The concierge desk was very helpful with planning tours and recommending restaurants/bars. The rooms are very clean and spacious. The beds are SOOO comfortable! The room made us feel like we could just relax. They had automatic window shades that you can activate from the bed! All employees we encountered were very nice, polite and helpful. Definitely a "Grand" Hyatt! Some negatives - the hotel is pricey (but I guess you get what you pay for). Breakfast is not included. They charge for w-fi / internet service. Overall, I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “So comfortable”
Reviews.Author: WEBA
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a weeks stay in this hotel, we booked a bay view room, the view was stunning, over the city to Alcatraz. The bed was ultra comfortable, best one we've ever had in a hotel. Location and staff were fantastic. Only thig we can grumble about is the ten dollar per day charge for wifi which when we all rely on it these days seems very expensive

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: traveltom11_11
Reviews.Content: My son and i stayed here last week on the second half of our vacation to the west coast.. It has been recently remodeled in a modern decor.Rooms are a tad small- but typical for a big city- Better than New York anyway! Beds were excellent and Comfortable. THere was a refrigerator and flat screen TV. The sink in the Bathroom was unique and looked like a mini porcelain tub! You got Floor to ceiling windows with Push Button Shades- we were on a higher floor so had great views! The views from those windows are A very nice feature. There is a great bar on the 36th floor and some evenings they have a piano player to entertain you. . The staff here was Great- The concierge staff particularly are knowledgeable, efficient, Friendly and helpful- Particularly Joanna and Ann- they were great! The location of this hotel is very convenient as it is only a block or 2 from the big department stores and only one block up to Powell St to the Cable car stop and Sears Restaurant . You can walk into Chinatown from here too! The Union Square area is the more traditional historic area to stay in when in SanFrancisco as opposed to the other main tourist area which is Fisherman's Wharf. I prefer this area of town over the wharf which is very touristy and crowded. Stay here and visit the wharf on one of the Two Cable Car lines. When you get back in the evening walk over a couple of blocks to Lefty Odouls bar and restaurant for a lively piano bar and Karoake!

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location, Location (aka you get what you pay for)”
Reviews.Author: SOPHIEGIRL
Reviews.Content: This hotel is pricey. Just like most luxury hotels they charge for everything other than your room- wi-fi, parking, in room movies, whatever. If you accept that going into your stay, chances are you will love this hotel! (if not, just look elsewhere, you will not be happy here.) I had a room on the 31st floor with a spectacular view...loved it. If you don't get a room with a water view, take yourself up to the 36th floor and splurge on a cocktail, breakfast, lunch, or even coffee and dessert. Worth whatever it costs - I particularly like breakfast, as you can watch the fog roll in/out over Alcatraz. Service throughout the hotel is courteous and professional...but be aware, this is not a small boutique hotel where everybody knows your name. It is huge hotel, and it may feel a little impersonal, but I thought I paid for excellent service and received it. For me, the location is all - easy to get everywhere, lots of fab shopping, great dining within a few blocks, EZ walk to Chinatown...I just don't think it can be beat. And when it is all said and done, that's what I am paying for - LOCATION. A helpful hint...price a room with access to the Club Lounge. It will cost, but includes breakfast, snacks, hor d'eourves, dessert and coffee, etc. There's even a cappuccino machine! When you add it all up, you may find the extra cost is more than worth it. An added benefit - the club is on the corner of the 32nd floor with 2 full walls of windows...spectacular view!

Reviews.AuthorLocation: Cape May Court House, New Jersey
Reviews.Title: “3 months later, and still thinking about the trip”
Reviews.Author: nonotravels
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for the Bay to Breakers race. Had a blast! Upgraded to a 1 br. suite (with second bathroom!). It had a lovely long balcony from which we could gaze at the clock tower and Bay Bridge. The standout memory though, was the customer service. In a property that big, it is nice when workers remember your name and greet you as you pull in to valet parking, or are just passing through the lobby. Nice touch! Also, the lobby bar had an excellent menu, and good mixologists, so we ended up spending more time there than we originally planned.

Reviews.Title: “Centrally located”
Reviews.Author: GTheo
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed here as a first stop in our California vacation. The hotel is beautiful, clean and modern. We had two connecting rooms, and with the doors opened felt like a nice family suite. There is a restaurant on the top floor with panoramic views of the city and Alcatraz Island. We had a very nice lunch on the day we arrived, and the prices were reasonable. The breakfast buffet is $22.50, but if you don't feel like splurging there is a Starbucks across the street, a bagel store down the block and Lori's Diner a few blocks away. The gym is clean but small so get there early if you want to secure a treadmill or elliptical. There are a few free weights and weight machines as well. The hotel is in a perfect location. It is within walking distance to a major shopping area, and the trolley. The staff at the front desk was so helpful. They printed walking directions for us to a Chinese restaurant, Fang, which wasn't so great. Also, Santorini, which is within walking distance wasn't good at all either. For a fun tour of the city check out Mr.Toad's Tours. A boat ride to Alcatraz can also be combined with the tour. Don't miss Ghiradelli Square or Fisherman's Wharf. While at the Square have lunch at McCormick & Kulleto's. The restaurant is in a great location and although a bit pricey, very good. At Fisherman's Wharf you can dine at In n' Out Burger, Hard Rock Cafe, Bubba Gump Shrimp and many other options. Also, make sure you make the drive to Muir Woods. Absolutely breathtaking. On the way back stop at Sausalito for some ice cream and a stoll at the marina.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and Friendly Hotel”
Reviews.Author: cjzubok
Reviews.Content: The hotel is situated on the corner of Union Square and a minute from Chinatown. It is in the heart of everything. Close to restaraunts, shops, and the transportation (trolley and the cable cars). The rooms are small but very clean. And the views are amazing. Note: currently the end of the lobby beyond the elevators is undergoing construction...so if you are traveling with kids there's NO lobby restroom to use so you have to go back to your room. That was the only thing that annoyed me. And of course they say "oh there's one on the 36 floor" while your kid is ready to pee everywhere. Anyway, service was quick and efficient. They were helpful staff. Of course valet is overpriced but its the same everywhere. $50. You are walking distance to market street where you can pick up a cable car. And Powell is right around the corner where you can pick up the trolley. Shower pressure is low so don't expect the water to be shooting out at you. They provide a blow dryer which is awesome and a refigerator at no extra cost which is totally great for bringing snacks and drinks. I would definetely stay here again when in San Francisco. I would not stay near the Wharf even though it was fun to walk around there best to stay where all the action is in Union Square.

Reviews.Title: “Not impressed....”
Reviews.Author: KB2010
Reviews.Content: I decided to book the Grand Hyatt after an excellent stay at the Grand Hyatt in NYC. We loved our stay and were really looking forward to the same kind of experience in San Francisco. First impressions were good, the hotel is in a brilliant location and the staff were wonderful. The room was as expected for a 4* hotel; really comfy beds, flat screen TV and a great view. However, after getting unpacked a few things became clear... Firstly, the owner of this particular hotel is clearly intent on squeezing every last cent out of his guests. During our trip we had stayed in much cheaper hotels and motels, and had saved the best for last, or so we thought. We had enjoyed free Internet access and a huge variety of TV channels on our road trip, so imagine our disappointment when we learned that we would be charged $10 per day for Wifi. This was a joke, and how any right-minded person can think it's acceptable to charge for something that is nowadays a basic necessity is quite beyond me. We had to go across the road to Starbucks to use their free Wifi, and it's fair to say that their coffee was a lot cheaper than our hotel room. My girls and I like to stay in our room at night and watch TV, but once again we were hugely disappointed to discover that there were only a very small number of free TV channels available. This is penny-pinching at its very worst, and is definitely not what I would expect from such an esteemed chain of hotels. The safe in the room was not functioning, and the famed American power shower was a feeble dribble. The room had been recently renovated and I have no idea why a room on the 18th floor cannot get decent water pressure, especially when every fitting is brand new. They did send up an engineer to look at the shower, but even after he'd tinkered the shower was still feeble. I made my disappointment known to the hotel management and the lady in charge of guest services was a delight. She was most apologetic but it was clear that the owner of this particular Hyatt does not think it necessary to offer guests the same standard of amenities that other hotels in the chain enjoy. In conclusion, I would like to commend the hotel's staff as they were faultless, but would also like to voice my sadness that what should have been a memorable stay in a luxury hotel was spoiled by the miserly attitude of the owners. This stay has put me off staying at a Hyatt hotel in future, which is really sad.

Reviews.Title: “Great location - Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: lasgr
Reviews.Content: Beds were great..... so comfortable. Under construction? - I knew this beforehand and was a bit worried, we never even saw a glimpse of evidence! Fantastic location - able to walk everywhere: Coit Tower, Fishermans' Wharf, Ghiradelli, China Town, Union Square, and Starbucks right across the street. THAT was awesome! Our service was excellent - the bell hop, the staff, the roomservice, and consierge - all were so helpful and kind. And the main thing? It was completely CLEAN and COMFY!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Nice and Nice!”
Reviews.Author: Julienchito
Reviews.Content: On Union Square, amazing location, good service, great room, wonderful view from the restaurant. I don't have anything else to say but RECOMMENDED! Much better than Westin St Francis. ;)

Reviews.Title: “Nice room - Great service”
Reviews.Author: stevez444
Reviews.Content: Really nice place to stay. The service couldn't have been better. Very close to Union Square.

Reviews.Title: “Selling out your room from beneath you - very poor business practise.”
Reviews.Author: Sionel
Reviews.Content: It's difficult to be objective about a hotel that takes your booking, takes your money and then decides to give your room to someone else because you don't check in until later than they might expect. The stay at the Grand Hyatt was part of a pacy business trip covering a lot of the west coast of the US, and we had only a single night's stay booked there. We expected to be arriving there late in the day from LA, staying overnight and then moving on to Seattle on the following night. Given the activity during this trip a good night's sleep was essential so we didn't scrimp on hotel costs. We arrived at the Hyatt shortly before 11pm and were told that the hotel had no rooms left. We pointed out that we had booked - and had confirmations for - three rooms. The staff apologised for "a mix up" when it was very clear that they had decided we were going to be no-shows and thus sold our rooms on again. As you can imagine this was far from ideal given the time of night and the need for us to be away again the following day. After a fair amount of heated discussion we were found three rooms, all much less than we'd paid for, and all with sofa beds rather than actual beds. We were in no real position to turn these down and while the Hyatt promised to refund our credit cards with the difference in price, the fact is that this is a pretty shoddy business practise all round. Apologies were made, but it really is not good enough and not what one would expect from a hotel with the reputation of the Hyatt.

Reviews.Title: “Busy area, great beds”
Reviews.Author: jajoalbran
Reviews.Content: Just returned from the Grand Hyatt San Francisco, Aug. 13. First impression...not great as the lobby is small and underwhelming. Not much room to sit if waiting to meet ppl. Loved the fact that Hyatt guarantees connecting rooms with their "family plan" and a discount on the 2nd room to boot!! Rooms were small, but nicely done. Beds oh-so-comfortable! Actually that was the best thing about the hotel. Had brunch upstairs 4 out of the 7 days there with my family. Ok...nothing great. Wait staff very friendly along with the concierges and doormen. Starbucks everywhere as the location was great for shopping and coffee! We did not rent a car instead choose to walk, cab it or take some form of public transportation. Overall a very good hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Under Construction but couldn't tell - great service and rooms”
Reviews.Author: Traveler8Colorado
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a family trip out to San Fran. Location is great, the service team was wonderful and took care of all our needs quickly and effectively. The room we received (upgraded due to diamond status) was great. Newly renovated, clean, well decorated, great electronic and room features and fantastic bed. The breakfast upstairs was delicious and the lounge was nice as well (was a bit small due to the usual lounge under construction currently). Would recommend and would go again. Was only about 4 blocks or so from subway station and was an easy walk even with luggage. Area was safe as well. We got the stay at our corporate rate so was very afforable.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel with a great location”
Reviews.Author: Julia S
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights and although the room was small it was clean and comfortable and the location was superb. The staff were very welcoming and the concierges were really helpful and their recommendations were fabulous. The breakfast was buffet style hot or cold with a view of the city which was breath taking. Can highly recommend the hop on/off bus suggested by the hotel and take a cable car ride from Union Square down to Fishermans Wharf. The hotel is next door to the Levis flagship store on Union Square so you can't get closer than that and the Westfield shopping centre is a couple of mins walk.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Service and Good Location”
Reviews.Author: Carmen A
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hyatt while we were attending a conference in San Francisco. We liked the location in Union Square, near to where we wanted to be. The rooms were also very nice and the staff was good.

Reviews.Title: “Nicely renovated rooms, so-so service”
Reviews.Author: GlobalistNewYork
Reviews.Content: The dark, cramped lobby of this hotel makes an underwhelming impression, as does the the lackluster service. It took several minutes for someone at the front desk to provide me with a replacement key, and she didn't acknowledge my obvious impatience. And the next morning at a breakfast with colleagues, my food came about five minutes after everyone else's, with no explanation or acknowledgment. The breakfast itself? Average. So if you're on a business trip, on a tight schedule and used to polished service, this isn't going to be your top choice. Not surprisingly, most of the guests looked like families on vacation, and price was probably a bigger consideration for them. The rooms are quiet and nicely redone--although my mattress had a pronounced sag on one side. There's free wi-fi. And the view from the restaurant on the 36th floor is great.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location and service special price for connecting rooms!”
Reviews.Author: 4boysPennsylvanica
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for two nights. Everyone from the front desk to the balers to the concierge were incredibly helpful. The highlight of our stay was the breakfast buffet both mornings. The selection of food items was magnificent and the taste exceptional! However, it was the service we received from our waiter Danny that made the time special. He waited on us the first morning and was especially attentive. Danny asked us how long we were staying so he knew when we arrived the next morning that we were anxious to get to Yosemite. He made sure that our food arrived quickly as well as providing to go cups for our coffee! Since we were traveling with our three boys, I booked connecting rooms for a FANTASTIC price. It was heaven having the extra space. If only there was free wi fi as well.

Reviews.Title: “good value”
Reviews.Author: karim_sie
Reviews.Content: the location of the best ,right in the center of Union Square which is perfect to who likes to shopping. lots of shops around. view of the restaurants also excellent.staffs was friendly ,tried to help

Reviews.Title: “After months of agonizing about which hotel, we made the perfect choice!”
Reviews.Author: Sportsmom55
Reviews.Content: After pouring over Tripadvisor reviews, I was torn between several hotels. I eventually chose the Grand Hyatt (due to conversing with concierge Susan) and I feel we definitely made an excellent choice. Our room was on the 29th floor overlooking the bay and Alcatraz. The views were incredible and the three days we stayed were clearer than normal, so we really had beautiful scenery. The beds were comfortable, and we liked the renovations made to the room/bathroom with the oversided sink. Location to everywhere we wanted to go: trolley cars, shopping, Starbucks, Chinatown, etc. was very convenient! The conceirge Joanne was exceptional and got us everywhere we needed to go easily! We would definitely recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “It was ok, good location”
Reviews.Author: Tyler B
Reviews.Content: Location and view was great, however the room had uncomfortable chairs to sit on. Self parking was a pain as the communication between the garage and hotel forced me to go back and forth across the street a few times. There is nothing fancy about the rooms, small, average design, But great location. We walked all over the city and this is a great central location to be at.

Reviews.Title: “Lobby was very old but room is ok”
Reviews.Author: Miracosta
Reviews.Content: Just completed the room renovation so room is brand new. But lobby was so old, and no security. Anybody can jump in to the elevator. Standard room only comes with one chair by the work table, no other place to sit other than the beds. If the rates are good I would stay here again but if the rates are higher I would rather be Intercontinental SF or St.Regis.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: floribel1
Reviews.Content: This hotel is our destination hotel in San Francisco. It is situated right on Union Square, within easy walking distance of Chinatown, shopping, the cable car and great restaurants. We believe that this is the best location in the city. In addition to the location, the Hyatt has the best bar in San Francisco---overlooking the Golden Gate and Alcatraz, I believe only available on the Club level.

Reviews.Title: “No better location in San Francisco”
Reviews.Author: GatorRandy
Reviews.Content: Even though the hotel is in the midst of renovation, it is still a wonderful place. Try to get the restaurant view on the top before they, sadly, move it to the mezzanine. Ask for a high floor, the views are spectacular!

Reviews.Title: “Expensive, small rooms. Good location.”
Reviews.Author: mdkohli
Reviews.Content: Located in downtown San Francisco, ideal place. Near Powell cable car line, at the base of Nob Hill. Unimpressed with lobby, rooms are small. Bathrooms are adequate. Good breakfast upstairs with amazing views. Service is as expected for this class of hotel. Prepared to pay over $300/night.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location....but”
Reviews.Author: uofawildcat32
Reviews.Content: We had problems nearly every time trying to use the hotel elevator. We were on the 7th floor and by the time the elevator reached us 85% of the time it was already full (during normal hours) and it took usually around 7 minutes of waiting just to show up. Most of the time we just trekked on down the stairs, but they really should have a better system. Maybe they stop using some of the elevators during the weekdays, but it was ridiculous. I found the beds to be very comfortable! The bathrooms are odd and there is a sliding door that never really closes all the way so you can hear everything out in the bedroom if you know what I mean. The location is excellent. There is a Starbucks right across the street, Union Square, Chinatown and North Beach are all within walking distance. Be careful. The hotel charges $56 a day for parking. We just used the Sutter Stockton garage on the corner and it ended up averaging out at $21 a day.

Reviews.Title: “Great location - Union Square, Chinatown and Financial District”
Reviews.Author: fvrbtmn
Reviews.Content: I was in San Francisco for another business trip and decided to try a different Hyatt in SF (instead of Hyatt Regency San Francisco by Embarcadero Center). The Grand Hyatt was right at Union Sqaure and closed to everything - shopping, food, cable car and yes.... financial district. Folks at the front desk was very helpful and the checkin was very fast.

Reviews.Title: “Not what I expected from a Grand Hyatt”
Reviews.Author: milkman55
Reviews.Content: We stayed here three nights during the last weekend in July and had adjoining rooms for our party of four. The room had a fantastic view which was a great start. The problem was the housekeeping and the staff in general. The housekeeping started knocking on doors at 8am on a Saturday and Sunday morning to see if they could clean the room. 8AM !! on a weekend! On day we put the privacy out to keep them from knocking and then they didn't clean the rooms at all. For the price and the hype, I expected better staff.

Reviews.Title: “Super location,good value”
Reviews.Author: Lordy1
Reviews.Content: The Hyatt was recently refurbished and the rooms are very comfortable. Everyone was smiley and extremely helpful. The views from the rooms are wonderful and we were fortunate enough to overlook Union Square. They also provide a fridge in the room as well as coffee facilities. They charge for wifi.The location is in the centre of everything. We had breakfast in the dining room which is on the thirty something floor where we again were fortunate enough to have a table by the window. The service,by George, was impeccable and made breakfast that much more enjoyable. No point in going out for breakfast when it is this good with this view where you are! The only disappoinment is the bathroom where the towels and toiletries are not particularly good. Of course we will stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “great location in Union Square and brand new rooms”
Reviews.Author: mstifster11
Reviews.Content: My fiance and I stayed here for 2 nights, the location is right next to Union Square (only less than 1 block from Macys. It's a block from Chinatown in a very lively area. This hotel recently underwent a $38million renovation project and the rooms has flat screen TVs, contemporary designed rooms. It's a decent size for being in the city, bathroom is spacious. Self parking structure is very convenient just right across the street, it's about $38 i think. it's expensive but parking in SF is expensive no matter where you go. The bed is comfortable as we had great night sleep. Room is nice and clean. i would come back and stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great view, Great location”
Reviews.Author: DallasStephanie
Reviews.Content: The Grand Hyatt has an awesome location, right by all of the shops and restaraunts. The area was very safe and I could get everywhere I needed by car. The front desk staff was very friendly and helpful, as far as concierges go one was awesome and one didn't really help me much so if you don't get the answers you want, go back and try again when someone else is working. Rooms were very nice, roomy, and clean. Nice small touches, like free tooth paste in the room! Doesn't seem like a big deal, but it was important to me since I forgot mine! My only complaint about the room was the shower which had extremely low water pressure. If you're on a low floor, chances are you won't have a view of anything but the building next door but if you go up to the upper floors the views are amazing. The work out center was extremely nice with lots of equipment to choose from and had by far the best view I've ever seen from a gym. I wanted to keep going back to work out just for the view! We only ate at the hotel once (for breakfast), we ate the buffet since we were in a hurry but it was over priced and not that good. French toast was tasty though, and again... the view was worth it. Even if you just get a snack or a drink, make sure you go up there! I took some amazing pictures through the windows (turn off your flash), and no one would ever know that I took them from inside the building.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location. Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: roman022
Reviews.Content: I had stayed there 6 days. Near all. Shops, restaurants, transport. It was a great location.Safe. I had breakfast included. excellent. Hotel`s staff great. Value very reasonable. I surely recomend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Cozy rooms to relax in after some SF Fun!”
Reviews.Author: CanadianMystique
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Grand Hyatt with a group of friends for four nights in June.... really enjoyed the hotel and all SF has to offer. The rooms are clean and modern, check in was a breeze... loved the salt water taffy at the front desk- nice touch! We had a little mishap with the swipe system on our door- we were locked out of our room completely and it took several maintenance men to fix the problem. Despite the inconvenience they offered us another room to use while we could not get in ours and had the problem fixed in about a half hour. Was grumpy about that after a tiring full day of tours but they did their best to resolve the problem quickly and professionally. The top level lounge offered beautiful views and some tasty appetizers. The concierge was very helpful when asked for advice on places to eat or best means of transportation. Overall I really enjoyed this hotel, the location is fantastic and with the new upgrades its a very comfortable, enjoyable place to stay while visiting beautiful San Francisco!

Reviews.Title: “very pleased”
Reviews.Author: sbayers
Reviews.Content: Centrally located, great room with mini refrigerator and wonderful views. We also dined in the Grand View restaurant and the food was good and the views were 'grand'.

Reviews.Title: “My favorite San Francisco Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Rosita1124
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at 3 different properties at Union Square and the Grand Hyatt has been my favorite in the past. And, now that they are nearly complete on amazing renovations, they are over the top. They have great windows, basically floor to ceiling, so the city/bay views are fantastic. And, with the recently redone rooms, the comfort and ambience is spectacular and many push button features including curtains, lights, etc. I highly recommend this hotel as it has the typical Hyatt courtesies, plus with the new renovation, it is just the best. Am staying again at the end of September.

Reviews.Title: “Good Price and Good Service”
Reviews.Author: SouthernGirl41
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Grand Hyatt during the week of July 18, 2011. The room was great and was decorated with modern yet comfortable furnishings. The bathroom had this really funky looking vessell sink. The only thing was the sink was a bit shallow and I would splash water everywhere when using it. The hotel location was right in the midst of some really great shopping and was within about a mile to a mile and a half to the water front. We walked to the waterfront a couple of times. It was a good and easy walk but be prepared for it to be chilly in the evening. The only drawback to the stay was on our arrival, the bellman was a bit aggressive in trying to set expectations about how long it takes to get a taxi. My co-worker and I had just arrived and was trying to pay our taxi driver, get our stuff out of the car and figure out how much time we had before our first meeting. I assume that the bellman was trying to be helpful and set expectations but he didn't allow us to get out of the cab good before he began bombarding us with the drawbacks of the taxi situation in San Francisco. We were guests of the hotel when a pretty major union was picketing. Though I support the picketers, I do have to commend the hotel lobby and bellman staff for how they tried to make the hotel guests feel safe, secure and avoid the picket as much as possible. On the day of the picket, they were all organized, in large numbers and escorted guests from the curb to the elevators. They definitely took extra care noting the inconvenience to the guests but remained calm and in control. I would definitely stay there again and would recommend this hotel. Good price and service.

Reviews.Title: “Efficient staff, clean rooms, what's up with the noise?”
Reviews.Author: babbilu
Reviews.Content: Great hotel for business stay - close proximity to everything, expansive conference facilities. Rooms are clean, pleasantly-appointed and well-proportioned. The concierge is very efficient and courteous. The only wrinkle (apart from my pet peeve of SF hotels blocking the free city-provided Wi-Fi access, which I think is ridiculous) is the noise that the entire structure was emanating. According to the hotel management, due to high winds, many buildings creak in the same way. It might be true, but when you're on the 6th floor of a modern hotel building, and it sounds like you're on deck of a Flying Dutchman, it is bound to scare the Bejaysus out of ya. I can only gasp and guess what the noise was for the higher-floor guests.

Reviews.Title: “Very Pleased”
Reviews.Author: LivetheDream56
Reviews.Content: I highly recommend this hotel to anyone wanting to stay in the Union Square area. It's location has easy access to transportation to cable cars or street cars (2 - 4 blocks walking) We were able to check in early which made our arrival very nice. The hotel is decorated in a very simple classy style. The hotel desk help and all around personnel were very pleasant. Room size was okay and the view (12th floor) was okay. We could see a peek of the bay in the distance. We were never disturbed by hearing other hotel guests in other rooms. I would have thought we were the only ones on our floor if I didn't see the used food service trays outside. Being on the 12th floor we did still hear a lot of the street traffic noise (all night). Room was very clean. During our stay there, the Hyatt hotel cleaning staff had a demonstration outside the hotel one afternoon. We were worried that we could not enter the hotel. I would have expected the hotel to offer us some kind of discount in hotel bill or restaurant to help assuage the situation, but did not. As others have reported the view from the 36th floor is pretty incredible. You do have to pick a time of day though when the fog has not rolled in tho! Also there is not a lobby area where you can sit and relax. The hotel has close proximity to many many restaurants. Most are a bit pricey but we were able to find some them that were more moderately priced.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: michbren
Reviews.Content: As frequent SF visitors we have passed this hotel numerous times and finally decided to give it a try. We were so pleased!! The newly renovated room was beautiful, unusual and the bed was so-o comfortable. Everyone at the holel could not have been more accommodating. Housekeeping did an outstanding job and we were never inconvenienced. We had one minor problem which was handled quickly and to our satisfaction. This hotel has the best location for what we enjoy doing when in San Francisco (and it's not shopping). We are so glad we stayed here and look forward to returning.

Reviews.Title: “Another Excellent Stay”
Reviews.Author: Vanderneucker
Reviews.Content: The room was fully renovated and absolutely immaculate and gorgeous. We had a King size bed that was very comfortable. We were on the 7th floor and had no street noise. We ate breakfast and lunch in the restaurant at the top of the hotel, it was delicious with a beautiful view of the city. The concierge was very helpful and suggested several great places to eat within walking distance. We took a double decker bus tour out to the Golden Gate Bridge which was excellent and reasonably priced. We are Platinum members so there was no charge for the internet service, if you are not in Hyatt's loyalty program, then sign up, it is free. This is our third time staying at this hotel and we have never been disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: cgilmore1970
Reviews.Content: The hotel is all renovated and the rooms are very clean and well maintained. The hotel is by Union Square so it is create for transportation and dining etc. We were travelling as a family of 4 and found that the storage space was limited. The space that would typically be used as drawers for clothing were replaced with a fridge and a safe. I was also suprised how noisy the hotel was. You could hear the movement in the hall and outside the window. The internet was sooo slow. We called for assistance and someone even came to our room but they could not make it any faster. The service was great. All staff were very friendly and provided great service. So overall great room and location but a few things I would change.

Reviews.Title: “Great location!”
Reviews.Author: jetsetstyle
Reviews.Content: Excellent location! Stayed here on a long labor day weekend back in 2006 but still remember the great location of this hotel! Nice room, clean and comfortable bed. It looks like more of a business hotel but still a great hotel for a stay in San Francisco. Right in Union Square and walking distance to so much including good shopping, trolley ride, Chinatown, etc. Only problem we had was as soon as we checked in, we went up to our room and were laying on the bed when one of the staff came into our hotel room on accident. Guess they didn't know anyone was in there?

Reviews.Title: “great stay in centrallyl located hotel”
Reviews.Author: krazy140
Reviews.Content: we were in SFO for the 4th of July wknd and stayed the grand hyatt for 3 nights. locaion was great, central location. we took the bart train from the airport to the powell st station and the hotel was a 10 min walk from there ( 4 blocks). we could also walk to Coit tower (through china town and north beach) and to fishermans warf. lots of great restaurants in the neighbourhood too. the grand view restaurant on the 36th floor has great views of SF sky line, alcatraz and city. The rooms we stayed in were the updated/new rooms and was very comfortable and contemporary. fast internet connection helped as well. all in all great stay and will repeat at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent in all categories.”
Reviews.Author: Barbara111_11
Reviews.Content: Definately would return and enjoyed the entire experience. There was an initial problem finding availability for the type of room reserved, but the front desk clerk was most accommadating by providing a complimentary breakfast each morning. Staff members were professional, curtious, and ready to help right away if needed. The room was well appointed, very clean, modern, and had wonderful mattresses and linens. The view from the room was great but the view from the 36th floor restaurant was spectacular, especially at sunset. The hotel was centrally located at Union Square and not far from public transportation, but a tip for catching a cab.... start early... it's not easy to get a cab like in other cities.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: NNB77
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Grand Hyatt for a weekend getaway to San Francisco. We loved it! The location was terrific. It's right in the heart of the shopping area, it's surrounded by great restaurants and Chinatown is just a few blocks away. We had considered staying near Fisherman's wharf and after seeing the area, I'm so glad we didn't. The rooms looked newly renovated and he hotel was very clean We would definitely recommend the Grand Hyatt.

Reviews.Title: “perfect location, clean rooms, great concerige staff”
Reviews.Author: kellyann89
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Grand Hyatt San Fran last week for our wedding anniversary, and loved every minute of it. When we arrived, we were able to quickly check in. (favorite part of the front desk was the salt water taffy mints that i reguarly helped myself to!!!!) We had a lovely freshly rennovated king sized room on the 16th floor. Amazing bed! The only thing I didnt like in the hotel room was the smell of the hand soap, shampoo, and conditioner, but i had some of my own, so if you are particular, bring your own supplies! The concerge staff was 100% amazing in helping us make our plans.... one was nicer than the next in helping us with whatever questions we had. The other great thing about this hotel is the location..... steps away from wonerful shopping stores, the MUNI (bus and underground) and cable cars. A few blocks away and you stumble into Chinatown. i felt very safe here in the Union Square area...... can't say that about other "districts" or neighborhoods we visited. There was nothing lavish about this hotel, but it just meet all of my needs of being in a great loaction, being super clean, and having insanely nice people helping me. But beware, dont bother to ask for an upgrade if you book your stay through any site other than their own. My husband emailed someone before we left (trying to make our trip a little more special) and was, in my opinion, rather rudely denied because we booked through Travelocity. It just kinda made me feel "second-class". I almost would have prefered being lied to that no rooms were available. So then when we did check in, i felt like there was a big mark by our name that said "discount-website trash checking in" Alright, I dramatize a little. I just needed to get that off my chest. I would still stay here again, and truely suggest you do to, because again: it's in the perfect location, the place is immaculately clean, and the concerge staff were amazing. A few quick thoughts on San Fran in general..... it's cold! I guess especially in July/August.... so bring a jacket and pants! The sun is brutal and will burn you instantaneusly, so wear your sunscreen and wear a hat! The city is a bunch of wicked steep hills, so bring and wear the most comfortably shoes you have---- fashion be damned, those hills are evil! Food is super expensive and really not that good. Public transportation is cheaper in San Fran than Chicago- even taxi's! Bus fare is 2 bucks and it's good for 2 hours! Cable cars are a rip off 6 bucks for one ride, but most of the time they never ask you for money! I highly reccomend a hop on hop off bus tour when you first get there to get your bearings. Again, beware: when you cross over the Golden Gate Bridge, IT WILL BE COLD! And finally, if you are looking for a tour of Sonoma and the Wine country, please take the GREEN DREAMS TOUR with Ellie, it's the best. Sorry this is so long, and I really hope this helps someone. Please stay at the Grand Hyatt, it was a very nice clean safe place to stay!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: kschultz
Reviews.Content: The only issue We had is the wifi is not free ?!?! Really. ??? Ok but we loved it

Reviews.Title: “Wow! Gorgeous room! Breath taking views!”
Reviews.Author: MonocleTraveler
Reviews.Content: The wonderful room with breath-taking views made our recent trip to SF a special one! The newly remodeled rooms with elegant, modern furnishings were spectacular. The gorgeously appointed bathroom with top-of-the-line fixtures and stone was extravagant! We booked through AAA, and a full breakfast was included with our stay (a delicious deal). The hotel is located within walking distance to the underground, Chinatown and close by shopping. After an exhausting day of business, movies, drinks AND a Giant's game, we dropped into a deep sleep in the decadent bed. Slept soundly and comfortably. Would definately recommend staying here!

Reviews.Title: “Newly renovated!”
Reviews.Author: Pumpkin_Cupcakes
Reviews.Content: We had a pleasant one night stay here. It's been renovated recently, which is nice, but I can see how for some, the smell of new paint and decor might be bothersome. If you are sensitive to that, wait a while to stay here! I absolutely loved the mini-bathtub sink, as I find that sinks at most hotels are too small. Wifi is available in the room, but I believe it's USD10.00. The good thing is that there's a Starbucks right across from the hotel, so you could go there.

Reviews.Title: “Great Union Square Location!”
Reviews.Author: MassCouple2
Reviews.Content: Union Square is a great location to use a home base for a stay in San Francisco! We asked for, and got, a high level room (25th floor, out of 36, not bad), and although it was a west looking view, it was very nice! The room itself was redone and very modern! A bit of a negative was how thin the walls seemed to be ... the people in the next room sounded like they were actually in our room ... not what you'd expect from a high-end hotel. I was very impressed by the conceirge service! We hadn't been to San Francisco for many years and needed some direction with local restaurants and sights. Joanna Husk (Concierge and Member of Les Clefs d'Or USA Ltd.) was possibly the best conceirge I've ever dealt with. She took the time to understand what we were interested in and provided us with maps, site-seeing suggestions, and an extensive list of restaurants within walking distance ... then she gave us specific recommendations to meet our interests. It's this type of service that makes you want to come back to a hotel! As far as location, it was ideal. Easy to walk just about anywhere, as long as you have the time and stamina, up and down the hills! We walked to Nob Hill, Telegraph Hill, Fisherman's Wharf, and Ghiradelli Square. A beautiful city!! One of the great features of the hotel is Grandviews restaurant, on the 36th floor. I probably wouldn't recommend it for dinner, but what a great view for breakfast!!! Our room rate included breakfast for 2 each day (anything you want) ... all you have to pay for is the tip ... a good deal! Parking is another issue, but I'd recommend passing on the valet parking (way overpriced!) and park at the garage on the opposite corner of Stockton and Sutter streets ... right across from the hotel. Although it wasn't cheep, it was very convenient and much less than valet. We spent a day over in Golden Gate Park, and then over to the Golden Gate Bridge (which are too far to walk) and it was great to have the car accessable. I know it's still "par for the course" at high-end hotels, but why do they charge for internet service? I'd highly recommend that they make this a free service, just like they do at most lower level and business hotels! All in all a very pleasureable experience!

Reviews.Title: “What a great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: cissy2121
Reviews.Content: The staff treated you like you were at the Ritz Carlton! Exceptional customer service. Would highly recommend staying there. Rooms have recently been redone--beautiful with beautiful views of the city and bay....Again, the staff went out of their way to may our stay exceptional!! Only thing I would change is they need to offer free internet!!

Reviews.Title: “An excellent stay and would definitely return”
Reviews.Author: CMK63
Reviews.Content: I stayed in a newly refurbished room. Very well appointed. The concierge service at this hotel was wonderful. Like a private guide looking after your every need. Once the teamunderstood what experiences I was looking for, they never missed the mark. Restaurant recommendations and bookings in particular. Thanks team, I'll be back.

Reviews.Title: “Location, location, location”
Reviews.Author: BFLOMAN
Reviews.Content: Hyatt Grand is a great hotel if you want to stay right in the heart of SF. Steps away from Union Square...you can't beat the location. Service was great during my stay. Rooms seem recently renovated and were very nice. The only complaint was you could hear a bit of street noise. All in All a great place to stay in SF.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location! Great Views!!”
Reviews.Author: zsazsa22
Reviews.Content: Highly recommend this hotel for a San Fransisco Stay. Great location for shopping, restaurants and site seeing. Our room was newly renovated and very clean. All of the staff from the Valet to the Housekeeping Staff was very helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location at a Great Price”
Reviews.Author: cmaeder
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent two nights at this hotel and enjoyed our stay. Location was convenient within walking distance of shopping, restaurants and the Muni and BART. The staff was friendly and accomodating from the moment we exited our car to check in as the valet moved our car out of traffic. The check-in process was smooth and kiosks were available to issue room keys if you check in online. We checked out online due to an early flight and the process was also very easy. Room was clean and decorated with contemporary flair. The AC was nice since the temp reached 86 during our trip. We also enjoyed the 35th floor exercise facility. Good cardio equipment and a great view.

Reviews.Title: “So nice,will use again”
Reviews.Author: Pam255112
Reviews.Content: A great stay from the moment we arrived. Doormen were so happy and polite, always had time to chat.Checkin was fast and professional, as we were early were given an upgrade to a room on a higher level, wow the view was amazing. Looking down to union square or out to the Golden Gate Bridge it never ceased to amaze. The room wa small but very nicely appointed and comfortable and the location for walkig around was brilliant. The restaurant on the top floor at night was brilliant, had to be one of the best views in the city. Gym was good as well.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, but room more style than convenience”
Reviews.Author: ColinDavid Posted by an OctopusTravel traveler
Reviews.Content: The Grand Hyatt is a good hotel in an excellent location just off Union Square, and walking distance from Chinatown. The Continental Breakfast was excellent and (for a major city centre0 not too expensive, and the view from the top floor restaurant spectacular. We stayed in a refurbished room which looked splendid, but for a couple staying more than one night it lacked storage space (drawers particularly) and the bathroom had a large elongated basin ( could have bathed a small baby) which detracted from space for toiletries etc. Also there was nowhere to hang towels, making the "green" admonishment to reuse towels unworkable - no good leaving them in a soggy heap! Useful facility to print boarding passes for onward flights in the lobby.

Reviews.Title: “good location”
Reviews.Author: stephen g
Reviews.Content: couple of nights stay here. room fairly standard chain type place room clean and tidy ok view, not great. comfy bed and very quiet hotel. the bar at the top of the hotel was great and had great views and better cocktails! staff were very friendly. excellent location just off union square and with the rate we got which worked out at about £85 a night, fantastic value.

Reviews.Title: “Good Deal on a Nicely Renovated Room”
Reviews.Author: Phlyer
Reviews.Content: My business partner and I were in San Francisco for a business conference this month. Though the event was held at the Westin Market, we decided to try out the Grand Hyatt a few blocks away. We couldn't have been happier with the experience. We got an AAA rate that included breakfast, which was quite a steal, as the hotel restaurant on the 36th floor is very impressive. The breakfast buffet was slightly above average, nothing to write home about but perfectly adequate. Upon check-in, make sure to request a renovated room. From the looks of it, they're almost done with the upgrades, but parts of the hotel are still out of service. Our room was great with a nice view of the Transamerica Pyramid and surrounding areas. Note to those who care: The club is currently out of service for renovations. This hotel does charge for internet, just like every other property in its class in San Francisco. Acting shocked about it won't change anything. ;-)

Reviews.Title: “Ultra Modern Rooms on the Small Side, Very Clean”
Reviews.Author: CentralCoastTravelr
Reviews.Content: The hotel was clean, modern and had great views. The location cannot be beat if you're looking to be close to Union Square, Chinatown and the action of the City life. The front desk staff was pleasant and kind... but there was a wait of about 5-10 minutes at both check-in and check-out. The front desk agents were spot on and apologized for the wait and took care of us very efficiently and with great service. My only real disappointment came at the concierge desk. It was very, very busy and after a couple of unsuccessful calls and a 10 minute wait at the desk, I was a little disappointed in the service and attention (that I did not end up with) for a simple question. Thankfully, I'm pretty familiar with the City and it was only an inconvenience, not something that ruined our trip by any means. I found another way to get the information elsewhere. All in all, it was a nice stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great Customer Service”
Reviews.Author: Nmg60
Reviews.Content: Great location, customer service and clean. I think I will continue to stay at the Grand Hyatt.

Reviews.Title: “Incrediblle view, lux room, top location”
Reviews.Author: josanpu
Reviews.Content: I stayed June 5th, 2011, in a King room on the 17th floor. Everything was brand new, clean, and gorgeous. Super comfy bed, great lighting options on the headboard, big TV, good chairs. Loved the curtains, pillows, white ginger soaps. I would certainly return should I need to spend time in San Francisco. Only gripes: Shower water-pressure a little feeble, breakfast not included, and I resent paying a dollar to make a land-line phone call. Oh, and leave your car at home. Parking charges downtown are exorbitant.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great hotel”
Reviews.Author: inkwave17
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for two nights and found this to be an ideal base during my trip to San Francisco. Even though it is a big hotel, check-in was done in under 5 minutes thanks to the automated kiosk! My room was big for a city hotel with a great view of downtown (although I had asked for a bay view..I guess the tiny sliver of water out towards Oakland was supposed to count). The bed was super comfortable and the room had a nice size flat screen TV, comfy lounge chair and ample desk space for laptop etc. There was also a mini-fridge which was great for storing drinks and snacks. The bathroom was very clean and everything worked well in there. I am not a huge fan of the sliding doors that seem to be so popular now - I know they save space, but I prefer more privacy... Room service was quick and really tasty. I also appreciated that all staff at the hotel referred to me by name. All of them from the housekeeping staff to the front desk were very friendly and helpful. The location of the hotel is great - smack dab in Union Square where you can find plenty of breakfast spots and of course tons of shopping. BART stations, cable cars, taxis are easy to reach for when you want to explore other parts of the city. Definitely a great spot and would recommend it to anyone staying in San Francisco who wants a classy but not snobby place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Good Concierge and not much else”
Reviews.Author: sizzla36
Reviews.Content: We stayed here because we got a great deal on the room but there not really much else to this hotel. This is a four star hotel thats' standard rooms are tiny, beds are small and not all that comfortable and the front desk doesn't make you feel all that welcome. I guess it was the rate I got, but it's still money isn't it? They offer absolutely nothing complimentary not even internet service, which I think is ridiculous. You even have to pay to use the business center. The hotel is in a decent location with many fine places to eat within walking distance. The support staff was good and the concierge was great, especially Liz. But if this is a four star hotel, I'll stay with the two and three star locales because at least they respect the money your spending and offer you some extras besides a great looking lobby. Not recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Totally cosmo chic!”
Reviews.Author: ange_babyblue
Reviews.Content: While searching on various OTAs for a place to stay over Memorial Day weekend, I chanced upon a 48hr sale advertised by the Grand Hyatt, and thought it was worth a try. My husband and I arrived earlier than normal check-in time and were prepared to have our bag stored prior to receiving a room key; but not only was the room ready, our request for a higher floor had been granted. Furthermore, the front desk associate presented us with a couple of room options to make sure we received what we truly wanted. The room was absolutely stunning, very cosmopolitan, very chic. Totally adored the contemporary decor and furnishings that capture a loft-style, urban residence luxury. Appreciated the chic features like the window shade and personal bedside reading lights. The Grandviews Lounge has a wonderful ambiance, great music, and exudes serenity despite it being full. The door/bell staff were most pleasant and very attentive, always made sure we were comfortable and checked if we needed assistance. We're glad to have found a favorite place to stay in Union Square. Keep up the great work!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic new rooms!!!”
Reviews.Author: Gtraveler2010
Reviews.Content: Very updated rooms in this hotel. The room darkens with an electric shade. Hardwood flooring and very modern light fixtures. The customer care provided from the bell staff to the front desk shows that they are well trained and these employees like their job!!. Noise is a problem in the middle of the city with all the horns and sirens....but it is San Francisco.

Reviews.Title: “Most Comfortable Bed I have slept in”
Reviews.Author: Mckay6657
Reviews.Content: Visited San Francisco on the 4th May for 5 nights as part of a trip along with Hawaii and New York. Arrived tired 7 hours later than expected due to delayed flight, we were checked in very efficiently and in a friendly manner and went to our renovated room on the 23rd floor. The beds were the most comfortable I have slept in ( I have a memory foam at home and it was better than mine). Elaine at the concierge desk booked trips for us and went out of her way to be helpful and friendly, visited the restaurant on 36th floor, views fantastic and cocktails in bar good too. Would certainly stay here again and highly recommend a visit

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful week”
Reviews.Author: travelbugphil
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Grand Hyatt for a week from April 16. We had a great stay. We arrived at the hotel around 11pm and check in was swift. The location was very convinient. Starbucks is just across the street, Walgreens is a block away and Chinatown is close by. Shopping is all over. The hallways to the rooms were nicely decorated. The newly renovated rooms were a bit small but comfortable. I like the way the bathrooms were done. I read in one review that it was alittle noisy especially if you stayed in rooms facing Sutter. Well, when we were there we had that problem the night after we arrived the rest of nights was quiet. I think it was also because they were fixing the roads outside and they were working at night. The all staffs very very friendly and helpful. I haven't had a chance to check out the coffee shop on the top floor but I heard it has great views of the city. We also used the internet. We had to pay for it but the connections were ok.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: WorldTraveller1500
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Grand Hyatt for 5 nights at the end of April 2011. We were dealt with by a very professional and friendly member of staff who checked us in and welcomed us. We were given a renovated room on the 11th floor which overlooked Union Square. The renovated rooms are brilliant. Extremely clean and modern with lots of nice little touches to make your stay comfortable. We had a room with 1 king bed which provided 5 of the best nights sleep I have ever had. Whilst I never saw one of the older rooms, I would definitely request one of the renovated rooms when you check in. Location is perfect with easy access to the main bus and street car routes on Market Street and also the Cable Cars. It is also right in the centre of the main shopping areas with Macys over the square and Westfield Mall about a 10 minute walk. We went to the 36th floor bar on our last night for cocktails and the views are stunning. We got a seat in the window and was there just in time to see the last bit of the sun sinking into the bay. The drinks were pretty good too!! Throughout our stay, whenever we needed anything, I found the staff to be helpful, efficient and extremely polite. I would definitely recommend this hotel and if I am ever fortunate enough to be back in beautiful San Francisco, I will stay at the Grand Hyatt.

Reviews.Title: “Great location but maybe a bit pricey”
Reviews.Author: ruth10UK
Reviews.Content: Located just off union square, location great, nice view but a bit pricey but maybe thats just San Francisco prices. Food and drinks in the bar good but bit expensive but nice bar and great view of the city and Alcatraz. Room service breakfast was lovely, good size room and bathroom and very clean. Had to pay for wireless internet which I think was a bit unfair given the price we paid for the room. Free wireless internet would have increased the rating I give here

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic service and great location”
Reviews.Author: Kim2902
Reviews.Content: It was our first stay in San Francisco and wow what an impression it left. from the moment we arrived we were well looked after. The receptionist was great and gave us a lovely room, the card machine wasn't working at the time so couldn't give us a key to our room but arranged a member of staff to take us to the room and let us in. The room itself was gorgeous, on the 30th floor with great views. The room was spotlessly clean and each day the housekeeping team done a wonderful job to maintain this fact. The conciege team were FANTASTIC! they recommended some great places to eat, told us how to get around and answered all our questions... and we had quite a few. I can not thank them enough and the whole Hyatt team for a fantastic stay.

Reviews.Title: “It was the perfect hotel in every way”
Reviews.Author: MimiJohnson
Reviews.Content: We chose the lowest rate and got a beautiful room, 16th floor, over Union Square. The remodeling is well done, loved the unusual panels, in place of sheer curtains, and the automated shades. The built in bed headboards and built in desk/tv/etc... made much better use of the space that in the old-style rooms and gave more room to move around. The front desk and concierge staff were courteous and efficient, and our phone requests for extra things were filled immediately. We found the hotel perfect in every way, and the location cannot be beat.

Reviews.Title: “One of the worst Hyatt's”
Reviews.Author: gmm78
Reviews.Content: This is by far one of the worst Hyatt's. Yes, they are renovating their rooms - this is long overdue for this hotel. The level of customer service is not up to par with the other Grand Hyatt's I have stayed at. The management approach at this property is clearly different from the others. The front desk staff is the worst. They appear to really care less about whether you have an enjoyable stay or not. Renovated room or not, the walls are paper thin and you very likely will not be getting a good nights sleep. I am a Diamond Member with Hyatt and always try to stay at Hyatt to maintain my status. Not here though...I've switched to the Fairmont on Nob Hill. Fantastic hotel, great service, and great location.

Reviews.Title: “Great first visit to San fran”
Reviews.Author: rpi80
Reviews.Content: The hotel was in a great location, the room was very nice and comfortable, and the staff excelled at customer service. Elaine the concierge helped us book a fantastic napa trip after the one I booked online canceled the evening before. The rest of the staff genuinely cared to make sure we were happy. The thirty sixth floor restaurant and bar had awesome views of the city. The gym is on the next floor down and had the same views with brand new equipment.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing stay”
Reviews.Author: Angiex
Reviews.Content: We were at the 12th floor, I liked the view from our room. The room was totally renovated, bath was beautiful, very modern, the bed was comfy, the staff was very kind and helpful. The location is great, but you can hear the street noise during the night. It was a great week, thank you for everything! :)

Reviews.Title: “Renovated rooms make a big difference”
Reviews.Author: KKTRAVELS808
Reviews.Content: Agree with an earlier poster about requesting renovated rooms ONLY. This is an older property and therefore has it ups/downs. The location is great - only one block off Union Square and four blocks from the BART Station (which means you can come in from the airport for $8.10 instead of a $40 cab ride). The renovated rooms have all new furnishings, although the bathroom design is indicative of a renovation (small, tight). You can hear some noise through the walls, but you'll still sleep well due to the new beds. The lobby and elevators look worn, but once you arrive on your renovated floor it will be like stepping into a new hotel. The Executive Lounge was beautiful and had a breakfast serving fit for a king - definitely one of the nicest lounges I've seen in a long time. I would stay here again, but this time will request a renovated room upon making a reservation!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel - great service, but as most urban hotel chains - very pricey amenities”
Reviews.Author: PASkyGuy
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 3 weeknights in March 2011. At that time the hotel was undergoing renovations in places. I was given the choice of a renovated room or a room with a great view. I took the view (30th floor of 36). The room did indeed have a great view toward the bay and financial district but it did need some modernization. Tube TV, dated curtains, worn dressers/doors, straight shower curtain bar, and worn carpeting were some of the items needing an update. However, everything worked, the bed was comfortable, the shower had great pressure and plenty of hot water, and the room was quiet. So for this yet-to-be-renovated room the pluses outweighed the minuses. I had a car and parked it in a garage around the corner from the hotel for $35/day which is high but not as much as the hotel valet service. That garage by the way, is clean and the attendants are courteous and professional. The restaurant on the top floor has fantastic views of the city and beyond. The service was top notch and not rushed if you didn't want to be rushed. The full breakfast buffet with gratuity was $22-$24 which was about the same price as a late evening burger, beer, and gratuity. Lots of dining of all types within a five minute walk - Starbucks across the street, cafes on Union Square 1/2 block away, Lori's Diner (50s theme) is a block or so away, and many others. Overall a very nice hotel and I'd recommend it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Best Value in SF”
Reviews.Author: cokedawg
Reviews.Content: When I book a hotel, I look for one thing: value for my dollar. I got all I could ask for and more from the Grand Hyatt. The service was amazing. We brought our bags to the Hyatt at 7am to be stowed for the day while we did some sightseeing, but the front desk told us that they would go ahead and give us a room so we could get settled in. We had a wonderful view of Union Square, and the bed was very comfortable. I definitely would recommend this hotel to anyone seeking high-class treatment and service at an affordable and reasonable price! (Especially in San Francisco!)

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Service and the staff was perfect the room superb”
Reviews.Author: Wickedbelladonna
Reviews.Content: We checked in and they held our bags right away when we came back in they took our bags right up and our rooms were newly renovated with huge king beds...even more amazing was the dark curtain to keep out light and the bathroom vanity..we discovered our bathroom door was off track so they send someone right up to fix it. I had gotten two rooms because we went with friends and had the room joined so a moment after we checked in the slid a paper under our friends door and it was information on 9 different web sited where my friend could replace her broken handle on her vintage suitcase. We were very impressed from the in room safes to the coffee set up and the amazing use of space. The only issue was not being told they were putting a hold on my card for 25 dollars on each room which took 4 days to fall off my account but other then that small snafu the entire trip was perfect I would recommend this place to anyone wanting a lovely room and a great location...

Reviews.Title: “Great Views - Scrumptous Food and Wine”
Reviews.Author: Nickolini
Reviews.Content: Imagine a panoramic view of San Francisco from the 36th Floor of this Grand Hyatt hotel. Add a club atmosphere, intimate bar and grill with yummy burgers and refeshing wine; Dining on the same floor includes a separate dining room for breakfast brunch, lunch and full menu dinner. Attentive and polite servers put you at ease. Located near great shopping, this hotel has our vote for return visits. Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “Great Deal”
Reviews.Author: sdsuindian
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in many hotels in San Fran on business trips, this is one of the best, especially for the price. I hate big cities, they are loud! When you are trying to sleep this is especially ANNOYING!! I only stayed one night, but missing at night here were the loud sirens, jack hammers and yelling people I am used to hearing in SF. I forgot my iphone charger, but after a couple beers and some great chowder at the restaurant (didn't have a great food selection) on the 36th floor I realized the phone had an ipod charger attached to the back of the in-room phone! Hopefully they have all of the rooms upgraded soon because I doubt the others had this. The phones even have speakers so you can play your ipod. The beds headboard had reading lights attached. Didn't use the gym but it appears they will get you gym clothes if you need them. FOrget toothpaste? Its provided in the bathroom. There is A LOT of shopping near. Worst part of this hotel was thin walls. I could hear high heels clomping around and my neighbors ironing board being opened and closed.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, comfort & experience”
Reviews.Author: somerfun
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful stay at this hotel. Easy walk to great restaurants, the cable cars, the best shopping and local sights around the city. You would think that at the prices they charge you would get free wireless - oh well. We had a recently renovated and stylishly decorated room, overlooking Union Square. Our only issue with the room was the bathroom door (sliding door) which did little to offer privacy from the rest of the others in the room. Otherwise, the bed and the pillows were really comfortable and the room was, well roomy. The lounge on the top floor had a great view and the muchie menu was really good.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful room, great price!”
Reviews.Author: Fireholly1
Reviews.Content: We thoroughly enjoyed our stay. We were in one of the newly renovated rooms, and they were beautiful. Being on a lower floor left us with a mediocre view, but having a renovated room made up for it. Great service in every area of the hotel. Did not try out the restaurant, lounge, or fitness area, but the front desk staff was courteous, as were the gentlemen outside in valet and cab service. Booked through priceline for a great price. No complaints!

Reviews.Title: “Request renovated rooms only”
Reviews.Author: odanilina
Reviews.Content: Hotel rooms are being renovated now. Therefore some of them (already renovated ones) are absolutely great and the old ones are... well, really old (furniture and all interior, bathrooms, conditioning system, etc.) especially when you've seen the others. Location and service are totally great, it's just a huge diffeence that you can get for the same value.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable stay in AWESOME location!”
Reviews.Author: allenandstef
Reviews.Content: We decided to spend a long weekend in San Francisco based on a great rate we found at the Grand Hyatt. The location is amazing! We took BART in from the airport and the hotel was an easy two-block walk from the Powell Station. It’s right on Union Square, making it close to all of the shopping in that area. It’s one block from the cable car and just a five minute walk from Chinatown. It’s a very short cab ride from the restaurants in North Beach or the sights in Fisherman’s Wharf. The sidewalks around the hotel were draped in scaffolding, which was a bit of a drag. They must’ve been doing some sort of renovations or other work to the exterior. The lobby is a bit dark and drab. Nothing special and certainly not inviting. The front desk agents, while extremely friendly and helpful, were slow. We frequently noticed long lines waiting for service, even with several agents working. But the room was quite comfortable and provided a great place to stay. The hotel is currently undergoing interior renovations. From what we were told by the front desk staff and what we saw, the lower floors have already been renovated. Since we requested a view, we were on an upper floor which had not yet been renovated. So for now, you can choose between a great view or a renovated room, but it appears that you can’t have both. When the elevator stopped on the renovated floors, they appear to have been completely overhauled – new flooring, wall coverings, furnishings, lighting, etc. If the hallway is any indication, the newly renovated rooms must be amazing. Though our room had not yet been renovated, it was still very comfortable. They furniture and some of the fixtures are a bit tired, but Hyatt’s Grand Bed provides for a great night’s sleep. And ultimately… that’s really all we needed out of the hotel. We had a city view – our room looked right across into the financial district. In fact, we even slept with the curtains open, lulled to sleep by the soft lights of the city’s skyline. That skyline also provided the perfect backdrop for the lounge on the upper floor. The workout facility was awesome – again, taking advantage of that amazing view. Though it didn’t have showers, or a steam room/sauna/Jacuzzi, it was the most well stocked hotel gym I’ve ever seen. Every piece of cardio equipment you could imagine, along with weight machines, free weights, benches, exercise balls, TVs, towels, etc. Very easy to get in a complete workout, no matter what your routine. As platinum members, we enjoyed free WiFi in our room. I didn’t notice what the normal charge is, but I’m sure it’s exorbitant. The connection was a bit slow, but it worked for what we needed. Had I been trying to work with that connection, it could’ve been somewhat frustrating. We never ate at the hotel, nor did we park there, so I can’t speak to those aspects. There didn’t appear to be anywhere to get coffee in the lobby. And it was excruciatingly slow and very difficult to get a cab for dinner on a Friday night. That’s certainly not the fault of the hotel, but something worth noting if you’re seeking a cab. All things considered, the Grand Hyatt was certainly not the nicest place we’ve ever stayed, but it was comfortable, safe and you can’t beat the location. It was a great base for our long weekend in San Francisco.

Reviews.Title: “Newly renovated rooms are nice, great location”
Reviews.Author: zracoon
