Reviews.Content: The Grand Hyatt's newly renovated rooms are really nice, have a very contemporary feel. Really liked the style, feels like a brand new hotel. Location can't be beat. It was raining the whole time we were there but walks to so many things were short so we didn't mind. Had breakfast at the Grandviews restaurant. Really good foot, nice portions, with spectacular views.

Reviews.Title: “Poor representation of Hyatt name and city of San Francisco.”
Reviews.Author: Tventertainment
Reviews.Content: When an out of town guest tells the front desk that they did not sleep well because of certain situations in the room, the response should not be " wear earplugs" the staff not only represents the entire hyatt brand but also the city they are in. Grand hyatt San Francisco did a POOR job of representing the hyatt name and the city of San Francisco. Any guest who tells a hotel staff that they have a problem should be addressed " how can I make your stay more comfortable" or " I'm sorry you had a problem let me see what we can do for you" Not met with a Rude response. I, my co-workers, company, Family and Friends will no longer consider hyatt hotels as a viable choice of stay.

Reviews.Title: “Or Concierge Was Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: vmullins
Reviews.Content: I had a meeting planned in San Francisco at the Grand Hyatt in January. It also happened to be my 35th wedding anniversary weekend. So my wife and I had our two sons join us from NYC to celebrate. San Francisco and the hotel were wonderful but our concierge Elizabeth Baca-Pryfogle made our trip one to remember. She recommended a great restaurant based on her personal experience. The next day we came back from a tour of Alcatraz to find a bottle of champagne with a note attached wishing us a happy anniversary and the following day she sent a fruit basket for us to enjoy. Although she was very busy she took the time to treat us like we were family. If you go to San Francisco stay at the Grand Hyatt and go see Elizabeth she is amazing. Virgil, Terri, Nick & Stephen

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel with friendly, happy staff in an awesome location”
Reviews.Author: Shoppee
Reviews.Content: Our impressions with the hotel started before we arrived: super-helpful reservation staff who helped us with all of our questions and requests. We arrived Christmas afternoon with 2 sick children (the long haul from Sydney had taken it's toll), but our room was beautiful (super-comfy beds). Furthermore, one of the lovely staff, who happily took table photos at our Christmas dinner in the restaurant), took in the fact that our oldest child barely ate due to illness and did not charge us for his meal. Every single staff person we came across smiled and said hello. Front Desk & Concierge were fantastic. And the location? Terrific! Wish we were back there now!

Reviews.Title: “Mixed Review”
Reviews.Author: JSTUsa
Reviews.Content: I stayed one night at the end of January. It was a Monday night so I was easily upgraded to a room with a view of the city. The reception staff was very polite and ultra obliging. The room was small with two double beds. Walking in the room was difficult due to too much furntiure in the room which led to a cramped feeling. There was a large armoire jutting into the room with an old fashioned TV. There was also a place for the mini bar but no mini bar. The two club chairs were too large for the room also. The beds were very comfortable though. The bath towels however were threadbare at best. They were so bad it was funny. As I was checking out my daughter struck up a conversation with a manager who told her the hotel was in the midst of a renovation and only half of the rooms were completed. Obviously not ours. Breakfast at the restaurant on top of the hotel was wonderful. The food on the buffet was fresh and delicious. The real treat was the view. This restaurant and bar at night have 360 degree views of the city. The morning we were there the weather was sunny and clear, so the city was beautiful

Reviews.Title: “good business hotel at Union Square”
Reviews.Author: wiggerl089
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Grand Hyatt for approx. 140 USD/night in a room with two queen beds (corporate rate). Nothing special, but a good deal for San Francisco. Bathroom was okay (US standard). The location cannot be better in my opinion, as you always come across Macy´s on your way to Moscone Center. The room was clean and looked after quite well. The beds are very comfortable with thick mattrasses. Good value.

Reviews.Title: “Love the renovation”
Reviews.Author: grif858
Reviews.Content: The renovation that's going on with the hotel is fantastic. Rooms are now fresh and very comfortable. With regards to available space in the room it's very spacious (compared to other SF hotels). There is now a blackout blind over the main windows, in place of heavy blinds, and you will easily sleep late with how dark it makes everything. Nicely done Hyatt

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed! More like a 3 star hotel at a great location.”
Reviews.Author: mrandmrsbear
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a great location right in Union Square, but that pretty much summed up all the good things I had to say about it. I have stayed at at least 10 different Grand Hyatts around the world, without counting the Park Hyatt stays, so it's safe to say that I know what the Grand Hyatt standards should be. As a Hyatt GPP Diamond member, I have always been guaranteed room upgrade to the next room category with welcome fruit baskets and wine and a personal note from the GM of the hotel already in the room before I check in almost every time I visit a Hyatt property. I might have been spoiled, but when I do spend so much time and money in their hotels I definitely expect more than average service and treatment. I wasn't quite impressed with the room assignment at check-in already. I was assigned a very small room that is not on the Club floor at first and didn't even get Club Lounge access. Front desk staff didn't seem to have any clue about my membership status until I inquired about it. I would expect that they should have been able to pull out this information from their system. Rooms are old and definitely require remodeling which I understand is underway. I have taken a look at both the renovated and non-renovated rooms and eventually picked the old room for the better view as the renovated room looked out to the back of the adjacent building. Room amenities were next to nonexistent. I had to call housekeeping to request for very basic amenities such as toothbrushes, toothpaste, slippers and bathrobes, which are normally complimentary in a Grand Hyatt elsewhere. Housekeeping was sloppy. The ironing board was left in the bathroom throughout the entire duration of our stay after we used it on the first day. The iron was left next to the sink in the bathroom and was not put away after our use. The half-empty takeout coffee from the Club Lounge was left on the top of the cabinet in my room for days until I disposed it myself. One day I left the "Private" sign on the door before I headed out and when I came back to the room that evening my room was cleaned up nonetheless. If I requested for privacy, I would expect the housekeeping staff to first confirm with me whether the sign was left there intentionally before breaking into my room while I wasn't there. The walls were paper thin. I could hear conversations going on in my neighbours' rooms and every morning I was woken up at 6am when the guests next door got up. I stayed at the St Regis during my last visit to SF a few months ago and I didn't have any of the problems I mentioned above, granted I'm also Platinum SPG member. Most importantly, I felt that I was treated like a valued guest while I was staying at the St Regis which is what every hotel should strive to achieve. My overall experience at Grand Hyatt SF was more like that of a no frills hotel, except I paid a lot more than what I would have had to pay for Motel 6. The top management of this hotel seems to have little appreciation of what managing a Grand Hyatt property should mean to the guests. Understand the hotel is undergoing a major upgrade on the hardware but I would suggest management also consider improving on their software so that the service and overall experience would be on par with the rest of the Grand Hyatt properties.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, Wonderful Service, Beautiful View”
Reviews.Author: CAFunMom
Reviews.Content: I took my daughter and her four friends to San Francisco for her 18th birthday. For the girls, we booked an executive suite, which was large (2 doubles and a queen sofa bed + two bathrooms) on the 20th floor with an unbelievable view. We had dinner in the Grandview Restaurant. The food was good, not exception, but the waiters were top notch. Some of us had steak, which was cooked to perfection. Needless to say, the view from the restaurant was spectacular. My daughter wasn't feeling well, so they made her chicken soup - very thoughtful. All rooms were very clean. The staff were all friendly and courteous. Everyone seemed to go out of their way to make sure our stay was wonderful. They are renovating some of the downstairs of the hotel, but it had no impact on us at all. We have stayed here a few times and have always had a wonderful time. They now really have my loyalty after handling my daughter's party so well, especially while she wasn't feeling the best. The following day we had a color consultation with Donna Fujii. The girls took their color fans with them shopping for the rest of the trip. It was a wonderful weekend to remember!

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: travelcath_11
Reviews.Content: Perfect location for first timers to SF. Loved the shopping nearby and the trams that were so close. The room was more then adequate in size with 2 double beds and good size bathroom facilities. The Wifi was a little expensive. But overall very enjoyable..

Reviews.Title: “A Grand Hyatt. In a great location”
Reviews.Author: DodgerRoger
Reviews.Content: Its a good Hyatt with all that entails. Excellent serice and a great loaction in San Fran. Rooms are maybe getting a little dated and I never undertand why the bathtubs are so small in the States but hey ho. I stay in this Hotel every year for a few days before heading onwards. Great connections for the airport, great shopping location, away from the tourist tat of Fishermans Wharf and plenty of good restraunts nearby.

Reviews.Title: “Started the New Year with the bang”
Reviews.Author: mugsymalone54
Reviews.Content: I had an amazing stay at Grand Hyatt San Francisco earlier this week. After a busy week at work I just wanted to get a way and relax and enjoy the city. I went to the hotel with my dog and I had a fabulous time. Everything about the hotel was perfect from the time I arrived at the front drive until I checked out of the hotel. Customer service at this hotel is exceptional. Mylene and Ron at the front desk are awesome. They went out of their way to make sure my pet and I had a perfect stay. My dog was so excited when she entered the room, there were doggie treats and doggie bowls and very nice comfortable bed for her. Housekeeping staff did a fantastic job taking care of the room and my stay was perfect. I will make sure to tell all my friends Grand Hyatt San Francisco.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel in a very good location”
Reviews.Author: 18Titles
Reviews.Content: San Francisco was our first stop in our four-weeks U.S. vacation for husband, I and our two kids. We chose Grand Hyatt and really love this hotel. We stayed here two years ago and this time we were given their newly renovated rooms. They are nicely done, with flat screen tv, functional workdesk and extremely comfortable and spacious twin beds. Love the location. Easy access to all the main shops - Macys, Neimann Marcus, Bloomingdales and many more. The Grand Club lounge at this hotel has a small but nice buffet and evening spreads. Worth paying the difference, especially if you are travelling with two kids. Reception staff, housekeeping and especially the doormen were very friendly and extremely helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Very Good Hyatt off Union Square”
Reviews.Author: BocaBlocks
Reviews.Content: This was the second time in 2 yrs that we stayed here. It is located right off Union Square so one can walk to SFMOMA, Westfield Mall & all the galleries & upscale shopping in and around Union Square. We booked room early because it was Thanksgiving week. The rate was lower than at the nearby Hilton & smaller, lower quality hotels surrounding Union Sq & it included very good buffet or cooked to order breakfast on the 36 floor with a great view of SF, Golden Gate, etc. Staff were all personable, knowledgeable and efficient. There is a full-time concierge to answer your questions rather than just front desk clerks. Room had all the amenities except they have not put in flat screen TV yet. There was some exterior construction around the front entrance but there was no disruption or noise. We still don't understand why inexpensive hotels provide free WiFi &/or ethernet, but more expensive chains charge >$10/day for internet connection.

Reviews.Title: “Poor service from staff”
Reviews.Author: good2gosc
Reviews.Content: My original reservation rate at my conference rate was not "captured" by the hotel computer, they called it a computer glitch but they did have my check in and out dates. I did have my confirmation so they reluctantly agreed to honor that price. They also charged me for an extra night because again there was a computer "Glitch" and they did not receive my check in change date that I did have a confirmation for. Again they reluctantly removed the extra charge. That was settled the first night I was there, or so I thought. The higher rate and exra night stayed on my credit card for the 4 days I was there and I had to go over all of the hassles when I checked out and they still billed me for everything they were supposed to remove. You must review all of the charges before you leave!! And always have your confirmation! Otherwise the hotel is located in a great spot for shopping and public transportation. The conference facility was great, no problems there and the food was excellent! Don't suggest the hotel restaurant though, overpriced average tasting food.

Reviews.Title: “Despite Its Struggles It Delivers on Location and Top Floor Bar”
Reviews.Author: MangoChetney
Reviews.Content: We are frequent visitors here. We went down to shop for Christmas on 12/3. Building is being refurnished to update rooms. Hope they do a good job for reasons posted on this board. Noise was not a problem. Cannot beat the location for shopping purposes. After Fairmont, Carnelian Room, and Hilton closed their top floor restaurants/bars, the Grand Hyatt is one of the few left with Mark Hopkins. BUT we heard a rumor they want to move the restaurant to ground level. We had very good staff services this trip. Agree with comments that this has always been geared as a business hotel. Wish they would have coffee out in the morning instead of forcing everyone across the street to Starbucks.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed!”
Reviews.Author: Travelbugtoo
Reviews.Content: I am a loyal Hyatt fan and had read recent reviews so knew this would not be a great stay this time but I was so disappointed. We arrived in a taxi and had quite a bit of luggage. There was no one to help us.So we dragged our luggage into the front foyer. Front desk were abrupt, unfriendly and not helpful. Rooms were OK Club staff were great! The hotel is in a great position but I doubt I will stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Expected so much more, got so much less”
Reviews.Author: CardQB
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Grand Hyatt in San Francisco to enjoy a nice "4 Star" hotel. What we got was lucky to be even a 3 Star experience that made a Motel 6 so much more appealing! First off, the hotel rooms are small and, as many have said, very outdated. This we could understand, San Francisco has limited space and obviously they can't expand outwards. So it was already expected for the size. BUT... what wasn't expected was the quality of the building and bed. We never thought we'd say this, but can't they afford to buy a new mattress? At an average of $200 a night for a room, you'd figure on sleeping on a comfortable mattress and not something that looks like it's been there since they opened the hotel 40 years ago. The king-size mattress had giant pits (I'd like to say dips, but they were way too deep) on both sides of the bed where people lay each evening. Only by placing one of the extra pillows into each crevice could the bed be made level to sleep on. This was TOTALLY UNACCEPTABLE for a hotel of this quality!! Come on, the mattress could have been replaced for the cost of a single night's stay. Not worthy of a so-called "4 Star" hotel. And the building... sure, it's a high-rise 36 story building and is bound to sway in the wind. But we were kept awake by the constant creeking, snapping and popping sounds that it made as it swayed in the breeze. We were waiting for the final loud pop before it collapsed on us. Other guests in the bar also complained of the same loud noises. Perhaps a building inspector should take a look before something bad happens? Then there was the refrigerator and mini-bar. If you're going to stay in the room expecting to use the refrigerator, think again. It was packed top to bottom with beer, soda and wines that if moved at all, you're IMMEDIATELY charged for. That's one high tech refrigerator.. but they can't even put in a flat screen tv? We called the front desk and they were very nice and said to go ahead and remove bottles to make the room we needed and they'd remove them off our bill. They did, no problem (at least not yet, we have not seen our credit card statement). The mini-bar lady came by before checkout to review the contents and noticed one bottle missing in the door of the refrigerator. We figured it was the only place they left for someone to put a drink, but apparently it wasn't fully stocked and was missing a bottle of wine. Good thing we found out, it was also removed from our bill. Note to those wanting a drink.. it's $9.00 for a can of beer. The shelves on the dresser/TV unit were also dedicated to fast grab snacks, so don't expect to use it for storing your clothes. They had mouse-trap like devices with candy bars in them. We'd hate to see the prices for those!! Everyone from the staff was very nice, unlike some comments we read on here. Staff made it feel like a 4-5 Star hotel, but the room was maybe a 2 Star, bar was okay and fitness gym was up to date. Now for parking... we didn't pay the $50+ parking fee for the hotel parking. Instead, we parked across the street at the Sutter-Stockton garage and paid a fraction the price the hotel wanted to charge. We arrived around 1 p.m. on Saturday and left at noon on Sunday. Paid only $28 parking. We highly recommend the Sutter-Stockton public parking garage. It's just a short walk and is diagonally across from the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Decent, but overshadowed by nearby options”
Reviews.Author: dtremit
Reviews.Content: The Grand Hyatt San Francisco would be a fantastic hotel in a lot of other cities in the world. Unfortunately, it's in San Francisco. I travel frequently to San Francisco, and have stayed frequently at other hotels; however, needing a one-night stay I decided to try out the Grand Hyatt. I should admit that there was nothing particularly wrong with my stay -- I had a perfectly adequate room on a high floor, with a nice view. However, as a Hyatt Diamond, I wasn't particularly impressed with the room -- based on the room map, it appears to have been one of the smallest in the hotel, and though high up, it wasn't on the same floor as the Grand Club. Furnishings were high quality, but a bit tired, with a worn counter in the bath. The bed was comfortable, and the room was very quiet. I didn't get a chance to check out the Grand Club, but it's not on the top floor of the hotel, which costs it a few points in my book. The cocktail lounge, which is on the top floor, has a nice northerly view of Coit Tower and the Transamerica, but it's kind of tight, and noisy, and the music from the private event next door kept intruding. Staff everywhere was pleasant, but not exceptional. All in all, I'd be perfectly happy with this property if there weren't so many other good options in the area. However, the Hyatt Regency is nicer for Hyatt loyalists, and the Westin is a better hotel in Union Square if you're a Starwood elite. And at the northeast corner of Union Square, it's a bit of a hike to transit compared to other nearby properties. So at the end of the day -- stay here if you get a deal, and you'll be perfectly happy, but don't pay a premium for the Grand Hyatt name.

Reviews.Title: “Bay or City view??”
Reviews.Author: BuffaloBill5463
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the hotel and found it surrounded by scaffolding but it did not put us off at all. We had booked a Bay View room but when we arrived the reception staff suggested that we have a City view room. We took their advice which was lucky really as the Bay was obscured for most of our stay by fog/low cloud. The city view from the 22nd floor was magnificent, especially at night. The room and hotel was spotlessly clean, the staff were very courteous, very helpful and knowledgeable. The hotel was very quiet where ever you went which was great so it was very easy to get a good nights sleep. We flew with Virgin and got two free nights which meant the hotel was very good value for money, if not cheap. However, if you factor in the location and quality of the hotel we were pleased overall. My only gripe was that I thought the bathroom should have been larger but that's me just being picky. I've kept the best until last. On the top floor of the hotel you'll find the restaurant and bar. The views are to die for. I would highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, reasonable rates”
Reviews.Author: Johnnysch
Reviews.Content: S Fco has three Hyatt hotels. The Grand Hyatt is the oldest I believe and it shows. Everything - rooms, facilities is just adequate. Location is great, just a step from Union Square, a couple of blocks to Market St to the nearest BART (Bay Area Rapid Transport) station. The no.30 bus takes you to Fishermans Wharf/Ghirardelli - as senior it cost me all of 75 cts. Cons: Breakfast buffet is overpriced (w/tips/ tax close to $30) and below standards of other Hyatt hotels I've stayed in. Go one block towards Chinatown and you'll find the Cafe de la Presse - great. Hotel has no pool, hot tub etc. There is no food other than breakfast, not even a sandwich but rooms have a bar fridge where you can keep some stuff if you take the cans etc out..S Fco is not great on corner shops, the nearest 7/11 is a couple of blocks away. Don't try to make tea with the coffeee maker- it will taste nothing like, I missed the plain kettle we have in any Australian hotel. Rates in Nov.2010 about US 200 (1-2 people) Internet - wired & wireless will cost you $10/day - cross street to Starbucks and you can log in for free. Finally, staff is very nice, friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “REVISIT UPDATE-REVIEW: still held its own ... convenient, comfortable, service”
Reviews.Author: Unbiased&FairAdvisor
Reviews.Content: This will be our 4th stay this year (another scheduled) at the Grand Hyatt in Union Square, and wanted to let all the "TA viewers" know that this hotel is still pleasant and comfortable enough for us to continue to patronize ... we've stayed at many other SF hotels, including the Hyatt Regency, the Meridian, the Hiltons, etc... The Grand Hyatt is not THE BEST, but does the job = convenient, comfortable, service. There are some good and some sorta bad ... please read on: The Goods: Service. During one stay, I requested a high floor, got it, and the views were very nice. We wanted a non-connecting room, and requested a change ... and Sebastian/Night Manager was terrific in helping move us to a different room, even upgrading us. Thank you Sebastian! The new view cleared all the surrounding buildings, and had a nice Northern view of SF Bay & Coit Tower. Comfort: The room was comfortable, as expected ... clean, with a very comfortable bed, and very quiet. Convenient: Union Square shopping and Chinatown, along with all sorts of transportation options were right outside the hotel. The 'bads': The hotel is clearly primarily a business/convention hotel. If you're looking for an intimate, warm, elegant, trendy or boutique/small hotel ... forget it! The staff was however, generally nice, and greeted us always. Make no mistake though ... this is the classic large, downtown business hotel (approx 36 floors), with a 'ga-jillion' rooms along with a semi-large gym/fitness center (no pool), as well as ballrooms/conference rooms, etc.. The rooms do need some updating: flat-screen TV needed, desk/table worn, aging tub, worn cabinets. It sounds worse than reality, so don't let this deter you (as many of the areas hotels have similar issues), but it's time for some updating. Overall: We didn't spend huge amounts of time in the room. We wanted to enjoy SF and surrounding areas. So, if all you need is a fairly comfortable, convenient hotel with enough amenities to make the stay enjoyable, you should be fine here. Get past the size, semi-warm staff, and basic-decorated rooms, you'll be fine. We recommend it for general use, but not necessarily for a romantic stay. PS - High speed internet free if Platinum member of their loyalty program. Happy Hotel-ing!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect hotel right on Union Square, but book through Priceline!”
Reviews.Author: caitrose12
Reviews.Content: I am ALL about DEALS, COUPONS, etc. I try not to pay full price for just about anything. And this is my favorite deal that I take advantage of the most often! We live in Sacramento, so we go to San Francisco very often. Whether it's a weekend trip with just my husband and I, or just about anytime our family and friends come to visit-- we stay a night or two in San Fran. This is the BEST deal. Just "name your own price" on Priceline for Union Square in San Francisco. Keep it at the HIGHEST amount of stars. We've gotten weeknights for $80, weekends for $90-100. Their parking is way overpriced. If you're traveling with a handicap person (my mom is) parking is free! If not, park at a local garage for better pricing. The rooms are great, the service is great (ask the concierge in the lobby for advice and reservations!) It's walking distance from everything in Union Square. We LOVE it!!!! Ask for a room with a view!

Reviews.Title: “fantastic location”
Reviews.Author: jesmas
Reviews.Content: absolutely wonderful views from grandviews on 36th floor. our room was on 23 floor and we had great view of city. staff were super helpful and friendly. everything is within easy reach and we would definately stay there again. definate praise for all staff.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel with fantastic views!”
Reviews.Author: Reviewer46
Reviews.Content: Stayed on 20th floor overlooking Union Square. Great views from dining room and fitness center. Great fitness center! Would stay there on my next visit to SF.

Reviews.Title: “Grand Hyatt - wonderful value for money”
Reviews.Author: Oracle68
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Grand Hyatt with my family in October 2010. Next to Union Square, the hotel is currently renovated, but this made no difference to our stay. Rooms are a bit outdated and need the renovation, but the hotel staff is in excellent location, staff are simply wonderful and this was one of the most value for money hotels I have stayed. Nothing negative to talk about, I would certainly stay there again and again and again (especially following renovations).

Reviews.Title: “Under Construction: Stay Away!”
Reviews.Author: nattofsachse
Reviews.Content: Jackhammers begin at 9 am, and the front desk treats us like we're unreasonable to want to sleep in on our vacation. Then a strange man leaps onto our balcony and begins painting it at 11 am with NO WARNING! We were supposed to stay a week and we're checking out today!

Reviews.Title: “Best place to be in San Francisco,”
Reviews.Author: Rajreviews
Reviews.Content: We have experienced the best of hospitality at Grand Hyatt and we wish all of you planning a visit to this hotel experience it too. I was surprised as well when I had reviews of this hotel earlier as they were not very positive, but absolutely it is an excellent place to be in. 1. proximity to the best shopping and restaurants. 2. Wonderfully concierge. Very helpful and informative. 3. Excellent Regency club lounge on 33 floor. 4. Well connected to local sights.

Reviews.Title: “Almost cool in a retro mad men sort of way”
Reviews.Author: Gandaratravels
Reviews.Content: This hotel is well located, but very tired. My room was very warn--almost everything was chipped, scuffed, or scratched. The bath products (maybe standard at hyatt in the US? Not in Asia/Australia) smelled disgusting, like artificial melon bubble gum. The location is very handy--but there are lots of hotels (at least 30) nearby, so this isn't such a selling point. The views are very nice, and the bones of the building are cool enough. I think this hotel could be amazingly renovated. I can easily imagine it becoming as hip as the Standard in New York. Even if it didn't take a hip turn, it could be brought up to speed with other better hyatts...probably with so many amazing hotels in SF, there just isn't demand for another top tier hotel in the current economy. Until it is renovated, I'll be sleeping (and eating) elsewhere when I visit San Francisco.

Reviews.Title: “Nice room in excellent location”
Reviews.Author: ocvbtraveler
Reviews.Content: We stayed one night at this hotel. It was in an excellent location for us to walk to so many different sites throughout the city. The room was well equiped with all the basics. The bed was very comfortable. The staff was very nice and helpful. Great views of the city from the restaurant at the top too.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location!”
Reviews.Author: leileiDetroit
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent a few days here is September 2007. The hotel is nice and modern and the location is perfect. We walked everywhere! The staff is friendly and we would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Fine Hotel in a Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Honest-Jim
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 4 nights in September 2010. The location, just off Union Square, is excellent with Market Street just a few minutes away for access to the MUNI and BART transport systems. For shopaholics, loads of fine shops around. Plenty of restaurants in the immediate vicinity and Chinatown is barely a 5 minute walk away. The rooms were surprisingly large, with a fine, large comfortable bed. The standard of cleanliness and housekeeping was also good. We heard no street noise on the 26th floor, excepting occasional emergency vehicle sirens. The only negative comment I have of the hotel as a whole is that we felt the rooms themselves could do with a makeover – seemed a bit on the tired and dowdy side. I was especially surprised to see an old fashioned CRT TV – we’re more used to LCD TVs these days. We enjoyed the very excellent bar on the top floor (36th floor) where the views were quite stunning. A good drinks menu, but we never had a full meal in the restaurant, preferring to eat out although we did enjoy a pizza on our first evening after an 11 hour flight as we were tired but not especially hungry; it was fine. Bar prices were not too expensive considering the status of the hotel and the location, so we used it quite a lot. We always found the staff to be very helpful and attentive. In all, an excellent stay and would definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice, centrally located hotel”
Reviews.Author: capecodd
Reviews.Content: The service at this hotel is performed graciously and precisely. The reservation staff went out of their way to make sure we were registered for their points program as they currently had a special promotion going on. All other personnel was firendly, gracious and expedient. The room was tastefully done,beds very combortable,temperature easily adjusted. The only comment might be that the hotel needs to upgrade to flat screen tvs in the rooms. Currently the outside facade is being rennovated and I believe there are plans to rennovate on parts of the inside.. Location is very cental on Union Square and very easy to start walking trips around San Francisco. Disliked the room tvs. Enjoyed the top floor dining room particularly the continental breakfast buffet and great view.

Reviews.Title: “Great value and wonderful view”
Reviews.Author: hikerprincess
Reviews.Content: Great view of bay, we loved upgrading to a club pass!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location”
Reviews.Author: Anon015
Reviews.Content: Ideally suited as a base to discover the city. Close to the shops, tour buses and car hire. The walk down to Fisherman's Wharf is a bit of a trek but well worth the effort as you walk through Chinatown and beyond. Breakfast was a little expensive but the service and the views were excellent. For a cheaper option - hop across the road to Starbucks, which has free wi-fi for the teenagers! Would definitely stay here again - the Bay View room was worth the upgrade.

Reviews.Title: “Great View”
Reviews.Author: Ronaldo_o
Reviews.Content: Despite the expensive breakfast and internet access, this hotel is perfect: great location, since it is near of many interesting places; amazing views, mainly from the restaurant on 36th floor; and friendly staff.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, amazing staff”
Reviews.Author: macaroonlunch
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a good location. Walking distance to union square, shopping, BART, restaurants etc. Felt very safe to walk around. Staff was very friendly. Check in was easy, no line and it was 4pm. We traveled with friends and asked to be put on the same floor. The hotel didn't have two rooms ready on the same floor. The bell desk took our luggage for storage and the front desk clerk told us it would be an hour. No problem, we went to get coffee, convenient location right across the street. 15 minutes later we received a phone call that our rooms were ready. The doorman are very helpful with directions, maps, recommendations and putting you in a taxi without waiting very long in the car. What really impressed me with the customer service was when we took a town car to the airport. At check in we realized that we left our laptop in the car. I called the hotel and told them what happened and was told they would check on it. 5 minutes later I was told the driver was on his way back to the airport to drop it off.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent, centrally located”
Reviews.Author: areview28
Reviews.Content: The Grand Hyatt is a large luxury hotel just off Union Square. Most of the San Francisco tourist sights are quickly reachable by buses or cable cars passing near the hotel. The Powell street BART station is just a few blocks away and provides an inexpensive way to reach the San Francisco International airport. Rooms are spacious and clean, and have all the luxuries you would expect from this class of hotel, but the TV in our room was a 25 inch tube, a vanishing beast. Our 8th floor room suffered from street noise, so ask for a higher floor if you need a quiet atmosphere. Our room had pay-for-use wired and wireless Internet, but the wireless signal was weak. The lobby space is pretty small and not the usual atrium like in the other San Francisco Hyatt on the Embarcadero. Grandviews lounge and restaurant on the 36th floor has a spectacular view of San Francisco Bay and reasonable prices given the location and class of hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice experience.”
Reviews.Author: tsinpa
Reviews.Content: I had a six night stay wrapped around the Labor Day weekend and was pleasantly surprised with the Grand Hyatt. This was my first visit to San Francisco and choosing a hotel took some time and research. The location is terrific with easy access to all public transportation.(Get the muni pass; it is a tremendous bargain). The lobby was on the small side, but so what? It is very attractive and offers all the services you expect in a good hotel.Prompt, courteous staff with special mention going to the concierge desk. I reserved a bay-view, non-smoking room with a king-sized bed. I ended up in a room on the 26th floor that appeared to have undergone a fairly recent remodel. Extremely clean and very nicely furnished with a bed that was heaven on earth. If I have any "complaints", they are minor. The walls were a tad thin(heard the neighbors a few times), the exhaust fan in the bathroom didn't have a wall switch that I could find(got pretty steamy after a hot shower) and calling this a bay-view room was true but it would be better to call it a bay and city view room. Yes, I could see the bay but the majority of the view was of other buildings. The view was beautiful(especially at night) and I was not at all unhappy about it, but labeling it a bay-view room created expectations of an unobstructed view of the bay. In addition to the concierge staff, here are some more special mentions for this hotel: 1) Iron and ironing board(very handy!!) 2) Free daily newspaper 3) Lots of upscale shopping nearby 4) Wide variety(price and menu offerings) of restaurants nearby 5) Theater district is also nearby 6) Walgreens right around the corner for those items you forgot to pack 7) Shuttle service to/from SFO a bargain at $16.00 8) Alarm clock on the night table as a back up for my cell phone alarm(don't laugh) 9)Etc.................

Reviews.Title: “Great location but hotel looks worn”
Reviews.Author: felix190
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Grand Hyatt for 2 nights. The hotel is in a great location - you're about 3 minutes away from Market Street, where you can hop on the MUNI and BART to pretty much anywhere in the city. It's right across from Union Sq and next door to Chinatown and the Cable Car lines. Plenty of eating and shopping options in the area as well. We booked the hotel through a priceline bid (about $100/night cheaper than the regular rates), but the staff person that checked us in (I think his name was Ryan) was friendly and welcoming nonetheless. The room looks worn out though - the tv, the carpet, the furniture all look like they need to be replaced soon. The bathroom also looks worn. But at least the room itself was clean (no bugs!) and the bed was very comfortable. I would probably stay here again just for its location but only if I could a discounted rate again - otherwise, there are probably better options out there.

Reviews.Title: “Don't Let the Bed Bugs Bite”
Reviews.Author: HiddenLily
Reviews.Content: This is a lovely hotel and would receive my recommendation to friends and family were it not for the bed bug bites my husband received staying there. On the second day of our stay, my husband noticed red welts on his arm. We reported the bites to the hotel staff and were moved to a new room. My husband spoke with a manager and maintenance man who inspected our old room. They claimed no evidence of a problem. I suppose my husband's bites weren't weighed as evidence. As a precaution against bringing pests home, we disposed of all the luggage and clothes we had brought into the room. I hope the hotel takes our report seriously and treats the room, but with the plethora of hotels available in San Francisco I would recommend staying elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, nice views”
Reviews.Author: WDWDolphinFan
Reviews.Content: The location of the Grand Hyatt is very convenient, and the views from the bar & restaurant on top are great. Our bay-view room was smaller than the one we'd had at the St. Francis last summer, and our view was not quite as good (although some bay-view rooms would have truly fantastic views). Our room faced toward the financial district (which was actually rather attractive at night), with some views of the bay at the sides. The few things that brought the hotel down a notch for me may not matter to others. The lobby was virtually non-existent, with nothing there but the check-in desk & concierge. No sundry shop, no gathering place, etc. I missed the feel and amenities of the St. Francis's lobby. The buffet breakfast, while in a room with a great view, was disappointing and sub-par (particularly the muffins and croissants). It's been a while since I've had croissants that bad. Aside from these things, I would have given the hotel 4 stars.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location and very nice rooms.”
Reviews.Author: geckogirlVirginia
Reviews.Content: This hotel was great. It is very conveniently located. The lobby is so beautiful and the view from the rooms is awesome. Book a room with the regency club-the evening snacks and breakfast are a great deal and quite good. The fitness center is not great, but overall it is a nice place. The parking price is ridiculous, however ($50/day)

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Concierge!”
Reviews.Author: kath256
Reviews.Content: I stayed in the Grand Hyatt for a full week during August 2010 with some friends. While San Francisco weather was seasonably cooler than usual by about ten degrees, the staff at the Hyatt was warm and friendly (pardon the pun)! It was everyone's first time in the city and every morning when we went downstairs to begin our adventures, we would stop and ask the concierge for advice. Every day they were pleasant and incredibly helpful providing maps, public transportation information, ferry information, and even helped us plan a day trip to Muir Woods. Additionally, they were assisted in getting a car service to take my friends and I back to the airport for our VERY early flight home. They called to confirm the night before and called in the morning when the car had arrived. I cannot say enough wonderful things about the staff!!! The only negative would be the somewhat dated room furniture, but very clean and neat!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location”
Reviews.Author: valbres
Reviews.Content: The location is perfect at Union Square, walking distance to the starting line of the race. Great restaurants everywhere, metro station to the airport a couple of blocks away. Check-in was like being interrogated by the KGB; my room had been booked under my friend's name and when the reservation had been made the hotel said all I had to do was change it to my name and credit card when I got there. My friend had even called the front desk that day to follow up and was told no problem everything would be taken care of when I got there. Then I got there and the story changed. At first the manager said "Oh we don't do that anymore" and told me I couldn't have the room as if I'm just going to say "OK", turn around, go back to the airport and fly 3,000 miles back home. I just kept standing there while he fussed and fretted around and I called my friend and asked her to call the manager and he finally relented and let me check in. The room was small which was ok because I don't take up much space but the first night (a weeknight) there was noise from the street like construction going on. My only real complaints were charging for Wi-Fi (a Marriott thing) and lack of electrical outlets--one in the bathroom and one under the little desk that I had to get down on my hands and knees to access. Laptop, ipod, cellphone, Bluetooth=4 outlets. The concierge was wonderful in getting me a 1-day car rental and had excellent written directions for getting out of the city. If you are driving in don't park in the hotel garage--drive around the hotel for a couple of blocks and shop around--I saw one garage that charged half of what Hyatt does.

Reviews.Title: “Great service; great location.”
Reviews.Author: melson3
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 5 nights at this hotel in mid-July 2010, and found the service and location to be exemplary. Front desk was incredibly helpful in helping us get delayed luggage from United (never trust United's SFO baggage dept). All requests for additional towels, pillows, were filled promptly. Location is terrific--2 minutes from the Chinatown arch entryway; around the corner from Union Square (with Macy's, etc.). Many mid-priced restaurants within 1-2 blocks (try Lefty O'Douls at 333 Geary st, diagonally across Union Square; they have full meals (cafeteria style) for $11 (!). Less than 15 minute walk to many major museums; easy access to BART and to Cable cars. Also, they offer 2 prices for parking--if you drive 1/2 block, they have a deal with a garage that offers 24-hour parking for $33; you can come and go (no extra charges for taking the car out and then returning/ it's all valet at the garage; we tipped $2 each time/ very quick). More expensive garage diagonally across the street but we're talking 25 yards v. 50 yards. Believe it or not, the $33 is actually a low rate for this area. The room was very comfortable; a bit on the small side (seems typical for SF); beds very comfortable. Top floor restaurant has great views and a very good buffet breakfast (not cheap, but nothing is). If you use the AAA rate, you get 2 breakfasts included.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful design, helpful staff, starting a major renovation”
Reviews.Author: dldmia
Reviews.Content: The hotel design is great, sort of compact although it has amazing views from the top floor, where there is a bar, restaurant and meeting rooms. The manager, David, is a classy guy who takes pride in this property. He has an awesome golden retriever, Bailey. Shortcomings - a little noisy early in the morning - when dumpsters in the area are emptied. The sliding doors on the rooms could have better sound-proofing. Also, the windows needed cleaning. Strengths - location, ease of getting in and out, and to meeting rooms below, comfort of rooms, cleanliness of rooms, staff, spectacular views from the top. They staff was very friendly and helpful. They will be undergoing a huge renovation, and I look forward to visiting it again.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous location, antique TV'S”
Reviews.Author: zeketheportie
Reviews.Content: Great location, no problem with the service, speedy check in and never had to wait long for an elevator! Concierge was helpful on getting us Hop on Hop off tickets and also for telling us to get on the trolley at Saks instead of waiting 2.5 hours at the bottom of Powell St. BUT REALLY FOR A DOWNTOWN HOTEL OF THIS QUALITY HAVING OLD TVS AND CHARGING FOR INTERNET??? It seems the more expensive the hotel the more expensive the internet. Get flat screens and include the internet in the room rate.

Reviews.Title: “Bellow other Hyatt's I've been to”
Reviews.Author: dams73
Reviews.Content: The hotel needs a serious refresh. I was there for one night and I specifically asked for a non smoking room, I got a room that still had smels of smoke. The curtains had holes (probably from cigarettes burns) and there were stains on the lampshade. Not that I'm partciularily looking at this but it is not what I expect from a hotel of this category.

Reviews.Title: “Just perfect”
Reviews.Author: the-surveyor
Reviews.Content: Recommended by our travel agent who got us a very good price. We were very impressed with the size of the rooms (we had interconnecting rooms at a corner), the comfort of the beds and the overall arrangement. We did not use the facilities of the hotel very much, but the location was very good for getting anywhere in the city, especially the buses, cable cars and trolley buses. We used a cable car to get to the Alcatraz Cruises Pier and including the walk it took less than 30 minutes.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel in top location”
Reviews.Author: Urbanoid
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my family for four nights as part of a tour of the US. After a somewhat belated access to our room, at the 24th floor, we could enjoy the view of the Eastern part of downtown SF and the bay - just like we had requested. The room had an ok size, good beds - and a television from the last century... We did not watch anything else than a couple of weather forecasts, but a flat screen could save some space! The service of the hotel was, apart from the check-in, was excellent. However, in this class and price range, one could expect services as WiFi to be free. The $10 ålus charge per day seems both 'cheap' and out of date. The location at the NE corner of Union Sq is absolutely fantastic. The next time we go to SF, and we will!, our hotel research will have to come up with an absolute stunner to top this one.

Reviews.Title: “You Can Count on Hyatt”
Reviews.Author: Katsandcards_8
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Grand Hyatt for 2 nights and it was great. Typical Hyatt - nice service, check-in was friendly & quick, concierge was friendly and knowledgable about the area, and rooms were clean. It's a downtown Hyatt, so there is no parking (be prepared for the $45 overnight parking fee), and the lobby is crowded all day - but the location is in the heart of San Fran - 2 blocks from Chinatown - 1 block from Union Square - tons of restaurants and bars around. The top floor bar and restaurant offers one of the best views of the city day or night. If you're looking for a "boutique" or B&B type hotel expereince, don't stay here. Otherwise - this makes a great home base for San Fran exploring.

Reviews.Title: “Nice but not over the top.”
Reviews.Author: Brent_Herridge
Reviews.Content: We stayed 2 days, driving to Napa and back on day 2. We wished we had stayed 2 nights in Bodega Bay instead. That was wonderful for about the same money.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for the family”
Reviews.Author: glendalegal
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 3 nights of our family vacation with our 3 children (17+ years old.) Got the AAA rate with breakfast included and used Hyatt dollars we bought at Costo for an extra 20% off so the price was great for two adjoining rooms. Enjoyed the buffet breakfast on the top floor with a great view. Chinatown was around the corner as were the shops of Union Square. Parking was pricey, but no more so than the other parking lots we checked. Room was clean and quiet, beds were cushy and big enough for my daughters to share comfortably. All in all, a perfect place to land after a day of sightseeing.

Reviews.Title: “Great staff (esp Club level) and location, rooms needs updating”
Reviews.Author: Tink1234
Reviews.Content: We stayed here while my husband was at a conference and we couldn't have been happier with the location and staff. All of the concierges were fantastic as were the staff in the Regency Club lounge. Outside of Asia, I have yet to see a club that surpasses this one. The food was terrific (and based on how long people were hanging out around the dinner hour, we weren't the only ones who made it into dinner!) and the staff truly exceptional. My only complaint was how dated the guestrooms were. Not dirty or worn but still in need of updating. But the staff was SO good that I am still giving it 4 stars. The management can rightly be proud of their staff - reading other reviews I see that lots of people agree with me - the staff makes this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Nowandthen2
Reviews.Content: Great location, staff was fabulous, bar/restaurant on top floor is nice with a great view, room price was reasonably priced as I was able to use a discount code. I would definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “great location - less then great hotel”
Reviews.Author: David48025
Reviews.Content: The location was great but hardly worth the price. Lots of great food close by. Room and hotel were not anything more then your standard 4 star business hotel. The only thing I remembered was that hotel parking was outrageous - but as they say, when in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Grand Hyatt in grand location”
Reviews.Author: seem123
Reviews.Content: After a 14hour flight we checked in this hotel the staff was very friendly ,concierge was very helpful and we got a nice comfortable room though little small in size but clean. It is just one block from the Union square so the location is fantastic. Tram station is 2 minutes walk and there are couple of good restaurants close by. Buffet breakfast had a good spread and a good view of the city from the coffee shop

Reviews.Title: “Decent hotel in a fabulous location!”
Reviews.Author: wrale577
Reviews.Content: I really liked this hotel as I was having issues finding a nice hotel at a fair price around Union Square that being said I think the Grand Hyatt is the best value in Union Square. I thought the hotel was very clean and well decorated. The rooms are decent, wicked soft beds, the TV was horrific, and the bathroom was clean and fairly spacious. My only comment about the view is you get what you pay for... what I mean is that if you book on priceline, expedia, orbitz, etc.... they give you the base ho-hum room, but you have the option to PAY for a better view either on hyatt.com or at check-in and to have a view of the bay its like $30-50 more per night which I think is highway robbery, but if they make money on that than so be it. The parking is incredibly easy, there is a 24-hr valet garage less than half a block away on Sutter they charged me $32 a night which for the location in SF that is dirt cheap. However charging $10 internet is a hose job. You get a $15 voucher for breakfast at the rooftop restaurant which is nice. The breakfast is excellent and the view is even better. However, make sure you know the hours of breakfast service because I got hosed on Mother's day because they stopped serving an hour earlier then the guest book says and as I checked out a little later that morning I noticed on the desk the flyers saying something about a mother day brunch thing... regardless I had no clue of the hour changes because I checked in 4 nights ago and complained to the desk person and he took off the $40 (4 day) internet charge for my trouble. I was more upset about not being able to eat there because the food is so good and the view is wonderful. Another issue I had was loud and rowdy people in the hall at 1AM. A quick call to the front desk eliminated the noise problem within minutes. I heard the elevator chime within 30 seconds of the call hang up. Its nice that security is fast and prompt here. Overall I would stay there again, if I wanted to be in Union Square. Two small flies in the ointment wont dissuade me from staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Really helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: Eskimo21
Reviews.Content: Location wise it's a couple of miles from the main tourist ares but can walk and plenty of public transport options. Very close to the main shopping area though. Room was clean and comfortable. Bar and restaurant on top floor offers good value snacks, drinks and food and staff were very, very good. Concierge was excellent in helping with maps, excursions etc. Not ideal for kids but for couples on a city break or people on a business trip it offers a good standard and a reasoable price.

Reviews.Title: “What a great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Neile7
Reviews.Content: I have just spent 4 wonderful nights in the Grand Hyatt. You could not ask for a more centrally located hotel to go shopping, dining, chilling out in union square over a coffee and of course the cable car terminal. After a very long trip from UK to San Fran, we were greeted at the front desk by `Wayne`, who was very pleasant, courteous and exactly the right person to greet you after a long haul. Checking in was a breeze and after chatting about our trip we were given a room higher up on the 29th floor overlooking Union Square. Wow!! What a view. Thanks again Wayne. The rooms are very clean, tidy and the beds are comfortable. Our room had a mini-bar, TV, Alarm clock with i-pod docking and the usual iron, hair dryer and coffee making facilities. There is a room safe for your valueables, but if you want you can also get a box at reception. There is a good gym on the 35th floor with the usual runners/cycles and x-trainers as well as weight machines. The kit all looks modern and you can plug your i-pod into them or watch TV on the individual screen. It does get busy around 0700. The staff and concierge are very polite and accomodating. They sell tour tickets on the open top bus at a discounted rate, the bus is definitely worth doing to get your bearings and introduce you to all the districts, plus it stops outside the Grand Hyatt and goes over the Golden Gate bridge. A definite must is to go to the 36th floor for a drink or just to look out the panoramic window for a view of the bay and coit tower. We were fortunate to have great clear weather and had a fantastic view. Absolotely Wonderful. We decided to eat in the restaurant, the service is very good and the duty manager made sure everything was to the customers satisfaction. The starters were great, but I felt the main didn`t match up to the 1st course and I have to say I have eaten better for less $$, although those times are few and far between. However, it is definitely worth the experience of looking out onto San Fran enjoying a meal and cool glass of wine, watching the sun set over the horizon, a definite tick in the box thing to do. If you don`t want a big meal, they also do bar food in the bar area and a to-go service. I cannot fault the service and experience I had staying here, perhaps because I was on a high floor added to the experience, but I would definitely go back to the Grand Hyatt, if I were to return to San Fran.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: OlySilver
Reviews.Content: The room was spacious and clean, the bed was comfortable, and the location was convenient. Unfortunately, there wasn't much sound-proofing, so we had a lot of noise from the neighbors and the hallway. Also, I had called in advance to request a room with a view of the bay, but we got a view of the parking lot next door. When I called the front desk to ask about switching, they were rude about the fact that I had bid on Priceline. All in all, it was worth it because I got a good deal, but had I paid full price I would have been very disappointed by the noise, view, and service.

Reviews.Title: “Hyatt Quality in Downtown SF but BEWARE of "fees"”
Reviews.Author: filmtheory
Reviews.Content: Pros: Great location, nice room view (but average size), top floor restaraunt/bar views of city were amazing. Food was good, but not great. Paid $179 for room - seems 'fair' but am sure other good options out there, too. Overall nice Hyatt quality comes at a steep price with hidden fees (see below) Cons: Hyatt will "rape" you in various charges and fees. Like charging $55 dollars for overnight car parking. Or $10 dollars for daily Wi-Fi connection. And if you use their in room phone to the tune of like $3 dollars a minute. It's straight up theft. I complained to management for a $60 dollar charge for 20 minute call and they seemed oblivious. I tried watching an in room movie VOD and the picture quality was terrible, too. Also, my room was near elevator shaft and I could hear the roar of the elevator in the bathroom sometimes. Was I satisfied overall? Yes. Would I stay there again? Probably not.

Reviews.Title: “It was just okay, and really nothing special”
Reviews.Author: kmhaley
Reviews.Content: My husband was taking a class in town, so we stayed for four nights and five days. This hotel, I thought, would be much more grand and the rooms a little fancier - everything about it was just average. I told the woman at the front desk that we were newlyweds, hoping for something cozy, and we ended up with a room facing the back of two other buildings. It was nothing like what I expected after seeing other reviews raving about the view. No view at all, even though the hotel was not exactly full. I would never pay the rates they want - which must be due to the proximity to Union Square. And they are "steps away from Chinatown" but also border an area of town that isn't very nice. I'm recommending only because I have friends who would love to be as close as this is to all of the stores.

Reviews.Title: “Not So Great”
Reviews.Author: myhumblethoughts
Reviews.Content: The hotel was easy to find and right on Union Square. As far as location goes I don’t have any complaints. We pull up in front of the hotel and stop in the valet parking area. Kindly the valet attendant notified us of the daily parking rate and also a secondary parking location with a cheaper daily rate (not ran by the hotel). The secondary parking structure was around the corner. I didn’t feel like driving anymore so I stayed with the original hotel valet and paid the extra $15 bucks a day. Checking in was seamless..Only a few people in line with plenty of staff to help out. The grand lobby area was not so impressive; maybe I’m becoming a snob because my last hotel stay was in the Bellagio in Las Vegas. Anyways, nothing really impressive about the entry way, but nonetheless we were on our way up to the room quickly. We booked one of the "club level" rooms with a view of the bay. Well, the room was very, very small for a semi suite. Yes, I do understand that San Francisco typically has small rooms, but that's way I paid the extra money to enjoy a little more room with some relaxing views. The bathroom was small and pretty standard, nothing to brag about. The television was probably a 27-inch tube style. The least you could do is pull out these old style TV’s...donate them while they're still working and spend a couple hundred bucks for some nice flat screens. At least they should do that for the suites. The furniture seemed a little outdated...come to think of it the whole interior of the hotel seemed a little outdated. The view...yes we did see the bay, but it was hindered by the view of the roof tops on the nearby buildings. Not quite the enjoyable view I imagined, besides there wasn't any room to sit down and take it all in. After a quick relaxation on the bed we decided to go upstairs and enjoy some hors d’oeuvres (not sure if I spelled that correctly) in the lounge specifically for "club level" guest. Again, nothing to really brag about here...the food was typical and nothing exciting. Only 1 television tucked away in the corner where only 2 tables could view it. At least the TV here was a decent size maybe a 40-inch LCD. I was able to catch some highlights of the NBA playoffs. The bar was an "honor" bar; basically you make your own drinks, fill out a card specifying how many and have it charged to your room. Not a bad choice of drinks...there was enough options to satisfy your thirst, also the soft drinks, water and coffee was free. After, leaving the lounge we decided to relax a little more before trying the hotel restaurant boasting of beautiful views. The bed was a little stiff and the sheets were standard, maybe a 200 thread count. After a little cat nap we started getting dressed and to my surprise, I can’t seem to find a power outlet. The power outlets were all behind the night stand, the bed or the table. The table was easiest to get to but had several items plugged into it (coffee maker, telephone, lamp, TV). After crawling under the table to plug in the iron I noticed that there was an available outlet on the base of the lamp. That was the only outlet available in the whole entire room (besides the bathroom). Although, this was a leisure trip, I still work on my laptop; charge my cell, etc. etc. With this set-up I was only able to do one at a time. One plus was the iron itself...I'd have to say it was a great iron. A kinda funny giving prop to an iron, but it was worth mentioning. Ah the restaurants...nothing spectacular, not even the views. The food was sub-par but the drinks were poured nicely. Service was decent and the food was brought out in a timely manner. The views of the city lights were ok, but nothing to brag about. The price of the food was a little steep, but that was kind of expected. Walking out of the restaurant we passed a piano lounge/bar. It was very crowded, and people seemed to be enjoying themselves. We decided to hit the streets of SF instead. The fitness center was pretty much what you need in a fitness center. Had all the basics…treadmills, stationary bikes, dumbbells, resistance machines and televisions. I used the treadmill for awhile and the resistance machines without incident. Towels and water was readily available. Check out was just as seamless as check in. We paid our additional expenses and in our vehicle within 5 minutes. Overall not a bad stay, but we were expecting a little more. Hope this helps. Thanks!

Reviews.Title: “High class property in the heart of the city”
Reviews.Author: PG32
Reviews.Content: I was pleasantly surprised by this hotel. From some of the reviews I expected a tired old property in need of renovation. This was not the case. The rooms are a bit on the small side but that is to be expected in the city. They are tastefully decorated. The bathroom appeared to have been redone fairly recently. Overall the room was clean and comfortable. The location and views cannot be beat. Enjoy your stay.

Reviews.Title: “Very comfortable room and great staff”
Reviews.Author: paulieuk
Reviews.Content: Whilst its true the hotel is due for refurbishment (front desk said the gradual process was to start late 2010) I found the room and the furnishing to be quite acceptable and the bed, the most important thing in the room, was huge, incredibly comfortable and the bedding fresh clean and of high quality - resulting in a great night's sleep. The staff were all great - friendly and enthusiastic - from front desk, to doormen to the executive lounge staff. The breakfast there was adequate in quantity and quality, but get there early for the view! Free wifi is available in the lounge too, though it closes early at 2100. Location has been enthused about before, and the view from my room was stunning, it has to be said.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Good Rate, and Super Friendly Staff”
Reviews.Author: LaCruz
Reviews.Content: I can't say enough about the great experience my friend and I had at the Grand Hyatt. The room was more than adequate, the good rate included breakfast (anything on the menu), parking was a bit expensive but we received a 25% discount. Only negative was to pay for internet - in this day and age - guests should receive free internet. This amenity is free from a Best Western to a Bed & Breakfast, why not at a large hotel chain? The staff, from the doorman, to the bellman, front desk, concierge, and wait staff went out of their way to be accommodating and upbeat.

Reviews.Title: “A Quick Weekend Visit”
Reviews.Author: VacationPlanner
Reviews.Content: We stopped over for two nights in San Francisco to do a college tour for our teenage son after spending several days in Monterey. This was our third straight year we have stayed at the Grand Hyatt while visiting the city and our fourth stay overall. As usual we walked almost everywhere, to the Westfield Mall and the Powell Street BART station, North Beach, the Financial District and over to the Ferry Building. We requested a room on the Gold Passport Floor and received access to the Regency Lounge located on the 32nd floor. This is a great place for a light breakfast in the morning and we enjoyed juice, hot coffee, fresh fruit and muffins on our last day there. This was a lot less stressful than standing in line for an hour to have breakfast at one of the small and popular cafes at the edge of the Tenderloin which we did the previous day. Service from the front desk, concierge, bellmen, the host at the Regency Club and room staff was professional and courteous. I noticed that the door and bellmen kept a close but discrete watch of people entering the lobby area, which I really appreciated and took as a sign of additional security for the hotel guests. We checked out early but asked the hotel to hold our luggage until it was time to go out to the airport. I liked that they placed our bags in a secured area off the lobby and asked us to go in with them to point out our luggage, insuring everything we stored came out. We enjoyed our short stay here and are pleased with the level of accommodations, location and service we received. There may be nicer, more luxurious properties and expensive properties to stay at in San Francisco, but we are comfortable with the Grand Hyatt and intend to return on our next visit.

Reviews.Title: “Incompetent to the level of idiocy”
Reviews.Author: sandwmn
Reviews.Content: Made reservations for two rooms for two couples a month in advance using a coupon that included a discounted price of $150 and free breakfast. Recieved perfect e-confirmation of reservation. Arrived first and front desk was unable to find the reservation and did not want to honor coupon. Front desk even suggested that I go somewhere??? and print out my confirmation, even though I had the confirmaiton number!!!, and come back. Finally remade the reservation for both rooms and the front desk agreed to honor the coupon. Went up to room: shower head broken, light bulb burned out, coffee maker broken. These things were fixed the next day. When our friends arrived the front desk could again not find the reservation and hassled them out of the coupon for a room. After three days we left, checking over the bill we were charged for beer we never drank out of the room bar, a movie we never watched, and the breakfast that was supposed to be included. My boyfriend paid a corrected bill. Our friends paid for their room. A week later I saw a $300 charge on my credit card and called the Grand. Apparently I was charged for no-showing on the original reservation!!!! Incredible as it sounds, it took me two weeks and three phone calls to fix. Ughhhhh!

Reviews.Title: “Grand as it spells”
Reviews.Author: meeravelury
Reviews.Content: I was there to attend a red carpet event. The BAFTA awards!! Well this place was real grand and luxurious!

Reviews.Title: “Decent, pretty typical fare for a business hotel.”
Reviews.Author: sterlow
Reviews.Content: I had a good time at this hotel, with only one complaint, the noise! The rooms are very clean, the beds are incredibly comfortable, and the staff are truly friendly. My only compaint was noise coming from a party of drunken/high guests in the next room. The staff was very accomodating of my concerns, and I would be happy to stay here in the future. Also, this hotel is very expensive for the quality, if you purchase your room at the published price. Check around the discount sites, and you should be able to find it at a much lower rate. ** Be Sure to Check Out the Bar on the Top Floor, Great View of the Bay! **

Reviews.Title: “Absolute treasure”
Reviews.Author: SukiD
Reviews.Content: Loved it. Were treated like royalty the entire time. Hotel is in perfect location. Customer service is A+. Check out hotel on the top floor. Amazing view of the city and harbor including Alcatraz. Pillows and bed are incredibly comfy- hard to get out of bed! Try the room service..amazing. Nothing but great things to say about this place. Luxury, luxury, luxury.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, but I expected more from a Hyatt”
Reviews.Author: CaitlinK
Reviews.Content: This is a very good location near Union Square. As a Hyatt Diamond, I was given some nice amenities promptly after check-in. Our room was very small, but that's what I'd expect in a SF hotel. The view was amazing, it was a beautiful view of Union Square and the big Christmas tree there. The lounge upstairs was always very crowded, and it was hard to even find a seat. The selection of snacks and drinks was pretty good, though. The view from the lounge was also very nice. For the price of the hotel, I thought it was only an average value. I will want to try a different hotel for my next visit to SF, but I would not be opposed to staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “The only place we'll stay in SF from now on.”
Reviews.Author: USCMommy
Reviews.Content: We just got back from a three-day weekend trip to the Grand Hyatt San Francisco, and this was the best hotel experience we've had in quite some time. The room was comfortable, the location unbeatable, and the staff incredible. We arrived early on Saturday; I'd requested early check-in, but knew that showing up at 9:30am was really pushing it. However, it was no problem at all; we were checked in right away, with the requested view. The room was on the smaller side, and the two armchairs felt unnecessary and cramped, but it was nothing a little reorgnaizing couldn't fix. Grandviews restuarant for breakfast and take-out for lunch was excellent. Very good food for a reasonable price, and top-notch service. The bellmen staff were always attentive and friendly. We got a great deal directly through the Hyatt site, and I would certainly recommend this hotel as a great place for a couple on a weekend away; location is really great and within a five or ten-minute walk of great shopping and delicious restaurants. We were with our young son, and it was also perfect for a young family. He had the time of his life, as did we, and we can't wait to return!

Reviews.Title: “Stay away”
Reviews.Author: DineFrequently
Reviews.Content: This hotel is exhausted. The rooms are dirty, everyhting is old and is desperately in need of an extensive upgrade. Only the Concierge was good.

Reviews.Title: “It is not criticism”
Reviews.Author: ChristopheRL75
Reviews.Content: Grand Hyatt San Francisco, a hotel in the hearth of San Francisco, very close to China Town, no need to have a car, perfect conexions with local public traffic. If you like to go to Napa Valley then you need a car or a tour.

Reviews.Title: “Modern and Chic w/ awesome location”
Reviews.Author: enbamba
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at the Grand Hyatt Several times since I get a special nightly rate there because of my job. I choose this hotel most of the time because of its location. It's located right on Union Square, across the street from Niketown. There's also a Starbucks across the street and Macy's and all the fashionable upscale stores (Tiffany's, LV, Gucci, etc...) are within 5-10 minute walking distance. Most importantly, there are tons of restaurants in this part of town. The Grand Hyatt is about a 10-15 cab ride to Fisherman's Wharf. As far as the room, the beds were comofortable and I had a very good night's sleep. The room was very clean and did not notice anything out of the ordinary. Like any upscale hotel, they overcharge with the items in the mini-bar. Peoples main complaint is the parking, which is $50 per night, valet only. Unfortunately, parking is expensive for ALL hotels in SF not just the Hyatt. If you want to save money, I suggest parking down the street at a parking garage for about $25 per night. I was fortunate to find street parking, since the meters are not running on the weekends. Lastly, I recommend checking out the bar at the top floor of the hyatt. You have an incredible view of San Francisco, and you jaw will drop because of this view while you're having a martini.

Reviews.Title: “Grand view and good location but pedestrian experience otherwise”
Reviews.Author: dvg_loves_cali
Reviews.Content: I traveled to SF to see the renovated California Academy of Sciences. I used to live in the Bay Area, so when I visit SF I tend to have a singular purpose. I don't spend a lot of time wandering the streets like a tourist, although I still like to window shop. This hotel is in a nice location near a lot of good shopping and convenient to BART and the cable car. My room had an excellent view of the Bay, Coit Tower, the Bay Bridge, and the TransAmerica Building. It was a picture postcard view and was the highlight of my stay. Otherwise, the room was rather small and uninspired. The bathroom could use a remodel. The clock radio did not work, which was annoying to us both because we wanted to hear music and because we wanted the alarm. The hotel lacked charm and glamour. At this price point you might not be able to do too much better, but if you can spend a little more you can get more elsewhere. Be warned that parking here may set you back as almost much as the room itself. It cost me $50 to park each night and after factoring in taxes my $120 room became a $200 room and that was without room service. For $200 I would stay elsewhere, but if you are a tourist without a car it's not a bad deal. We walked over to the Four Seasons for breakfast just to see what that was like and we weren't impressed, but I'm sure it was better than Hyatt's overpriced offerings. I had an excellent experience in the past with the concierge at this hotel and I want to remark that the front desk staff did a good job on this visit. They allowed me to check-in very early (and very efficiently). The valets took some time to retrieve my car and my experience with them was spotty. Overall, it was an acceptable stay but I felt it was not a great value. If not for the superb view I would have been miffed.

Reviews.Title: “Needs a Revamp”
Reviews.Author: OnTheRoadElla
Reviews.Content: I really wanted to love the Grand Hyatt in San Francisco. The location is fantastic. The staff was so friendly, helpful and welcoming. The city view from our room was lovely. But the rooms...ugh. Really tired and shabby. There were weird stains on the lampshades, holes in the curtains, scuffs all over the walls. The room was comfortable, just really rough around the edges and worn out. Also, when we checked out there were a lot of people waiting for their cars outside and we were told it would take up to 1/2 hour to get our car from the valet. It didn't actually end up taking quite that long for us, but there were others still standing there who'd been waiting before we were. Considering there is a huge parking garage (much cheaper) at the corner of Stockton and Sutter, we could have parked the car ourselves and walk across the street. I would only consider staying here again if the hotel undergoes a renovation. There are way too many other great places to stay in the city for this price.

Reviews.Title: “There is nothing grand about this Grand Hyatt”
Reviews.Author: aaflyer3M
Reviews.Content: As a Hyatt Platinum member I stay at many Hyatt properties (as well as many other hotels). This was my first visit to this property - and likely my last. After a delayed check-in, seemingly caused by not enough desk personnel, I got to my room. The carpet was worn (poorly repaired) and soiled. The furnishing were very worn - and clearly not up to Hyatt standards. When I shared my complaint the hotel staff that responded were concerned and seemed to understand the problem. I was told that there would be a complete renovation of the hotel in the next six months. So, check if you're considering this property to see if the renovations have been completed. If not, stay elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient, very nice hotel with tremendous views”
Reviews.Author: Unbiased&FairAdvisor
Reviews.Content: First timer at GRAND HYATT, and it was a very nice stay. Arrived when there were multiple conferences/conventions going on with most everyone of them already checked-in ... so expecting the worst of rooms. Had requested a high floor room, and the super nice front desk (Wayne?!) did some searching, and was able to find one. Nice ! Here are my assessments: LOCATION: Right on Union Square shopping. Shopper's heaven! Very close to Chinatown, restaurants, and cable car stops. Reasonable reach for everything else.
